name: Aruba
notes_H1: "ORANJESTAD – In connection with the COVID-19 pandemic, the Department of Public Health launched its website www.arubacovid19.org. The website provides: Information on the latest developments on the COVID-19; Decisions and instructions by the government to contain the spread of the virus and to flatten the curve; Ads and video’s on precautionary measures you can take to protect yourself and others against the coronavirus". Retrieved from: /web/20200406202057/https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/department-of-public-health-launched-its-website-for-coronavirus-updates_48638.html
notes_H3: Contact tracing was noted a few times in the daily update.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200521213219/https://www.visitaruba.com/news/general/corona-virus-and-travel-to-aruba/
notes_C7: No data found
notes_C1: Opening up preconditions educational institutions with regard to preventive measures COVID-19.   Definitely Target group: Demarcated educational institutions: nursery, primary and secondary schools, secondary vocational education, universities, special education institutions that  provide classroom education. Other educational institutions, including crèches,  pre- and after-school care, homes and other special education institutions  (Pasadia Bibito Pin, Pasadia Briyo di Solo y Centro Man na Obra from Foundation before  Mentally Handicapped Aruba (SVGA)) are outside the scope of this document.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214112702/https://8f39937c-2835-4a9d-b0e9-4a8971f34620.filesusr.com/ugd/1a09f9_3681d33b16ce4da3b97cdc3877b21349.pdf
notes_H6: https://web.archive.org/web/20201214113655/https://www.arubacovid19.org/ddg
notes_E2: No evidence found of measures in place to freeze financial obligations.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210114030731/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#A
notes_E1: I cannot find evidence that the programs in place were extended beyond 01 Jan 2021.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210114030613/https://www.svbaruba.org/covid-19/   https://web.archive.org/web/20210114030731/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#A
notes_C3: From 07 Jan 2021 to 31 Jan 2021, "No activity permits will be granted until January 31 2021".     https://archive.is/dqTZz
notes_C6: "Authorities in Aruba have extended the existing 2300-0500 curfew until Jan. 31 as part of ongoing efforts to curb the spread of coronavirus disease (COVID-19). Officials have also tightened some restrictions on public gatherings, and most other pandemic-related operating requirements will remain in place. The following revised measures are in place:"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210125124535/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/426946/aruba-authorities-extend-covid-19-related-curfew-until-the-end-of-january-update-21
notes_C8: As of 25th of January the border with Brazil is closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210209002512/https://www.government.aw/news/news_47033/item/aruba-closes-its-borders-with-brazil_55688.html
notes_C2: As of Feb 5 bars and rum shops are closed  "The Aruba government has also implemented additional island-wide measures to further maintain the health and safety of visitors.     Curfew in effect extended until further notice:  Curfew starting at 12:00am until 5:00am   All establishments are required to close by 11:00pm at the latest. This is not applicable to establishments on hotel properties but is applicable to hotel casinos. Please check with your specific hotel for more information on closing times.    Prohibition of public gatherings: Between 7pm and 5am it is not allowed to gather in public spaces such as parking lots and on beaches. A maximum of 4 persons can be together.    Tables at restaurants can have a maximum of 4 seats inside or 6 seats outside (excluding children under the age of 12). Tables must be at least 1.5 meters apart.     All bars, rum shops, and nightclubs are closed until further notice. Restaurant bars can serve at tables only. There will be no bar stools and no standing at bars.    Hotel bars can serve at the bar only to registered hotel guests.    Musical entertainment and dancing at restaurants etc.: Only 1 musician allowed. No dancing allowed.   Yachts/boats: No more than 4 persons at one time on board. This is not applicable to commercial vessels such as charter boats/catamarans which are allowed to operate at a maximum of 50% of capacity.    Sports: contact sports not allowed; other sports allowed with a limit of 25 persons outside or 10 persons inside. No spectator public allowed.  For any social / family gatherings, the maximum number of persons allowed are 10 (inside) and 25 (outside). No dancing allowed, all rules must be adhered to for social distancing and mask-wearing.    In shops/supermarkets the maximum allowed is 1 person per family, all rules must be adhered to for social distancing and mask-wearing. Compulsory to wear a mask also outside if social distancing of at least 1.5m is not possible."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210209002737/https://www.visitaruba.com/traveling-to-aruba/entry-requirements-and-visas/aruba-travel-restrictions-covid-19/
notes_C4: "No more than four people should be together at a time in public (up from two)."  "Indoor home gatherings are limited to 10 people, while outdoor gatherings are limited to 25 people."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210218135722/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/440471/aruba-authorities-enforcing-a-slightly-relaxed-covid-19-related-0001-0500-curfew-as-of-feb-9-update-22
notes_H7: A, C  "From the beginning of the vaccination program on February 17, 2021, until February 24, 2021, 18822 people registered for the vaccine which includes 8022 seniors over 60 years of age.   So far, 2935 vaccinations have been administered which can be split into 1115 healthcare providers and 1820 citizens older than 60 years old. The vaccination of the seniors continues as they are at higher risks of developing severe complications and even die"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210301223938/https://www.government.aw/news/news_47033/item/aruba-is-vaccinating_55951.html

name: Afghanistan
notes_H1: While journals like Lancet and official embassy websites of US and UK provide updated information on COVID-19 situation in Afghanistan, there seems to be no coordinated initiative by the Afghan government.
notes_H3: Unclear if there is any active contact tracing happening in country.
notes_H2: There is currently no policy on "who can get tested". A testing lab was established by FMIC: The testing laboratory is a sampling facility, meaning that samples will be received by MoPH, will be tested at FMIC and the results will be shared back with MoPH after processing. The laboratory will help process over 100 tests per day – during a period when Covid-19 positive cases are on the rise in Afghanistan. The testing lab was established away from the main facilities of the hospital so normal operations at the hospital could continue without Covid-19 restrictions.    See News Article, archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20200826130518/https://www.akdn.org/project/laboratory-services-accelerate-covid-19-testing-afghanistan
notes_C7: Lockdown measures are no longer enforced, provincial borders have opened again https://web.archive.org/web/20200904195409/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/sites/www.humanitarianresponse.info/files/documents/files/afghanistan_covid-19_access_impediment_report_01_jul_-_25_aug_2020.pdf
notes_C1: Afghanistan reopened schools at all levels on Saturday after health authorities claimed the country surmounted the first wave of the novel coronavirus outbreak.    Education Ministry spokeswoman Nooria Nuzhat announced that all public school students from grades 1 to 10 would again start going to their schools, where hygiene measures will be ensured to avoid contracting COVID-19.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201026120914/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/asia-pacific/covid-19-afghanistan-finally-reopens-all-schools/1994551
notes_H6: "Afghanistan on Monday made the use of face masks mandatory in public places across the country in a bid to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.  Speaking at a news conference in the capital Kabul, Ahmad Jawad Osmani, Afghanistan’s acting health minister, said the virus situation in the country is “satisfactory” compared to neighboring countries."
notes_E2: Since there are no new updates on this, this is coded to a 0 again (assuming this was a policy implemented in May only).
notes_C3: AW Updated: Press release on 15 August in Pashto from the Ministry of Public Health regarding the Ashura ceremony indicates that authorities are promoting social distancing precautions, along with "the provision of masks, spraying of antimicrobials in mosques", etc., while not cancelling the event.  As a major religious event, it is likely the government is no longer cancelling events, but recommending precautions, therefore coding a 0   http://archive.fo/wip/aSspx
notes_C6: Lockdown measures are no longer enforced, and people can go about their daily lives again https://web.archive.org/web/20200904195409/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/sites/www.humanitarianresponse.info/files/documents/files/afghanistan_covid-19_access_impediment_report_01_jul_-_25_aug_2020.pdf
notes_C8: According to the UK foreign office:    "Everyone arriving in Afghanistan needs to have their temperature checked at the airport. If your temperature is high, the government will advise you to quarantine and will offer you medical attention at two hospitals in Kabul."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201120094516/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/afghanistan/entry-requirements
notes_C2: No government mandated restrictions seem to be in place since lock down restrictions started easing in Afghanistan.    According to news reports (https://web.archive.org/web/20201108205026/https://apnews.com/article/399dd046ff9c9f5693210d60f58b55ab):     "Desperate for relief from endless war combined with the pandemic, Afghans are rushing back to public recreation as the government eases the lockdown it imposed to fight the coronavirus. Since mid-July, Afghans can once again frequent parks, swimming pools and gyms, shop in malls and celebrate marriages in wedding halls. Universities and private schools have reopened, and at government schools, the 11th and 12th grades have restarted.     Few wear masks or take other precaution — and authorities are left trying to remind the public of the danger of a second wave of the pandemic."
notes_C4: According to the IMF report, there are currently no restrictions on gatherings. See report, archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20200825172817/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C5: Lockdown measures are no longer enforced, hence public transport can also resume https://web.archive.org/web/20200904195409/https://www.humanitarianresponse.info/sites/www.humanitarianresponse.info/files/documents/files/afghanistan_covid-19_access_impediment_report_01_jul_-_25_aug_2020.pdf

name: Angola
notes_H1: Angola has set-up a central COVID platform with current legal information about what is allowed, as well as statistics and new developments...    source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200715000000*/https://www.covid19.gov.ao/
notes_H2: Government is testing those with suspected symptoms:  "COVID diagnosis test are reserved for suspected cases, i.e people with symptoms or anyone in contact with positive cases."    Outside of governmental tests, private tests are available:      source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200715000000*/https://www.covid19.gov.ao/perguntas-respostas.php
notes_C7: For boarding on domestic flights, it is compulsory to serological test presentation with negative result, carried out in the 72 hours preceding the journey, no authorisation being required    "1. It is recommended that all citizens refrain from circulating on public and similar spaces and roads, and who remain at their homes, except for necessary and unavoidable journeys.    2. Abstaining from movement is particularly recommended or stay on the public highway from 10 pm to 5 am."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202150415/https://governo.gov.ao/fotos/frontend_1/gov_documentos/2020_dri_169__medidas_excepcionais_e_temporarias_3742179835f96a3aa662f8.pdf  (Official decrete regarding Covid-19 restrictions)
notes_C1: Primary schools have now re-opened since 10 February 2012. Universities and secondary level school were already allowed to hold in-person classes. Only missing are preschools (children age 3-6) which are scheduled to open March 3rd.    Strong restrictions are in place for in-person classes, including social distancing, hand-washing, etc...     sources: http://archive.today/2021.02.16-144244/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://archive.today/2021.02.16-144845/https://jornalnorthnews.com/noticia/409/alunos-do-ensino-primario-voltam-as-aulas-na-angola  http://archive.today/2021.02.16-145224/https://governo.gov.ao/ao/noticias/medidas-a-vigorar-ate-11-de-marco/
notes_H6: "Without prejudice to the provisions of this Order at specific areas, the correct use of masking is mandatory in closed public access spaces, in public transport, in educational establishments, in the street and market sales."    "The use of a face mask in vehicles is compulsory.of school transport by all users, regardless of age"    "It is not compulsory to engage in sporting activities with the use of a face mask."
notes_E2: No statement of national debt relief to be found
notes_E1: Cannot find any evidence of further income support beyond last update.
notes_C3: Religious activities are limited to four days a week with no more than 50 percent capacity or 150 people and are limited to a maximum duration of 2 hours if held in enclosed spaces.  Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210307205259/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: According to the US embassy website, there is no curfew in place. Also domestic flights between Luanda and the remainder of the country’s provinces resumed on September 14, 2020.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200927024309/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Policy: There is a two pronged approach here. International travel from certain countries are banned. These countries are the following: South Africa, Australia, Nigeria, United Kingdom, Portugal, and Brazil. Otherwise, "limited international travel is permitted for only citizens or residents of the country, humanitarian transport, medical emergencies, and diplomatic missions. Persons entering the country require a negative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) COVID-19 test taken no more than 72 hours before arrival. Travelers must also undergo a rapid COVID-19 test immediately on disembarking the plane. Travelers who test negative may continue; however, positive travelers will be quarantined at a government facility."  Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210307205259/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210307211436/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/435351/angola-authorities-amend-covid-19-measures-as-of-jan-27-update-17
notes_C2: Overall, sectors are open with limited capacity and some hourly restrictions.    This summarises the situation quite well: Health centers and hospitals are fully operational.  Restaurants are open from 6a.m. to 9p.m. for table service, and from 6a.m. to 10p.m. for takeout.? In person dining is limited to 50 percent capacity with no more than four guests per table.? Stores, including supermarkets, can remain open until 10p.m.? Museums and monuments, movie theaters, cultural and art fairs, libraries, and media centers are open but limited to 50 percent capacity.? Religious activities are limited to four days a week with no more than 50 percent capacity or 150 people and are limited to a maximum duration of 2 hours if held in enclosed spaces.    sources: http://archive.today/2021.02.16-144244/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://archive.today/2021.02.16-145224/https://governo.gov.ao/ao/noticias/medidas-a-vigorar-ate-11-de-marco/
notes_C4: "Gatherings are cancelled in public or private spaces", with the exception of religious activities, exercising and sporting events.    sources: http://archive.today/2021.02.16-145224/https://governo.gov.ao/ao/noticias/medidas-a-vigorar-ate-11-de-marco/  http://archive.today/2021.02.16-144244/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Angola received it's first batch of vaccines from COVAX on the 4th of March and has already jabbed 90 plus people. It's stated priority groups are as follows: health professionals, teachers, defense and security forces, and people with comorbidities. I've coded all of these individuals as three groups: the healthcare force, the "essential" workforce meaning teachers, defense services, and thirdly, those with co-morbidities.    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210307204010/https://governo.gov.ao/ao/noticias/vacinados-primeiros-cidadaos-contra-covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210307204352/https://governo.gov.ao/ao/noticias/angola-preve-imunizar-mais-de-16-milhoes-de-pessoas/
notes_C5: Public transportation is limited to 50 percent capacity and is only available until 6p.m  https://web.archive.org/web/20200810203539/https://ao.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Albania
notes_H1: First official government communications aimed at raising awareness among the wider public dated 10 March 2020 Source: Institute of Public Health of Albania  https://web.archive.org/web/20200529111706/http://www.ishp.gov.al/?s=koronavirusi&paged=18
notes_H3: Appears to have a comprehensive mechanism in place.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210103165123/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/albania/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.5+Testing&Type=Chapter
notes_H2: 'Currently, in order to be tested for COVID-19 one must have symptoms.'      http://web.archive.org/web/20201108140404/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_C7: No evidence of a policy change, no restrictions on internal movement or interstate travel.  source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102231838/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_C1: Schools are open on a rotation system providing three days of tuition to one group, and two days of tuition to another group. Universities have postponed reopening.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210111235448/https://a2news.com/2021/01/11/universitetet-ende-mbyllur-zhapaj-vendim-politik-ne-rmv-studentet-jane-ne-auditore/
notes_H6: Starting October 15, wearing a mask in all indoor and outdoor areas is mandatory for any individual 11 years old and above. Non-compliance with this rule may result in a fine up to 3,000 ALL.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201108140404/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_E2: The government has also adopted tax deferral measures allowing all large companies (except banks, telecommunication, public enterprises and other essential businesses) to defer payment of profit tax for the second and third quarter of 2020 in 2021. Tourism, active processing and call centers can defer payments for the rest of 2020 to 2021. Small businesses with turnover below Lk14m will not pay profit tax for the remainder of 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210130223812/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: Support to salaries and firm liquidity: USD 100 million, through the instrument of a sovereign  guarantee, was allocated to companies that have difficulties in paying employee salaries. The  government will support businesses who stopped working due to the COVID-19 pandemic with a  benefit of not more than USD 14 000 by paying their employees the minimum wage, ALL 26 000.  The self-employed will also receive the same amount.    Median monthly salary in Albania is ALL 92, 300; Average salary as of Q4 2019 is ALL 53458 (http://web.archive.org/web/20201108183838/http://www.salaryexplorer.com/salary-survey.php?loc=3&loctype=1 ; https://web.archive.org/web/20200604191537/http://www.instat.gov.al/en/themes/labour-market-and-education/wages/publications/2019/wage-statistics-q4-2019/)    Coding All workers because of the point around 'self-employed'    https://web.archive.org/web/20200604183631/https://www.oecd.org/south-east-europe/COVID-19-Crisis-in-Albania.pdf
notes_C3: On 8 March, the Albanian Council of Ministers stopped all flights and ferries with quarantined areas of northern Italy until 3 April, halted all schools for two weeks, ordered cancellation of all large public gatherings, and asked sports federations to cancel scheduled matches.  Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528143137/https://tvklan.al/ndalohen-fluturimet-me-10-destinacione-drejt-italise/ https://web.archive.org/web/20200528143219/https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-health-coronavirus-albania/albania-halts-schools-italy-flights-ferries-over-coronavirus-idUKKBN20W01E?il=0
notes_C6: Public movement is restricted during the hours between 10:00pm and 6:00am; except for work reasons, health care emergencies, or urgent needs. e-Albania portal must be used for special permission to move during this time.  https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/ (Wayback Machine giving errors when saving)
notes_C8: As of December 21, the Albanian government banned all flights to and from England until January 6, 2021.   source:  https://archive.vn/fuCc5
notes_C2: Order no. 680- For closing bars, restaurants, fast food and restaurants  In the order no. 615, dated 9.11.2020, "On the closure of bars, restaurants, fast food and bars", as amended, the following change is made:  1. Item 1 3 The order is reworded as follows:  "Limiting the activity of bars, restaurants, fast food, bars that provide service to customers throughout the country, from 20:30 to 06:00 starting from 24.12.2020 until 04.01.2021."  This order enters into force immediately and takes effect on 24.12.2020. After the date 04.01.2021 the restriction of the activity of bars, restaurants, fast food, premises that provide service to customers throughout the country will be in the time range from 22:00 to 06:00 until a second order    https://web.archive.org/web/20210123122535/https://new.shendetesia.gov.al/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Urdher-Nr.680-1.pdf
notes_C4: Gatherings are restricted to no more than 2 citizens - see: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427212500/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/
notes_H7: A:    Vaccination begins in Albania for frontline medical workers and personnel.    The Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine is being used.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118105529/https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/health/albania-carries-out-1st-vaccinations-with-donated-doses/
notes_C5: "Public transport and taxis are operating as normal." It no longer appears that the government is recommending any closure of public transport. Masks are required.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200817080741/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200817080250/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/albania/staying-during-coronavirus

name: Andorra
notes_H1: The government's  website has regular updates. They also have a Twitter account with regular updates. As well as a Facebook account. Cannot find information about traditional media.    https://archive.vn/Z1BuN  https://archive.vn/Zp9l5
notes_H3: The portfolio holder recalled that the country's strategy is rapid screening - anyone suspected of having been in contact with the disease can ask for a diagnostic test on 821955 - and tracking. In this regard, he confirmed that about 300 diagnostic tests are currently being performed daily and the number of available trackers continues to increase and now exceeds one hundred.  https://web.archive.org/20200729111541/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11752-salut-realitza-300-proves-diagnostiques-diaries-per-cribrar-positius-per-la-covid-19
notes_H2: In addition to the diagnostic tests performed in labs, citizens can be tested for antigens in private pharmacies and laboratories. In this case, "the tests check if you are infected at that precise moment and have a shorter validity than the lab test, of one or two days" according to the Minister of Health. The advantage is that the result is known in a few minutes.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201124035502/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/12098-la-pressio-al-sistema-sanitari-baixa-arran-del-seguiment-per-part-de-la-ciutadania-de-les-mesures-decretades
notes_C1: Schools are fully open.   https://archive.vn/5jXic  With various safety measures in place.  https://archive.vn/iOrmB
notes_H6: In Andorra, everyone over the age of eight must wear a mask and follow the restrictions in place to prevent infection.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222015447/https://www.govern.ad/covid19_newsletter/en/
notes_E2: Under certain conditions and if eligible, people can request:  - 20% reduction in the amount of rent of their home   - grant of the instalments corresponding to the mortgage or personal loans or an extension of the term repayment of these loans in order to finance the acquisition of their home or the acquisition of their own vehicle.  - 100% reduction in rent for commercial activities that are suspended   - 80-100% discount in electricity bills  See "MESURES ECONÒMIQUES I SOCIALS EXCEPCIONALS I URGENTS PER  PAL·LIAR LA CRISI PROVOCADAPER L’EMERGÈNCIA SANITÀRIA". Pages 10, 11 and 13.  https://www.govern.ad/mesures-economiques-laborals-i-socials/assalariats  (Apologies, the website cannot be archived)
notes_E1: Government has a comprehensive policy for the broad protection of income through employment regulations, unemployment and social security during the pandemic. "(i) Half of these hours will be paid by the company as paid leaves. (ii) The other half will be paid as well, but the worker will have to offset them as it is indicated below:  (a) With extra hours and days-off during the working year. In this case, the consent of the worker is not necessary. (b) With extra hours and days-off from the working year, within 3 months from the first day of the next month when the suspension is over. In this case, the consent of the worker is necessary; and (c) With a maximum of 50%of holidays generated during the current year."  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.caseslacambra.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/CL-Monographic-Act-of-exceptional-and-urgent-measures_Covid-19.pdf
notes_C3: On September 18, "The Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has presented the Decree approved today by the Government in relation to the health emergency situation due to the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus and which will enter into force on Monday 21 September. Martínez Benazet has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people, given the importance of reducing social interaction and not leaving cohabiting nuclei. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200927103231/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11886-les-autoritats-sanitaries-demanen-reduir-la-interaccio-social (official press release)
notes_C6: Previously coded as 1G on 7th July, due to restrictions around the elderly:  Restrictions on elderly and nursing homes: "the departures of residents are restricted to once a week, which must be done with a single family member and with a maximum duration of two hours. During these outings it will not be possible to have a meal outside or to go to spaces with a high concurrence of people. Visits by relatives to users of assisted living facilities are permitted in accordance with exceptional measures." https://web.archive.org/web/20200716090024/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11716-el-govern-decreta-l-us-obligatori-de-mascaretes-com-a-mesura-preventiva-davant-la-covid-19    Moving this elderly related restriction to H8.     Cannot find information that recommends for people to stay at home after 7th July (previous coding date) nor have there been any curfews, so changing to 0.
notes_C8: Before you travel, get tested with a viral test 1–3 days before your trip. After you travel, get tested 3–5 days after travel AND stay home to self-quarantine for 7 days after travel. If you don't get tested, it's safest to stay home to self-quarantine for 10 days.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210122004810/https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices/covid-4/coronavirus-andorra
notes_C2: On 20 April the government will begin a pilot test of "phase 1" of their exit strategy, which involves re-opening some non-essential sectors such as real estate and textile making.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200427174636/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11440-el-govern-preveu-una-represa-progressiva-de-l-activitat-amb-una-primera-fase-que-incloura-aquells-sectors-que-facilitin-el-confinament-i-la-venda-en-linia
notes_C4: "On September 18, "The Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has presented the Decree approved today by the Government in relation to the health emergency situation due to the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus and which will enter into force on Monday 21 September. Martínez Benazet has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people, given the importance of reducing social interaction and not leaving cohabiting nuclei. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200927103231/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/11886-les-autoritats-sanitaries-demanen-reduir-la-interaccio-social (official press release)
notes_H7: A, B, C: Upon the arrival of 3,000 doses of the Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine from France, Andorra began Phase II of vaccinations. Key workers, clinically vulnerable groups, and elderly groups (people 70 or older) will be able to receive the vaccine. (see second link for definition of Phase II)    The government is additionally calling on citizens who wish to receive the vaccine to register online.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210305161428/https://www.govern.ad/comunicats/item/12496-el-govern-presenta-l-operatiu-de-vacunacio-a-la-placa-de-braus    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315140656/https://www.bopa.ad/bopa/033018/Pagines/GD20210205_13_23_21.aspx
notes_C5: public transport is operating at a reduced capacity ie. 33% capacity and also with a reduction in regular hours. https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.govern.ad/preguntes-coronavirus

name: United Arab Emirates
notes_H1: the UAE launches a website dedicated to awareness of the COVID-19 crisis  http://archive.fo/9oRXW
notes_H3: When did the UAE start contact tracing Covid-19 cases?  Since the very first four cases of coronavirus were detected in the Emirates in late January.  - exact date unknown therefore, coded as 1st February  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430175534/https://www.thenational.ae/uae/health/coronavirus-the-contact-tracing-method-explained-1.1004887
notes_H2: Initially, you had to have symptoms and a travel history to be tested (https://gulfnews.com/uae/health/when-and-where-to-take-a-coronavirus-test-in-the-uae-1.70405120) and this is still stated as conditions on the Ministry of Health's website: https://www.mohap.gov.ae/en/AwarenessCenter/Pages/COVID-19.aspx. However, recently the UAE has been opening up a lot of drive through test centers and while priority is still given to certain segments, it seems the general public is now able to get tested by booking through an app or calling a hotline: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.thenational.ae/uae/health/coronavirus-how-to-get-tested-in-the-uae-and-how-much-does-it-cost-1.1006284
notes_C7: There are strict rules for travelling into Abu Dhabi by road. All passengers entering Abu Dhabi must have a negative COVID-19 PCR test result issued within 48 hours. You may have to quarantine depending on how long you have been in the UAE.  /web/20210126002156/https://www.emirates.com/english/help/covid-19/dubai-travel-requirements/tourists/
notes_C1: In the emirate of Abu Dhabi, students are allowed to return to school to school from the 14th of February with the option of remote learning for parents who do not want to sent their children to school.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210214192825/https://www.arabianbusiness.com/education/458187-abu-dhabi-to-reopen-schools-on-february-14-after-approving-preventative-protocol
notes_H6: During the COVID-19 pandemic, wearing masks in the UAE is mandatory for all in public places, public transportation or commercial centers, when walking outside in high-density public areas and in private transportation. However, on 31 May 2020, Dubai Government issued new guidelines under which certain people under certain situations would be exempted from wearing a mask even in public areas.       Individuals who have been exempted from wearing a face mask  The individuals have been exempted from wearing a face mask in public are:  children under six years of age  people of determination - those with cognitive, intellectual or sensory disorders or any impairments that prevent their ability to breathe or communicate, normally  those for whom masks can lead to sensory triggering (a medical report is needed to confirm the condition)  the individuals who require supplemental oxygen or have severe respiratory issues or have difficulty breathing with a mask (medical report is needed to confirm the condition).       Conditions under which masks can be removed  Masks can be removed under the following situations:  when driving alone, or with your family members  while eating or drinking in indoor and outdoor settings, that is at restaurants  when engaging in strenuous indoor and outdoor physical exercise  while being alone in a certain setting, like your office and no one is around  while undergoing specific treatments such as dental work, eyes, nose and throat examinations, and other treatments related to hair and beauty.     However, physical distancing must be observed at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207160732/https://u.ae/en/information-and-services/justice-safety-and-the-law/handling-the-covid-19-outbreak/tips-to-stay-safe-from-covid-19
notes_E2: Under directive from Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, banks have come together to offer relief to consumers. Among the relief offered:   • Retail loan customers placed on unpaid leave can ask their bank for a repayment holiday of up to three months with zero interest and fees.  • Customers with personal loans, car loans or mortgages can apply for a one-month repayment holiday with zero fees.  (https://web.archive.org/web/20200502084637/https://www.thenational.ae/business/money/how-your-bank-will-help-if-you-are-affected-by-covid-19-1.997187)
notes_C3: Beginning on February 2, "The Dubai Tourism has suspended all the entertainment permits issued in the emirate. This came after the authority detected more than 200 violations of safety guidelines and closed down around 20 establishments in three weeks."     https://web.archive.org/web/20210208140628/https://www.khaleejtimes.com/coronavirus-pandemic/dubai-covid-19-full-list-of-new-rules-for-travel-malls-hospitals
notes_C6: UAE announced it would shorten the night time curfew bye two hours.  https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-emirates/uae-to-shorten-covid-19-prevention-curfew-by-two-hours-idUSKBN23524U
notes_C8: No change in policy, arrivals into Abu Dhabi must still quarantine   http://archive.today/pwdFv
notes_C2: Dubai has banned live entertainment "as of Thursday, January 21, 2021, until further notice." "Dubai’s Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (DTCM) on Thursday issued a circular that put all entertainment activities — like live DJ, live band, live dancing and quiz nights — on hold until further notice."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210208155208/https://www.khaleejtimes.com/coronavirus-pandemic/covid-19-dubai-entertainment-ban-may-affect-business-but-its-the-right-moversquo
notes_C4: On 7th of Feb, imposed restriction on gatherings:" Gatherings and parties will be strictly prohibited in the capital city, and movie theaters will be closed. A maximum of 10 people will be allowed to attend marriage ceremonies and family gatherings, the circular said"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210214202717/https://english.alarabiya.net/coronavirus/2021/02/07/Abu-Dhabi-bans-gatherings-limits-capacity-in-malls-beaches-restaurants
notes_H7: Starting February 7, a nationwide decision by the Ministry of Health, which said all vaccine centres were now dedicated "only to the elderly and people with chronic diseases, in the light of the spike in infections over the past weeks...But people who have not yet had their first dose are expected to wait until next month. Walk-in services will end and younger people will be seen by appointment only."   "Four vaccines are available in the UAE. The Sinopharm and Sputnik V drugs are available across the UAE, although the latter is only for emergency use.  Pfizer-BioNTech and Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccines are available in Dubai. Currently, specific priority groups are being vaccinated in Dubai, with plans for a wider programme later in the year."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207152420/https://www.thenationalnews.com/uae/health/abu-dhabi-limits-vaccines-to-elderly-and-disabled-for-next-six-weeks-1.1161411
notes_C5: No change.

name: Argentina
notes_H1: https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/tenemos-la-capacidad-de-reaccion-y-estamos-en-vigilancia-absoluta-ante-situacion-mundial-de
notes_H3: The sources cited (here and all the subsequent entries) suggest that contact tracing is being done for every confirmed case. So it can be considered as a comprehensive contact tracing. Applies to all the entries from 4 March till 12 April.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408152354/https://www.sadi.org.ar/boletines-y-reportes/item/913-actualizacion-epidemiologica-ministerio-de-salud-de-la-nacion
notes_H2: While Argentine government authorities may only test symptomatic patients, citizens may obtain COVID-19 tests at many private labs (diagnósticos/laboratorios). Appointments are generally required, citizens must pay for the cost of their own test.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201009214732/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/
notes_C7: From October 25 to November 8, some provinces will be under ASPO (Aislamiento social, preventivo y obligatorio = Social, Preventive and Compulsory Isolation) and some others will be under DISPO (Distanciamiento Social, Preventivo y Obligatorio = Social, preventive and mandatory distancing). Under DISPO, internal movement is allowed.    Provinces under ASPO: City of Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires, Chaco, Chubut, Córdoba, La Rioja, Mendoza, Neuquén, Río Negro, Salta, San Luis, Santa Cruz, Santa Fe, Santiago del Estero, Tierra del Fuego and Tucumán.    Provinces under DISPO: Misiones, Corrientes, Formosa, Entre Ríos, Catamarca, Jujuy, La Pampa and San Juan.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201028220922/https://argentina.as.com/argentina/2020/10/25/actualidad/1603627708_473148.html
notes_C1: Schools in certain areas are still closed for now, such as within Catamarca and La Rioja, but they are gearing up for children to come back face to face safely for the 2021 school year.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/el-nuevo-calendario-2021-preve-como-ordenador-las-clases-presenciales-y-consolida-la
notes_H6: "Argentina made face masks obligatory for everyone using public transport and out in public on April 14."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200907231620/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/04/countries-wearing-face-masks-compulsory-200423094510867.html
notes_E2: "Electricity services, running water, gas through networks, fixed and mobile telephony and Internet and cable television may not be suspended for non-payment (up to 3 consecutive or alternate bills) for a period of 180 days."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208181021/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/economia/medidas-economicas-COVID19/corteservicios
notes_E1: 495/5000  The Family Emergency Income (IFE) is established for informal workers and monotributistas, between 18 and 65 years old, with the highest degree of vulnerability, who in mid-April will collect $ 10,000 one-time, although it could be repeated in May if circumstances so require. merit.    The IFE joins the package of measures already in place that reach formal workers in the critical, informal, monotributistas, retired, pensioners, allowance beneficiaries and companies sectors.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603182807/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/covid-19-el-gobierno-implementara-el-ingreso-familiar-de-emergencia-ife-para-aliviar-la
notes_C3: During the period of "social, preventive and compulsory isolation", no cultural, recreational, sporting, religious, or any other type of event involving the attendance of persons may take place. This period has been extended to the 12 of April.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200603183936/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/227042/20200320    'It will run from March 20 to 31'
notes_C6: 5th June    The Government of Argentina has announced that the national quarantine that began on March 20 has been extended through June 28, with greater restrictions in the greater Buenos Aires area under DNU 297/2020. President Alberto Fernández on Thursday night announced the extension of Argentina's mandatory lockdown in selected large cities, especially Buenos Aires and its surroundings, until June 28.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200611100938/https://www.batimes.com.ar/news/argentina/lockdown-extended-until-june-28-with-two-types-of-quarantine.phtml    Regional variations remain in place: “Considering that the epidemiological situation is not homogeneous within the national territory, the administration of isolation will adopt a modality that contemplates the reality of the various jurisdictions of the country.  Provincial and local authorities may request exceptions to isolation from personnel affected by certain activities and services” Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200620154857/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/228261/20200426    https://web.archive.org/web/20200622180219/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200614231327/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/medidas-gobierno
notes_C8: "Argentine authorities are implementing a “tourism pilot program” for citizens and residents of bordering countries traveling to the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area for tourism.  This program does not apply to the United States.  In addition to the sworn statement required of all passengers entering Argentina, persons entering under this pilot program must also present a negative COVID-19 PCR test within the 72 hours before travel and proof of medical insurance for COVID-19 that covers hospitalization or isolation for the duration of their stay in Argentina. Travelers under the program  must enter Argentina at Ministro Pistarini Ezeiza International Airport, San Fernando International Airport, or the Buquebus Ferry Terminal in Buenos Aires.  As Argentine authorities are still finalizing the details of this pilot program, persons who believe they meet its requirements should contact Argentine immigration directly."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116171330/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/
notes_C2: Gyms, discos and other non-essential workplaces are allowed to open in some provinces. A general lockdown is in place until October 25. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201020131736/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/alberto-fernandez-extendio-el-aislamiento-social-preventivo-y-obligatorio-hasta-el-25-de
notes_C4: Gatherings under 10 people are allowed in the provinces of La Pampa, Entre Ríos, San Juan, San Luis, Mendoza y Jujuy only. Gatherings are forbidden in the rest of the country. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201020131954/https://www.pagina12.com.ar/299764-dia-de-la-madre-en-que-provincias-estan-permitidas-las-reuni
notes_H7: AC:  "The Ministry of Health of the Nation reports that as of today the jurisdictions reported the application of 107,542 of the 300,000 doses distributed of the Sputnik V vaccine. In this first stage, the vaccine is intended for health personnel between 18 and 59 years of age, from intensive care units and microbiology laboratories of health institutions located in large urban agglomerates where the pandemic has had a greater impact."    "It should be noted that the vaccines are provided by the National State and the vaccination plan is carried out in stages, free of charge, voluntarily and regardless of the history of having suffered from coronavirus."    "Tomorrow (January 16, 2021) the 300,000 doses will arrive with the second component so that health personnel can complete the two-dose scheme," added the official who commented that the distribution operation throughout the country will be similar to the first time based on the joint with all jurisdictions."    "Said González García. And he added: 'This first stage we do the vaccination to protect those who have to take care of us, which are health workers, starting with the most exposed; but on Monday (February 22, 2021) they start with those over 70 years old and then we will reach everyone the entrerrianos, working together. '"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111182006/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-107542-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-covid-19-en-el-pais  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115190146/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-200759-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-la-covid-19-en-argentina  https://web.archive.org/web/20210218223803/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/gonzalez-garcia-superviso-el-plan-de-vacunacion-contra-la-covid-19-en-entre-rios
notes_C5: Still current

name: Australia
notes_H1: 25th January- Information at ports after first cases confirmed, but no national campaign as yet. Information is on display at all major international ports around Australia, with instructions on what to do if travellers have symptoms or if symptoms develop.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200413093831/https://www.health.gov.au/ministers/the-hon-greg-hunt-mp/media/first-confirmed-case-of-novel-coronavirus-in-australia
notes_H3: First case in Australia confirmed on 25 January 2020. Health Minister's announcement says contact tracing will be undertaken. https://web.archive.org/web/20200402211239/https://www.health.gov.au/ministers/the-hon-greg-hunt-mp/media/first-confirmed-case-of-novel-coronavirus-in-australia
notes_H2: Recommendation for testing if showing a symptom of coronavirus, or for other reasons such as working in a high-risk environment or if having received an organ transplant.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201106223200/https://www.health.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/2020/09/coronavirus-covid-19-guidance-for-people-tested-for-covid-19_0.pdf    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201117175657/https://www.health.gov.au/news/health-alerts/novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov-health-alert/what-you-need-to-know-about-coronavirus-covid-19
notes_C7: WA: A press release on the Western Australian Government COVID-19 website states that the "NSW will move from ‘low risk’ to ‘very low risk’ at 12.01am, on Tuesday, 16 February, pending no further outbreaks.  Under the ‘very low risk’ category, safe travel is permitted into WA subject to the following updated conditions:  completion of a G2G Pass declaration, stipulating they do not have any COVID-19 symptoms and which jurisdictions the traveller has been in over the previous 14 days;  all Perth Airport arrivals to undergo a health screening and temperature test;  travellers to be prepared to take a COVID-19 test at the airport COVID clinic, if deemed necessary by a health clinician (voluntary asymptomatic testing also available); and  land arrivals to be met at the border checkpoint, for a health screening and to have their G2G Pass declaration checked.  "  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222073452/https://www.wa.gov.au/government/announcements/return-pre-lockdown-life-1201am-sunday-14-february
notes_C1: A 17 February 2021 media release from the Victorian Government published on the Victorian State Government Health and Human Service website announced that "Restrictions under Victoria’s new circuit-breaker actions will end tonight. From 11:59pm 17 February 2021 Victoria returns to COVIDSafe Summer restrictions – with some revised conditions.... There will no longer be four reasons to leave home and the five-kilometre restriction will no longer apply. Schools, restaurants and retails can reopen and both public and private office workers can return up to 50 per cent on site."  Schools across VIC have reopened.  In VIC Students age 12 yrs and older must where a mask while indoors at school and it is strongly recommended outside. Staff are required to practice 1.5m distancing with other adults where ever possible.  Density limits of one person per two square metres apply to staff areas such as staff lunchrooms and areas accessed by the public, such as reception areas.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220060525/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202102/Stay%20Safe%20Directions%20(Victoria)%20(No%2015)%2017%20February%202021%20(signed).pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219220907/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/coronavirus-update-victoria-17-february-2021    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222013328if_/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/physical-distancing-health-and-hygiene    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222013320/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/face-masks-study-and-school
notes_H6: In an easing of restrictions the Victorian Stay Safe Directions (Victoria) (No 16) came into force at 11.59pm on 26 February 2021 and replace the Stay Safe Directions (Victoria) (No 15).  This directions remain in place as at 8th March 2021.   According to the VIC Govt. COVID-19 government website, directions require that:   “You must always carry a face mask with you at all times when you leave the home, unless you have a lawful reason not to.  Face masks must be worn:  on public transport, in commercial passenger vehicles such as taxis and ride share vehicles, and in tour vehicles  by visitors to a hospital  by visitors at a care facility (while indoors)  indoors at shopping centres, retail facilities with 2,000 or more square metres of indoor space, markets and market stalls  on flights to and from Victoria and  at airports  if you are diagnosed or suspected of having COVID-19, or a close contact of someone diagnosed with COVID-19, when leaving your home or accommodation for a permitted reason, such as medical care or to get tested  while awaiting the results of a COVID-19 test when leaving your home or accommodation for a permitted reason, such as medical care (except as part of a surveillance or other asymptomatic testing program)  while experiencing any symptoms of COVID-19.”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210224152432if_/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/face-masks-when-wear-face-mask  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308052911/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202102/Stay%20Safe%20Directions%20%28Victoria%29%20%28No%2016%29%20-%2026%20February%202021%20%28signed%29.pdf       Victoria currently has the highest level face mask regulations in Australia.   However, this item has been coded as a 2G because Victoria’s restrictions no longer meet criteria to be coded at the level of a 3 AND every state and territory requires that face masks are worn on airplanes and airports as a minimum.    New South Wales:   “On 12 February the Minister signed the Public Health (COVID-19 Mandatory Face Coverings) Amendment (No 4) Order 2021 (Amending Order).    The Amending Order amends the Public Health (COVID-19 Mandatory Face Coverings) Order 2021 to only require a mask to be worn:  on public transport (including taxis and ride share) and public transport waiting areas in Greater Sydney (including the Blue Mountains, Wollongong and the Central Coast)  at airports  on domestic commercial aircraft that land at, or take off from, a NSW airport while in NSW”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308053138/https://www.health.nsw.gov.au/Infectious/covid-19/Pages/public-health-orders.aspx     Queensland:   “To protect the health of Queenslanders, from 12am AEST 12 January 2021 wearing of a face mask will be mandatory in particular settings anywhere in Queensland… You must carry a face mask while in a Queensland airport and wear it at all times… You must wear a face mask at all times if you are on a domestic commercial flight while the plane is at a Queensland airport and in Queensland airspace… You must wear a face mask while transporting a person required to quarantine on a bus, coach service, taxi or ride-share to or from government hotels… If you are arriving to Queensland from overseas or a COVID-19 hotspot and you are required to quarantine, you must wear a face mask while travelling from the airport on a bus, coach service, taxi or ride-share to your quarantine hotel. You must wear the mask until you arrive at your allocated room in government arranged accommodation.”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308053358/https://www.qld.gov.au/health/conditions/health-alerts/coronavirus-covid-19/current-status/public-health-directions/mandatory-masks   https://web.archive.org/web/20210308053441/https://www.health.qld.gov.au/system-governance/legislation/cho-public-health-directions-under-expanded-public-health-act-powers/mandatory-masks     Western Australia:   “Wearing a face mask is mandatory in the following settings:  in an airport in WA  on an aircraft in WA or  travelling in a vehicle with a person who is subject to a quarantine direction (this includes personal vehicles, private cars, hired cars, ride-share vehicles or taxis).”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210226053120/https://www.wa.gov.au/organisation/department-of-the-premier-and-cabinet/covid-19-coronavirus-what-you-can-and-cant-do       Tasmania:   “you must wear a mask when:    inside or outside an airport terminal. This includes saying goodbye and greeting passengers (unless you stay in your car);  on board your flight (including during boarding and disembarking, while flying, and when you are on the tarmac); and  whilst waiting for your transport or walking to or from your transport (including in the car park).”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308054208/https://coronavirus.tas.gov.au/keeping-yourself-safe/facemasks   https://web.archive.org/web/20210226143610/https://coronavirus.tas.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0038/139979/Airports-and-aircrafts-No.-2-5-Feb-21.pdf     Northern Territory:   “Chief Health Officer Directions make it mandatory for face masks to be worn at all major NT airports and while on board an aircraft. Masks must be worn when inside the airport and when on the airfield.”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308054704/https://coronavirus.nt.gov.au/__data/assets/pdf_file/0009/965628/cho-directions-no1-2021-wearing-face-masks-in-aircraft-and-airports.pdf   https://web.archive.org/web/20210308054727/https://coronavirus.nt.gov.au/stay-safe/slow-spread/information-about-face-masks   Australian Capital Territory:   ‘Under a public health direction effective from 11.59pm on Friday 22 January 2021, face masks are mandatory for people aged 12 and over, including workers who interact with the public, while inside the Canberra Airport terminal and during domestic commercial flights in and out of Canberra.  Although face masks are not required to be worn outside the terminal of Canberra Airport, passengers embarking and disembarking a flight on the tarmac must keep them on.’  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308055258/https://www.covid19.act.gov.au/stay-safe-and-healthy/protect-yourself   URL for from legal direction ‘Public Health (Mandatory Face Masks –Canberra Airport and Domestic Flights) Emergency Direction 2021’ unable to be archived.
notes_E2: ***Updated from 2 to 1; majority of household-relevant debt relief expired on Jan 1; some limited measures still in place. Recommend review of this entire column     See previous coding note:     In March 2020, the Australian Government announced a series of changes to bankruptcy law, as part of the wider economic response to the COVID-19 pandemic.  These temporary debt relief measures ended on 1 January 2021. The now ceased temporary changes included:  an increase in the debt threshold, which enabled creditors to apply for a bankruptcy notice; an increase to the timeframe for a debtor to respond to a bankruptcy notice; an increase to the temporary debt protection period available to debtors. https://web.archive.org/web/20210113072218/https://www.afsa.gov.au/about-us/newsroom/temporary-debt-relief-measures-ended-1-january-2021      AER Statement of Expectations of energy businesses remains in place : Protecting customers and the energy market during COVID-19 remains in effect and (while not binding) states that "Customers worried about paying their bills should contact their retailer about their debt. Retailers will work with their customers to make sure they stay connected."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210113074737/https://www.aer.gov.au/publications/corporate-documents/aer-statement-of-expectations-of-energy-businesses-protecting-customers-and-the-energy-market-during-covid-19    A national hold on evictions will be put commercial and residential tenants in financial distress, who are unable to meet their commitments due to the impact of the coronavirus, remains in place. https://web.archive.org/web/20210113075010/https://business.gov.au/risk-management/emergency-management/coronavirus-information-and-support-for-business/relief-for-commercial-tenancies
notes_E1: On 22 March 2020, the eligibility criteria for this payment was extended to new payment recipients who are eligible for their payment or card between 12 March 2020 to 13 April 2020 (inclusive). As long as someone had lodged a claim for an eligible payment and was eligible for that payment by 13 April 2020, they should have already received this economic support payment via Services Australia or the Department of Veterans’ Affairs. Payments were made from 31 March 2020 and would have been received by the majority of recipients by 17 April 2020.https://www.dss.gov.au/about-the-department/coronavirus-covid-19-information-and-support
notes_C3: VIC: In an easy of restrictions, a 17 February 2021 media release from the Victorian Government published on the Victorian State Government Health and Human Service website announced that "Restrictions under Victoria’s new circuit-breaker actions will end tonight. From 11:59pm 17 February 2021 Victoria returns to COVIDSafe Summer restrictions – with some revised conditions.....  The Victorian Government COVID-19 website states that: "Up to 20 people can meet outdoors in a public place. There is no limit on the number of households those people come from."... "Large indoor venues, such as the NGV and Princess Theatre, can open for up to 50 per cent capacity of the total venue with a maximum of 300 patrons in each space. Density caps apply to non-seated areas."..."Indoor seated entertainment venues also have limits of 50 per cent of seating capacity and up to 300 patrons per space."..."Outdoor entertainment venues have limits of 75 per cent capacity and up to 1000 patrons. Density caps apply to non-seated areas."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210220060525/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202102/Stay%20Safe%20Directions%20(Victoria)%20(No%2015)%2017%20February%202021%20(signed).pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210219220907/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/coronavirus-update-victoria-17-february-2021  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222044743/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/how-we-live
notes_C6: VIC: In an easy of restrictions, a 17 February 2021 media release from the Victorian Government published on the Victorian State Government Health and Human Service website announced that "Restrictions under Victoria’s new circuit-breaker actions will end tonight. From 11:59pm 17 February 2021 Victoria returns to COVIDSafe Summer restrictions – with some revised conditions.... There will no longer be four reasons to leave home and the five-kilometre restriction will no longer apply." While restrictions re mask wearing and gathering remain, The VIC Govt COVID-19 is no longer restricting citizens from leaving their homes.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210220060525/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202102/Stay%20Safe%20Directions%20(Victoria)%20(No%2015)%2017%20February%202021%20(signed).pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210219220907/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/coronavirus-update-victoria-17-february-2021  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222044743/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/how-we-live
notes_C8: PM statement of 19 March 2020: Australia is closing its borders to all non-citizens and non-residents.  The entry ban takes effect from 9pm AEDT Friday, 20 March 2020, with exemptions only for Australian citizens, permanent residents and their immediate family, including spouses, legal guardians and dependants. Archived statement: https://web.archive.org/web/20200510205042/https://www.pm.gov.au/media/border-restrictions
notes_C2: WA: In a further easing of restrictions Western Australian Premier Mark McGowan announced that "The Perth and Peel restrictions will end as planned at 12.01am, Sunday, February 14.This means the whole of Western Australia will return to the pre-lockdown conditions, as experienced prior to 6pm on Sunday, January 31....Western Australians should continue to practise physical distancing where possible, maintain good personal hygiene at all times and get tested when unwell. It is vital that all Western Australians ensure they are registering their contact details, at businesses and venues where contact registers are mandatory, to assist contact tracing if it is required. As was the case before the lockdown, public or private events involving more than 500 patrons that require local government authority approval will need an approved COVID Event Plan as part of that process." All businesses are allowed to reopen though some COVIDsafe measures remain in place.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210222020726/https://www.wa.gov.au/organisation/department-of-the-premier-and-cabinet/covid-19-coronavirus-what-you-can-and-cant-do  http://web.archive.org/web/20210222021353/https://www.mediastatements.wa.gov.au/Pages/McGowan/2021/02/Return-to-pre-lockdown-life-from-12-01am-Sunday-February-14.aspx      VIC: In an easy of restrictions, a 17 February 2021 media release from the Victorian Government published on the Victorian State Government Health and Human Service website announced that "Restrictions under Victoria’s new circuit-breaker actions will end tonight. From 11:59pm 17 February 2021 Victoria returns to COVIDSafe Summer restrictions – with some revised conditions.... There will no longer be four reasons to leave home and the five-kilometre restriction will no longer apply. Schools, restaurants and retails can reopen and both public and private office workers can return up to 50 per cent on site."  All workplaces are open with restrictions including recordkeeping, maximum people, percentage capacity restrictions, mask carrying/wearing, record keeping requirements,  square meter capacity rules, and 1.5m distance rules.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210222023521if_/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/how-we-work  https://web.archive.org/web/20210220060525/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202102/Stay%20Safe%20Directions%20(Victoria)%20(No%2015)%2017%20February%202021%20(signed).pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210219220907/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/coronavirus-update-victoria-17-february-2021    NSW:  The most recent updates to the Public Health (COVID-19 Restrictions on  Gathering and Movement) Order (No 7) 2020 made on 11th February 2021.  The direction prohibits Nightclubs operating within Greater Sydney, Central Coast, and Wollongong.  No other work places are prohibited from operating.  However, there remain capacity restriction (square meter rules and percentage capacity) and record keeping    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222043855/https://www.legislation.nsw.gov.au/file/Public%20Health%20%28COVID-19%20Restrictions%20on%20Gathering%20and%20Movement%29%20Order%20%28No%207%29%202020_210212.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210209073400/https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/what-you-can-and-cant-do-under-rules/greater-sydney    Therefore reverted coding to T2 from T3.
notes_C4: Currently Victoria and New South Wales have the most stringent government directions restricting private gatherings.     Victoria: In a further easing of restrictions the Victorian Stay Safe Directions (Victoria) (No 16) came into force at 11.59pm on 26 February 2021 and replace the Stay Safe Directions (Victoria) (No 15).  This directions remain in place as at 8th March 2021.     According to the Victorian Government COVID19 website current COVIDsafe settings for Social gatherings include:   You can have up to 30 visitors to your home per day, meaning the household members plus 30 visitors (children under 12 months of age and intimate partners of any person living in your house do not count towards the 30-person cap).    If you have visitors in your home, it is strongly recommended that face masks are worn during the visit.    Face masks are also strongly recommended if you cannot keep 1.5 metres distance from others (except if you are with household members or an intimate partner   If you are planning to leave your home – you must carry a face mask.   You can meet in groups of up to 100 people in a public outdoor space from any number of households."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308071910/https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/social-gatherings  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308065653/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202102/Workplace%20Directions%20%28No%2021%29%20-%2026%20February%202021%20%28signed%29.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308052911/https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/202102/Stay%20Safe%20Directions%20%28Victoria%29%20%28No%2016%29%20-%2026%20February%202021%20%28signed%29.pdf        New South Wales:  The most recent updates to the Public Health (COVID-19 Restrictions on Gathering and Movement) Order 2021 was made on 25th February 2021 and commencing at the beginning of 26 February 2021.  It remains current as at 8th March 2021.     According to the NSW Government COVID19 government website:   “Up to 50 visitors from any number of households may visit another at any one time. Under the rules  the total number of visitors includes adults and children  a member of the hosting household is not counted as a visitor  an overnight stay as part of a visit to someone’s house is allowed.  …If there are more than 50 visitors at a home, every person will be held individually responsible for a breach of the public health order.”      https://web.archive.org/web/20210308071248/https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/what-you-can-and-cant-do-under-rules/greater-sydney  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308064621/https://www.legislation.nsw.gov.au/file/Public%20Health%20%28COVID-19%20Restrictions%20on%20Gathering%20and%20Movement%29%20Order%202021.pdf
notes_H7: Scott Morrison, Australian Prime Minister, announce in a Media Release dated 21st Feb 2021 that "Aged care residents, nurses and doctors, disabled support residents and hotel quarantine workers, were among the first Australians to receive a COVID-19 vaccine today in Castle Hill, New South Wales.  They were joined by personnel from the Australian Defence Force and Australian Border Force alongside Australia’s Chief Medical Officer, Chief Nursing and Midwifery Officer and the Prime Minister in getting vaccinated.  The COVID-19 vaccination program was officially launched today ahead of the formal national rollout across Australia on Monday."    Australia is currently vaccinating:   Quarantine and border workers  frontline staff in facilities or services such as hospital emergency departments,COVID-19 and respiratory wards, Intensive Care Units and High-dependency Units laboratory staff handling potentially infectious material ambulance and paramedics service GP respiratory clinics, and    COVID-19 testing facilities.    Aged care and disability care staff  Aged care and disability care residents    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222114544/https://www.pm.gov.au/media/first-covid-19-vaccinations  https://web.archive.org/web/20210220003517/https://www.health.gov.au/initiatives-and-programs/covid-19-vaccines/getting-vaccinated-for-covid-19/when-will-i-get-a-covid-19-vaccine    Currently the only vaccine being delivered to individuals in Australia is the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210222121938/https://www.abc.net.au/news/health/2021-02-22/covid-19-vaccines-pfizer-astrazeneca-australia-coronavirus/13158870?nw=0  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222121816/https://www.health.gov.au/node/18777/australias-vaccine-agreements
notes_C5: 18 May  “Hundreds of thousands of Sydneysiders will have to give up their public transport commute and drive to the city under strict new social distancing measures announced by the NSW government. Capacity on trains, buses and ferries will be slashed, temporary car parking set up at Moore Park and six new pop-up cycleways rolled out across Sydney, Premier Gladys Berejiklian announced on Monday. Just 12 people will be allowed on a bus and 32 in a train carriage as the government works to maintain strict physical distancing of 1.5 metres on the network.  Trains will run at 24 per cent capacity and buses at 14 per cent for the foreseeable future, meaning Sydneysiders may be prevented from entering railway stations as they fill up or watch near-empty buses drive past their stops”  Source: http://archive.vn/zhhOo

name: Austria
notes_H1: Chancellor Kurz informs about measures against the Coronavirus, appeals to Austrians, launches info campaign and telephone hotline; http://web.archive.org/web/20200528142740/https://www.bundeskanzleramt.gv.at/bundeskanzleramt/nachrichten-der-bundesregierung/2020/bundeskanzler-kurz-zu-massnahmen-gegen-coronavirus-oesterreich-ruestet-sich-fuer-alle-szenarien.html
notes_H3: Once a case has been confirmed, contacts are determined, informed and may be put into quarantine depending on situation. https://web.archive.org/web/20200402195123/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Haeufig-gestellte-Fragen.html
notes_H2: ** Austria on Wednesday passed a resolution in the National Council to offer coronavirus antigen tests free of charge at pharmacies across the country. The non-binding resolution is expected to become law in the coming days, Austria’s Kurier newspaper reports, after which the “free coronavirus self-tests should be distributed as soon as possible”. **    http://web.archive.org/web/20210126100826/https://www.thelocal.at/20210121/austria-to-make-coronavirus-tests-available-free-at-pharmacies
notes_C7: "COVID-19 virus variant regulation (departure from Tyrol)  The following applies from February 12 to February 21, 2021: People who are leaving the federal state of Tyrol must have proof of a negative PCR or antigen test result, although the test must not be more than 48 hours ago.    "An exception is for    - Children under 10 years,  - averting immediate danger to life, limb and property,  - Organs of the public security service as well as members of rescue organizations and the fire brigade,  - freight transport,  - Transit passengers or the transit through Tyrol without a stopover, which is also present in the case of exclusively essential interruptions,  - for leaving the district of Lienz, the community of Jungholz and the Riss valley in the district of Vomp and Eben am Achensee. (see corresponding regulation )"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210212203745/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/
notes_C1: Source on universities: https://archive.is/dFdwi  "With the easing, which will be allowed from February 8th, universities and colleges can also take responsibility for taking gentle steps to open the doors and allow students in particular to come back to their respective locations. However, this is only allowed under strict conditions that the universities and colleges themselves set."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210308220830/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/HS-Uni/Aktuelles/corona/corona_faq.html    *Schools in middle schools, the AHS lower level and in polytechnic schools*  - Shift work for all students  - The classes are divided into two groups: The students in group A attend school on Monday and Tuesday. Group B students have face-to-face classes on Wednesday and Thursday. On Friday, both groups will be taught distance learning. In the following week, group B comes to school on Monday / Tuesday, group A on Wednesday / Thursday. Friday stays in distance learning. So the change continues.  - Pupils who do not want to be tested receive work assignments for work at home from the teachers in their school.     *Schools in AHS upper levels, vocational middle and higher schools and vocational schools*  - Schools conduct face-to-face classes on a daily basis.  - The lessons should be organized in two-day alternating shifts (group / class A on Monday and Tuesday, group / class B on Wednesday and Thursday). Friday can be used individually for lessons in small groups. More than 50% of the upper secondary school students may never be at the school location at the same time.    Participation in the “entry” self-tests is a prerequisite for attending school. This applies to all types of schools.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210225203418/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/schule/beratung/corona/schulbetrieb20210118.html    Primary schools resume regular operations. For secondary levels I and II, face-to-face lessons apply in 2-day shifts. Universities will remain distance learning until further notice. Kindergartens resume normal operations.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210222173307/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222173115/https://www.bmbwf.gv.at/Themen/schule/beratung/corona/schulbetrieb20210118.html
notes_H6: Since September 14th, mouth and nose protection (MNS) must be worn in the following areas:    In public transport and taxis  In all business premises for customers and staff in the customer area in closed rooms (e.g. supermarket, car dealership, banks, insurance companies, hairdressers, pharmacies, etc.)  In administrative authorities and administrative courts for party traffic  In bathrooms for bathers and staff in contact with customers in closed rooms (with the exception of damp rooms such as showers and swimming pools)  In the catering industry for staff with customer contact in closed rooms  In accommodation establishments (hotel business) for guests and staff in contact with customers in generally accessible areas in closed rooms. The catering rules apply to catering operations  In sports facilities for guests and for staff in contact with customers in closed rooms (except for sports)  In museums, exhibitions, libraries, archives and other leisure facilities for guests and staff in closed rooms with customer contact  At events in closed rooms (except at the assigned seat, whereby an MNS must still be worn if the meter distance cannot be maintained despite keeping the adjacent seats free)  In the visitor area of ??trade and public fairs, if the 1 meter distance cannot be maintained.  In cable cars and cog railways, coaches and in the interior of excursion boats  If, due to the nature of the service, the minimum distance of one meter cannot be maintained (e.g. for care and health services)  For services, if the 1 meter distance cannot be maintained or no other protective measures (e.g. plexiglass) are available.  During demonstrations, when the 1 meter distance cannot be maintained.  The operators and their employees must wear an MNS when they come into contact with the customer, provided that there is no other suitable protective device between the people for spatial separation that guarantees the same level of protection.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200916160505/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/ampelfarben/hohes-risiko-orange/verbindliche-bundesweit-geltende-massnahmen-orange/
notes_E2: Broad relief package with suspension on interest payments, partial release of obligation to pay rent etc. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200528142508/https://investinaustria.at/en/news/2020/03/corona-aid-package-economy-details.php;https://iclg.com/briefing/11275-consequences-of-the-current-situation-regarding-covid-19-for-tenants-and-landlords; http://web.archive.org/web/20200528142504/https://metropole.at/how-the-coronavirus-will-affect-your-business-in-austria/)
notes_E1: New, expanded form of short-time work for companies that are economically affected by COVID-19 introduced in spring 2020.   From October 1, 2020, working hours can only be reduced by at least 20 and up to a maximum of 70 percent for the entire calculation period.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103001533/https://www.bmafj.gv.at/Services/News/Coronavirus/FAQ--Kurzarbeit.html  https://archive.vn/EziNK
notes_C3: Professional events, such as soccer games or opera performances, are required to have placed seating. Only 1,500 people are allowed outdoor and 1,000 indoor. Masks must be worn during the entire duration of the event. No drinks or food will be offered.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103000933/https://www.vienna.at/verschaerfte-corona-massnahmen-ab-heute-in-kraft/6786417
notes_C6: Leaving your own private living area between 8 p.m. and 6 a.m. is only permitted under the following conditions: Avoidance of immediate danger to life, limb and property; Supervision of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties; Covering the basic needs of daily life; Professional and educational purposes, if necessary; Staying outdoors for physical and mental relaxation (e.g. going for a walk, jogging).  https://web.archive.org/web/20201109211208/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html
notes_C8: "Austria has suspended the entry by third-country nationals, including U.S. citizens, from outside the EU and the Schengen area since mid-March 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200916160830/https://www.austria.info/en/service-and-facts/coronavirus-information/entry-regulations
