Source: https://www.mspas.gob.gt/index.php/noticias/comunicados/item/795-el-ministerio-de-salud-publica-y-asistencia-social-mspas-y-el-instituto-guatemalteco-de-seguridad-social-igss-a-la-opinion-publica-informa
notes_C7: Restriction on internal movement lifted. The declaration only lasted until 28 Jan 2021.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210118093136/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus  http://web.archive.org/web/20210131065948/https://gt.usembassy.gov/alert-covid-19-2/
notes_C1: On Jan 4th, the status of education of Guatemala was changed to partly open according to UNESCO.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118094407/https://en.unesco.org/sites/default/files/covid_impact_education.csv
notes_H6: Masks are required in all public spaces starting on April 8: https://web.archive.org/web/20201005031448/https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/politica/guatemala-hace-obligatorio-el-uso-de-mascarillas-para-prevenir-contagios-de-coronavirus-ultima-hora/    As of 5 Oct they are still obligatory (although de facto this is probably more relaxed as businesses such as bars and restaurants reopened on 1 Oct): https://web.archive.org/web/20201005031830/https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/comunitario/el-uso-de-mascarilla-y-el-distanciamiento-social-siguen-siendo-obligatorias-en-guatemala-segun-nuevas-disposiciones-breaking/
notes_E2: The government deferred income taxes for a quarter and further subsidized electricity  https://www.prensalibre.com/guatemala/politica/cuales-son-los-programas-del-gobierno-por-la-crisis-del-coronavirus-en-guatemala-y-a-quienes-beneficiara/  https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: No policy changes.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301173848/https://gt.usembassy.gov/alert-covid-19-2/
notes_C6: Guatemala lifts its curfew in order to curb the negative economic effects of the lockdown. It is coded as a 0 as the govt seems to push people out of their homes to spend more.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201005024827/https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2020/09/29/guatemala-permitira-abrir-bares-y-anuncia-fin-de-toque-de-queda-por-la-pandemia/
notes_C8: All passengers age 10 and over arriving in Guatemala by air and land are required to obtain a negative COVID-19 PCR or an Antigen test within 96 hours prior to arrival, and comply with health screening requirements.  Starting December 23, all persons entering Guatemala who have visited the United Kingdom or South Africa within the past 14 days could be denied entry or be subject to quarantine due to a new variant of COVID-19 found in those countries. Guatemalan nationals, permanent residents, and diplomats with accreditation will be allowed entry, but will be required to quarantine for a minimum of 10 days.  This guidance could change rapidly and additional countries may be added.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210103160841/https://gt.usembassy.gov/alert-covid-19-2/
notes_C2: All sorts of businesses can now reopen following the restrictions that vary according to the risk level of the municipality:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201005030303/https://www.mspas.gob.gt/noticias/noticias-ultimas/5-noticias-mspas/1079-alertas-sanitarias-covid-19-mspas-actualiza-disposiciones-para-establecimientos.html
notes_C4: "Attendance at funerals and burials is limited to a maximum of 10 attendees. Everyone should comply with the measures put in place in Guatemala to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301180837/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus
notes_H7: The government of Guatemala will only receive its first delivery of vaccine doses in February.  As of Jan 19, no vaccines have been administered to the populace. Initial priority will be given to healthcare workers, first responders, and vulnerable populations.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210131065948/https://gt.usembassy.gov/alert-covid-19-2/
notes_C5: Public transport has reopened in Guatemala, however, there are a number of restrictions on capacity and access can still be very limited. https://web.archive.org/web/20200809075444/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/guatemala/coronavirus

name: Guam
notes_H1: "Honoring its commitment to keep the people of Guam safe, the Leon Guerrero-Tenorio Administration respectfully denied a request today from the U.S. State Department to accept entry of a cruise line vessel whose passengers may be infected with the 2019 novel coronavirus." Informed the public with developments etc. http://web.archive.org/web/20200523113902/http://dphss.guam.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/JIC_2_7_2020-1.pdf  Also Governor Lou Leon Guerrero posts daily government updates on her facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/govlouguam
notes_H3: June 2 - The Department of Public Health and Social Services (DPHSS) will be using a remote monitoring system known as Symptoms Monitoring Service to monitor individuals identified as close contacts to confirmed COVID-19 cases and returning residents in 14-day home quarantine.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200621122244/https://www.pncguam.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JIC-Release-No.-156-DPHSS-Launches-Symptoms-Monitoring-Service-for-COVID-19-Expanded-Testing-Continues-.docx.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200621122259/https://www.pncguam.com/public-health-deploys-covid-19-monitoring-app/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200621122309/https://www.pncguam.com/jic-156-dphss-launches-symptoms-monitoring-service-for-covid-19-expanded-testing-continues/    Previous coding info:    It was previously coded as 1 since contact tracing efforts were made on a case by case basis when a cluster was identified (e.g. the church incident in early April), but given the low numbers of cases in Guam, I belive that they managed to do contact tracing in most of the identified cases.    Most communicates contain the location of the identified cases and the travel history, but here is the only communicate that talks expressly about contact tracing: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605003557/https://www.ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-56-profiles-earlier-confirmed-cases-dphss-phone-calls-part-contact-tracing    Here a report on 3 June that says that new cases were discovered thanks to contact tracing: https://web.archive.org/web/20200605003635/https://www.postguam.com/news/local/one-covid-19-case-associated-with-significant-cluster/article_67f6e474-a543-11ea-b4e1-072251bba437.html
notes_H2: GRMC (a private hospital) made testing generally available. At some point also drive-thru testing centres started offering testing for people without symptoms, but change is observable on daily reports, I could not find any announcement of the change in policy.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200605001304/https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-113-profiles-earlier-confirmed-cases-grmc-drive-thru-testing-available-dphss-updates    https://web.archive.org/web/20200605001343/https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-157-end-day-results-two-test-positive-covid-19-dphssgovernor-signs-executive-order
notes_C7: I can't find any present evidence of restrictions about traveling within Guam.
notes_C1: Beginning January 19, 2021, all three models of instruction are anticipated to be offered, and parents may select which model their child will participate in.  THIS MODEL OF INSTRUCTION IS ANTICIPATED TO BEGIN ON JAN. 19, 2021:   Traditional (Face-to-Face): Guam Education Board has approved the District School Readiness Task Force recommendation of using an A- B or A-B-C alternating schedule, where either 1/2 or 1/3 of students attend classes on any given school day.    Link  https://web.archive.org/web/20210216115351/https://www.gdoe.net/District/Portal/covid-19-information
notes_H6: 10 May PCOR 2 level of reopening brought in, everyone required to wear a mask in public to enable safe reopening    https://archive.fo/3oygS
notes_E2: Ban on evictions lifted, as per Feb 19th executive order.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210302100438/https://dphss.guam.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/21.0219-SSD-to-Speaker-Terlaje-re-Executeive-Order-No.-2021-04-Relative-to-Declaring-Pandemic-Condition-of-Readiness-3-PCOR-3.pdf
notes_E1: No income support found. Federal Pandemic Unemployment Assistance and Lost Wages Assistance seemingly no longer active.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210221062215/https://www.ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-577-results-ten-521-test-positive-covid-19governor-leon-guerrero-signs-executive
notes_C3: Based on the most recent public health order, section 20, unnecessary use of break rooms and lounges are discouraged although gatherings are permitted.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210302102614/https://dphss.guam.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/DPHSS-Guidance-Memo-2021-06-REV1-PCOR3-02.24.2021-FINAL.pdf
notes_C6: "Governor Lou Leon Guerrero has extended the PCOR 1 status on Guam. However, she’s implementing a “phased-in” reopening of businesses and activities. The island is no-longer under a “stay-at-home” order, instead a “safer-at-home” advisory has been issued."    "General office work will be permitted to resume, however teleworking is still encouraged"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200930113139/https://www.pncguam.com/pcor-1-continues-on-guam-however-business-reopening-restrictions-to-be-lifted-in-phased-approach/
notes_C8: The Governor of Guam, Lou Leon Guerrero, announced that restrictions, such as mandatory quarantine for all incoming travelers, remain in place.    Source: vhttp://web.archive.org/web/20200930111803/https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/426845/guam-will-relax-covid-restrictions-slightly
notes_C2: In line with restaurants reopening, new rules were outlined and released.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210308181737/https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-590-results-3-411-test-positive-covid-19dphss-issues-guidance-memo-2021-07-rev-1
notes_C4: Congregation is permitted and shall be limited to no more than twenty-five (25) persons; and such that  Running, walking, biking, and other recreation and non-contact exercise is authorized on public roadways, beaches, and parks,   Recreational boating by single household unit, and boat charters, where 6 feet distancing can be maintained by everyone on board, is authorized.   The use of hotel ballrooms shall be restricted to a single public or private reservation to celebrate functions (i.e., anniversaries, birthdays, weddings, graduations)  Public and private swimming pools allow no more than twenty-five (25) individuals per group at poolside and must remain 6 feet distance if not from the same household.  Government of Guam parks and beaches shall be open to the public and congregations shall be limited to no more than twenty-five (25) persons.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210216141852/https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-556-dphss-issues-guidance-memo-2021-04homebound-covid-19-vaccination-schedule-dphss
notes_H7: Vaccines have stopped and will resume March 8th.     Refuses to archive.     https://ghs.guam.gov/jic-release-no-588-covid-19-mass-vaccination-clinics-scheduled-resume-march-8-13-uog-fieldhouse
notes_C5: To prevent the spread of Covid -19 virus with an overabundance of caution, we ask our riders to practice the proper precautions as per the directive by the Governor's Office, Office of Homeland Security, Dept of Public Health & Social Services to practice social distancing by limiting your social contact to emergency and essential purposes only.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200523105523/https://grta.guam.gov/

name: Guyana
notes_H1: Ministry of Health starts public info campaign on Coronavirus in series of facebook posts; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509223634/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2262669330703267&set=a.1505704143066460; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509223630/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2261551327481734&set=a.1505704143066460; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509224113/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2260577827579084&set=a.1505704143066460; https://web.archive.org/web/20200509224112/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2261551327481734&set=a.1505704143066460
notes_H3: Guyana's President, David Granger, confirmed the first case of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in Georgetown on Wednesday, March 11. Authorities are currently conducting contact tracing to limit community spread of the virus.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200521172042/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/322031/guyana-first-covid-19-case-confirmed-march-11
notes_H2: "In August, when there was a backlog of samples, the Ministry had restricted testing to symptomatic persons and those who might have been in contact or exposed to a person who tested positive for the disease. Walk-in patients were urged to follow preventative guidelines and to self-quarantine until a period of time had elapsed and they showed no severe signs or symptoms.    Hospitalised persons who were never tested for COVID-19 were given priority to undergo testing and obtain their results. Additionally, frontline workers are being prioritised for tests and results as they are among those likely to have been exposed to positive cases."    Note: this policy is related to a change of government    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200921161738/https://guyanachronicle.com/2020/09/19/dr-anthony-budget-2020-will-resuscitate-the-health-sector/
notes_C7: The restrictions on regional travel in and out of region 7 were not extended beyond December 31st. No restrictions on interstate travel are currently in place.  sources:  https://archive.vn/qJLXN  https://archive.vn/a2jRc  https://archive.vn/1CBhR
notes_C1: Schools reopen 9th November for grades 10, 11, sixth forms, PIC and TVET institutions: /web/20201116115909/https://www.education.gov.gy/web/index.php/mediacenter/item/6209-schools-reopen-today-for-grades-10-11-sixth-forms-pic-and-tvet-institutions
notes_H6: As part of the Third Phase, all persons are required to wear a face mask in public spaces at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200908164018/https://www.stabroeknews.com/2020/07/17/news/guyana/mask-wearing-now-mandatory-in-public-under-updated-covid-19-measures/
notes_E2: Relief focuses on bank transactions alone.   The Bank of Guyana has further encouraged financial institutions to consider the following measures:  1. Defer loan payments to assist customers in good standing;  2. Defer loan payments by companies to assist with their liquidity requirements;  3. Waive or reduce fees/penalties for transactions with ATMs, POS, EFT, debit cards, loan  processing, late payments on loans, etc. and;  NOTE: Licensed financial institutions will be responsible for evaluating, on a case by case basis,  the applicability to customers of the aforementioned measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200505024403/https://www.bankofguyana.org.gy/bog/images/communications/press_release/COVID19release.pdf
notes_E1: I am unsure for how long this policy has been in place because there is no evidence of it on the IMF policy page. However, $9000 GYD is currently being provided monthly under a public assistance plan. It is proposed to increase this amount to $12 000 GYD   source: https://archive.vn/wXbs1
notes_C3: No person shall host, attend or visit- a recreational or competitive sporting event;  a meeting of a fraternal society, private or social club or civic association or organisation; or any other social activity. Moreover, religious gatherings are banned except for funerals and weddings (limited to 10 attendees); measures in place until May 03; https://web.archive.org/web/20200427133043/https://dpi.gov.gy/covid-19-emergency-measures/
notes_C6: Stay at home requirements are in effect for everyone starting 1 August, except as stated in the notice.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200805231141/https://officialgazette.gov.gy/images/gazette2020/jul/Extra_30JULY2020COViD19_7.pdf
notes_C8: On January 30th, Guyana banned travel from Brazil for 30 days.  source: https://archive.vn/b0EPR
notes_C2: No updates since October 31, 2020  Employees in both the public and private sectors are instructed to work on rotation unless told by their manager to work from home.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201206171220/https://officialgazette.gov.gy/images/gazette2020/oct/Extra_31OCTOBER2020COViD19_11.pdf
notes_C4: On the 30th of September the Government of Guyana released the Covid Emergency Measures No.10 to be effective from 1st October to 31st October, 2020. The document outlines that with the exception of religious gatherings, gatherings of more than ten people are not allowed  http://web.archive.org/web/20201001040713/https://officialgazette.gov.gy/images/gazette2020/sept/Extra_30SEPTEMBER2020COViD19_10.pdf
notes_H7: Frontline workers have started to receive vaccines. They are receiving the Oxford-Astrazeneca vaccine.  source: https://archive.vn/NB0a1
notes_C5: No evidence of a policy change.

name: Hong Kong
notes_H3: The first highly suspected imported case of novel coronavirus infection was reported in Hong Kong.   The Centre for Protection of Health has immediately commenced epidemiological investigations and conducted relevant contact tracing.    A hotline is set up for contact tracing.   Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200124174136/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202001/22/P2020012200982.htm ; p.5, Annex 4, https://www.legco.gov.hk/yr19-20/english/counmtg/papers/cm20200219p-e.pdf
notes_H2: On Friday 7 August Hong Kong announced that voluntary free virus tests will be available to all 7 million residents in order to achieve universal testing to identify asymptomatic carriers. News articles report that capacity is able to fulfil this.    Media source 1:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200810212626/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-07/hong-kong-to-offer-free-virus-testing-to-whole-city-says-hk01    Media source 2:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812091126/https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-offers-free-testing-as-china-sends-in-teams-to-contain-coronavirus-11596815359
notes_C7: Announced on November 30, the Government strongly urges all members of the public to stay at home as much as possible. Besides, High Speed Rail between Hong Kong West Kowloon Station and the Mainland have been suspended.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201205074504/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202012/01/P2020120100061.htm  http://web.archive.org/web/20201205082117/https://www.td.gov.hk/en/special_news/spnews.htm
notes_C1: all kindergartens and kindergarten-cum-child care centres would start suspension of face-to-face classes and school activities for two weeks from this Saturday (November 14) until November 27 (Friday) owing to the outbreaks of upper respiratory tract infection.    https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202011/12/P2020111200609.htm?fontSize=1  * The website of wayback machine didn't work, kept on giving me internal errors.
notes_H6: "The Secretary for Food and Health will specify, by way of a notice published in the Gazette for the purpose of the mandatory mask-wearing requirement under Cap. 599I, a period of seven days from September 11 till September 17. During the aforementioned seven-day period, a person must wear a mask at all times when the person is boarding or onboard a public transport carrier, is entering or present in an MTR paid area, or is entering or present in a specified public place (i.e. all public places, save for outdoor public places in country parks and special areas as defined in section 2 of the Country Parks Ordinance (Cap. 208))."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200916120824/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202009/08/P2020090800764.htm
notes_E2: Government has implemented broad debt/contract relief, including issuing tax breaks, low-interest loans, waiving rates for residential properties and non-residential properties, and subsidizing utilities such as electricity and water. https://web.archive.org/web/20200402055542/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202002/26/P2020022600420.htm
notes_E1: There're policies about sponsoring residents with different occupations, but no evidence about if the sponsorship is over 50% of the income.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201117050424/https://www.coronavirus.gov.hk/chi/anti-epidemic-fund.html
notes_C3: The leisure and cultural venues/facilities reopened earlier will be temporarily closed starting from July 15 (Wednesday) until further notice.  The recreational, sports and cultural programmes to be held in July will also be cancelled.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713174115/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202007/13/P2020071300885.htm?fontSize=1
notes_C6: Announced on November 30, the Government strongly urges all members of the public to stay at home as much as possible.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201205074504/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202012/01/P2020120100061.htm
notes_C8: As of December 4, travel to Hong Kong is subject to entry restrictions. Specified conditions including negative test results are imposed on inbound travellers who have visited specified places.  Source:   http://web.archive.org/web/20201205091252/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/hong-kong  http://web.archive.org/web/20201205085856/https://www.coronavirus.gov.hk/eng/high-risk-places.html
notes_C2: Announced on 24th of November, effective from this day until 3rd of Dec, all pubs, public showers and night clubs will be closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201201012159/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202011/24/P2020112400893.htm
notes_C4: The number of persons allowed in group gatherings in public places will be tightened from 50 to four, with effective from July 15, 2020.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200713193134/https://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/202007/14/P2020071400010.htm
notes_H7: A, B, C and additional priority groups (sinovac, Comirnaty)    The Government today expanded the scope of priority groups to cover seven categories of people who have greater risk of exposure to COVID-19 and risk of infection. The seven categories of people include staff of premises that serve food and beverages, markets, supermarkets, convenience stores, couriers and takeaway delivery including food delivery. It also comprises staff of local public transport service operators, registered construction workers and property management such as security guards and cleaning and security personnel. The remaining categories include teachers and school staff, employees in the tourism industry and staff of scheduled premises under the Prevention & Control of Disease (Requirements & Directions) (Business & Premises) Regulation.    https://archive.ph/TEAbn#selection-563.0-579.229    Arranged by the Government, around 100 people in the vaccination priority groups received the Comirnaty vaccine at the community vaccination centre at Sun Yat Sen Memorial Park Sports Centre this morning.    https://archive.ph/CDvsP
notes_C5: To reduce the risk of the spread of the novel coronavirus in the community, public transport service providers have made special arrangements. The regulations vary for different modes.    https://www.coronavirus.gov.hk/sim/public-transport.html  * Wayback machine didn't work, kept on giving me internal errors or "503 Service Unavailable".

name: Honduras
notes_H1: No change as per US Embassy in Honduras.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222001008/https://hn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: no changes
notes_H2: "[Dr Victor] Flores works at various clinics around the country, traveling to more rural and underserved areas. The lockdown has prevented him from seeing patients like usual. He says he’s talked to fellow doctors who have been seeing patients come in with high fevers and coughs, but the lack of tests in the country means patients with coronavirus symptoms are being sent home and told to isolate." http://web.archive.org/web/20200402181802/https://www.wbur.org/hereandnow/2020/03/25/honduras-coronavirus-health-care There are some tests occurring, but only very limited. Mainly focused around incoming visitors it appears. http://web.archive.org/web/20200523092447/https://www.laprensa.hn/inicio/1363915-410/story.html Also from this note: https://web.archive.org/web/20200525161741/https://www.cnbs.gob.hn/blog/2020/03/04/laboratorio-nacional-de-virologia-esta-abastecido-para-analizar-muestras-de-covid-19/
notes_C7: No change as per US Embassy in Honduras.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222001008/https://hn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: A news report by France24 on Feb 16th, 2021 confirms the closing of schools in Honduras due to Covid-19.     https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.france24.com/es/minuto-a-minuto/20210216-futuro-de-ni%C3%B1as-de-honduras-en-riesgo-tras-destrucci%C3%B3n-de-escuelas-advierte-ong
notes_H6: Honduran authorities announced on Thursday, May 21, that the use of face masks in public was made compulsory in an attempt to curb the spread of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. The new regulations also require all individuals to follow and implement social distancing and hygiene measures in both public and private meetings exceeding five people. Penalties, including fines, community service, and/or jail time will be levied for failure to comply with the measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201014143057/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/344636/honduras-face-mask-use-compulsory-in-public-from-may-21-update-6
notes_E2: Mandatory waiver of late fees & charges for all debts, in addition to right to negotiate up to 3 mos. of debt payment deferrals with lenders.    Per Legislative Decree 33-2020, archived (Spanish): https://web.archive.org/web/20200430022613/https://www.tsc.gob.hn/web/leyes/Decreto-33-2020.pdf.     Secondary source, archived (Spanish): https://web.archive.org/web/20200430024722/https://www.laprensa.hn/honduras/1366054-410/hondure%C3%B1os-tendran-refinanciamiento-readecuacion-deudas
notes_E1: Efforts have concentrated on supporting the fragile health system and providing targeted support to families, workers, and firms. Additional crisis-related spending needs were initially estimated at 2.1 percent of GDP in 2020, including emergency healthcare expenditures (0.9 percent of GDP), temporary unemployment benefits to formal workers (0.6 percent of GDP), delivery of food supplies to poor families (0.2 percent of GDP), and cash transfers to informal workers (0.4 percent of GDP). The authorities have identified significant nonpriority spending reallocations to partly finance these emergency expenditures. Congress approved a decree authorizing expedited purchasing procedures for emergency expenditures related to the crisis. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200930112959/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#H
notes_C3: No change as per US Embassy in Honduras.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222001008/https://hn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Required (few exceptions); source: http://archive.today/2021.02.15-112322/https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/stay-at-home-covid?stackMode=absolute&region=World
notes_C8: Although international air and land travel has resumed with only screenings on arrival and a necessary negative PCR test prior to arrival, Honduras still holds its ban on passengers having been to the UK and South Africa in the 21 days prior to travel.   "Honduras does not permit the entry of travellers who have been in the United Kingdom or South Africa in the 21 days prior to their arrival. This measure came into force on 23 December.  Honduran nationals, foreign nationals who are legally residents in the country and diplomats who have been in the UK or South Africa in the two weeks prior to their arrival will be allowed to enter, however they must quarantine for a period of 14 days in their place of residence."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210309000503/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/honduras/coronavirus
notes_C2: No change as per US Embassy in Honduras.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222001008/https://hn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: No change as per US Embassy in Honduras.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222001008/https://hn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C5: No data; source: http://archive.today/2021.02.15-123446/https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/public-transport-covid?stackMode=absolute&time=2021-02-10&region=World

name: Croatia
notes_H1: "Ministry of Health: National Crisis Headquarters for Coronavirus is being established. ... Croatian Institute of Public Health (CIPH) will publish the latest information on the coronavirus every day at 3 pm on its web site."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200429123822/https://zdravstvo.gov.hr/vijesti/ministarstvo-zdravstva-osniva-se-nacionalni-krizni-stozer-zbog-koronavirusa/4956
notes_H3: I don't think any of the measures mentioned by previous coders constitute contact tracing. A contact tracing app is available, but according to the interpretation guide, the presence of a contact tracing app in a country would not be recorded here under H3.
notes_H2: There are various testing facilities available across Croatia, where individuals can simply book a testing slot when needed.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201029201016/https://www.koronavirus.hr/testing-centers-in-croatia/764
notes_C7: The island of Brac has lifted the restriction on internal movement.   http://stozerbrac.com/novosti/217-normalizacija-zivota-na-otoku.html
notes_C1: Based on previous policy schools should be fully open from 18-Jan, but have not found anything to confirm this.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210121155350/https://koronavirus.hr/najnovije/ogranicavanje-okupljanja-i-druge-nuzne-epidemioloske-mjere-i-preporuke/870
notes_H6: The wearing of facemasks was mandatory in most public spaces as of 13 July. Wearing protective masks is mandatory?throughout?the country?in public transportation, medical facilities, shops, malls, salons, and businesses?where face-to-face contact is required?(ex.?banks and post offices).     https://web.archive.org/web/20200901041257/https://www.oecd.org/south-east-europe/COVID-19-Crisis-in-Croatia.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20200917145125/https://hr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_E2: HBOR has extended the moratorium of loans:  For tourism businesses to June 30, 2021    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111003053/https://www.expatincroatia.com/tax-relief-covid-19/    On 19th October, the moratorium on debt enforcements had ended, leaving tens of thousands of Croatian citizens wondering about their future in time of social and economic uncertainty caused by the COVID-19 crisis.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201230084013/https://china-cee.eu/2020/11/18/croatia-economy-briefing-the-end-of-moratorium-on-debt-enforcements-social-and-economic-uncertainties-on-the-rise/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111003913/https://www.croatiaweek.com/moratorium-on-debt-enforcements-in-croatia-ends/
notes_E1: Eligible employers may receive a grant to offset an eligible employee’s potential loss of employment income if such an employee’s working hours are temporarily reduced in one or more months in the period June to December 2020.  Eligible employers:  Employers with between 10 to 50 employees must submit a grant request for at least 20% of all employees; Employers with 51 or more employees must submit a grant request for at least 10% of all employees  Value of the grant:  An eligible employer may receive a grant of up to HRK 2,000 per month per eligible employee  An eligible employee is an employee whose working hours have been temporarily reduced by no more than 50% of her/his contracted monthly working hours.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200917141525/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/croatia-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: As of 4 May, religious gatherings have resumed, provided they follow specifically prescribed safety measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200901041257/https://www.oecd.org/south-east-europe/COVID-19-Crisis-in-Croatia.pdf
notes_C6: Normal activity has resumed as long as precautions and protocols are followed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200901041257/https://www.oecd.org/south-east-europe/COVID-19-Crisis-in-Croatia.pdf
notes_C8: From December 1, 2020 to January 15, 2021, the Croatian Government has prohibited all border crossings to protect the population from the COVID-19 disease. Exceptions to the border crossing ban are as follows:   Travellers travelling to the Republic of Croatia from one of the EU/EEA Member States (regardless of nationality); Nationals of EU/EEA Member States as well as their family members travelling to the Republic of Croatia from third countries, i.e. non-EU/EEA , etc (See Archived link)  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110154351/https://hr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210106151359/https://www.koronavirus.hr/privremena-zabrana-i-ogranicenje-prelaska-preko-granicnih-prijelaza-rh/733
notes_C2: From 15.02.2021, cafés and bars will also be allowed to offer take-away in Croatia, fitness centres and gambling halls/betting shops will be allowed to reopen under certain conditions.  Restaurants, catering objects, cafés and bars are allowed to serve guests (from 6:00 a.m. - 10:00 p.m.) in addition to delivery, drive-in or take-away, since 01.03.2021 also in outdoor areas, betting offices are allowed to operate, but without serving food/drinks, except in outdoor areas. Still, closure of casinos, nightclubs.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210228192050/https://www.wko.at/service/aussenwirtschaft/coronoavirus-update-kroatien.html
notes_C4: Due to the recent rise of COVID-19 cases, the following measures are in effect from November 28 to December 21.  These measures may be revised or updated based on the evolving epidemiological situation:  Private gatherings are limited to 10 people and must end at 22:00.  Funerals are limited to 15 people, but physical contact must be avoided when offering condolences.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201128185729/https://hr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_H7: A, C:    Vaccination Plan:  First, it is planned to vaccinate employees and users of homes for the elderly (and other institutions for the provision of accommodation in the social welfare system) and health workers, then (conditionally speaking, the second phase of vaccination) all persons over 65 and all persons with chronic diseases, and finally (conditionally speaking, the third phase) the entire population.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110040933/https://www.koronavirus.hr/uputa-priprema-za-cijepljenje-protiv-covid-19-884/884    Doses ordered:  Procurement is contracted with several manufacturers and the procedures are still ongoing.  Contracts with four manufacturers have already been concluded.  Under these contracts, we expect a total of 5,600,000 doses of vaccine by the end of 2021.  Considering that all * vaccines are administered in two doses with different intervals, the amount agreed so far is sufficient for vaccination of 2,800,000 inhabitants of the Republic of Croatia.  * except for Janssen vaccine for which there is a possibility of administering 1 dose  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110040933/https://www.koronavirus.hr/uputa-priprema-za-cijepljenje-protiv-covid-19-884/884    de facto capacity and evidence:  First doses of coronavirus vaccine arrive in Croatia  https://www.croatiaweek.com/first-doses-of-coronavirus-vaccine-arrive-in-croatia/    Croatian PM says COVID vaccines will be free  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110181420/https://www.croatiaweek.com/croatian-pm-says-covid-vaccines-will-be-free/
notes_C5: "It is mandatory for passengers to wear face masks on public transport and taxis. "  https://web.archive.org/web/20200804030544/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/croatia

name: Haiti
notes_H1: "The Haitian government has been more visible on social media, with regards to coronavirus prevention and news. The presidential press secretary, Eddy Jackson Alexis, has been posting alerts on his official Twitter account.  The health minister said the government has established a second emergency telephone line — 116 (equivalent to 911 in the U.S.) and that they are working on a third emergency line that citizens can call at no charge, for information on the virus."   https://web.archive.org/web/20200428025657/https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/haiti-intensifies-coronavirus-preparations https://twitter.com/JoutheJoseph/status/1238235596595789825
notes_H3: Contact tracing information updated everyday on the website of the Ministry of Health. http://web.archive.org/web/20210301202856/https://www.mspp.gouv.ht/
notes_H2: Tests are available for people with Covid symptoms and passengers before international travel.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210301204313/https://ht.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: The state of sanitary emergency ended on July 20, 2020. There is no information relative to limiting internal movement. https://web.archive.org/web/20200729210316/https://www.haitilibre.com/article-31395-haiticovid-19-il-n-y-a-plus-d-etat-d-urgence-sanitaire-en-haiti.html
notes_C1: Schools reopened with limited class sizes and requirement for social distancing.  https://lenouvelliste.com/article/219091/covid-19-pas-plus-de-30-eleves-ne-seront-admis-en-classe  https://www.haitilibre.com/en/news-31439-haiti-flash-official-revised-school-calendar-2019-2020.html  *** ARCHIVING WEBSITE WAS NOT WORKING      Previous note by Lucy Goodfellow:  All levels of schools are now open to complete the 2019-2020 academic year, after some levels restarted education on August 10th.    This does not include preschools, but since they would be closed anyway and simply don't need to make up for lost academic time so do not need to open, I have coded this as 0.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200722115402/https://www.communication.gouv.ht/2020/07/communique-de-presse-du-menfp-relative-a-la-relance-des-activites-scolaire/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200819102839/https://www.communication.gouv.ht/2020/07/reprise-des-activites-scolaires-le-protocole-sanitaire-du-ministere-de-leducation-nationale-et-de-la-formation-professionnelle-est-presente-au-public/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200819102414/https://www.voanews.com/covid-19-pandemic/haiti-schools-reopen-first-time-five-months-coronavirus-outbreak    *Previous note by Precious Oluwadra    Monday July 6, at a press conference, Pierre Josué Agénor Cadet, Minister of National Education, took stock of the resumption of school activities on August 10 https://www.haitilibre.com/article-31195-haiti -flash-dates-of-resumption-of-school-and-university-activities.html and the actions programmed by the Ministry with a view to completing the academic year 2019-2020.    He recalled that according to the calendar established by the ministry, the resumption of school activities will be done only for the students expected for the state exams of the 9th fundamental year and terminal (Secondary 4 and philosophy), on Monday, August 10. The other classes will resume on August 17th. The end of the courses for the academic year is scheduled for October 9, 2020 and the 2020-2021 academic year will officially begin on November 9.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200930140735/https://www.haitilibre.com/article-31217-haiti-flash-tous-les-details-sur-la-reprise-des-activites-scolaires.html    http://web.archive.org/web/20200830132810/https://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/world/americas/haiti/article245245130.html
notes_H6: Gatherings of more than 10 people are banned as a precautionary measure. It is also mandatory to wear a facemask in public. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200831144029/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/344786/haiti-president-jovenel-moise-extends-state-of-emergency-until-july-20-update-6
notes_E2: "easing loan repayments", first time Haiti is recorded in the IMF database, but could be present earlier (I cannot find the notes for it though)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200328004509/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#H
notes_E1: Support is planned for wage payments and transfers to support households.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200622155955/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: I cannot find official government policy. However, the president has announced Carnival will be held, leading me to code this as 0.     "Haitian President Jovenel Moïse told Haitians last Sunday that the National Carnival 2021 will be held in Port-de-Paix in the North-West region of Haiti, on the Boulevard des Trois Rivières."   https://web.archive.org/web/20201220004807/https://www.caribbeannationalweekly.com/entertainment/haitis-2021-carnival-will-be-held-in-port-de-paix/    "Last week, while attending a music festival in the coastal city of Port-de-Paix, President Jovenel Moïse announced that Carnival, which was canceled this year, is back on and will take place in the northwestern Haitian city, Feb. 14-16. Three weeks earlier, his prime minister, addressing journalists at the swearing-in of the new police chief, spoke about not being able to party and reminisced about wanting to attend one of the popular neighborhood block parties in the slums, but being unable to do so, not for fear of COVID-19, but the recent rash in kidnappings."  https://archive.is/1PLOW#selection-1131.0-1131.568
notes_C6: "As of Jan. 13, a nationwide 0001-0400 nightly curfew remains in effect, as do requirements that residents wear protective facemasks while in public places and comply with social-distancing standards of 1.5 meters (5 feet) between persons; however, most other restrictions were lifted at the end of Haiti's state of health emergency in July 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210125152715/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/429096/haiti-nightly-0100-0400-curfew-remains-in-effect-nationwide-as-of-jan-13-most-other-coronavirus-disease-restrictions-lifted-update-10
notes_C8: On October 22nd "The Government of Haiti has stated it will impose a requirement that all arriving passengers self-quarantine for 14 days. The Ministry of Public Health (MSPP) will check in with passengers three times after arrival in Haiti, using information provided in the health declaration form, to determine any onset of COVID-19 symptoms."      https://web.archive.org/web/20201109144743/https://today.caricom.org/2020/10/22/covid-19-travel-protocols-for-haiti/
notes_C2: The state of sanitary emergency ended on July 20, 2020. There are no specific recommendations with regards to workplace closing. https://web.archive.org/web/20200729210316/https://www.haitilibre.com/article-31395-haiticovid-19-il-n-y-a-plus-d-etat-d-urgence-sanitaire-en-haiti.html
notes_C4: Information available is conflicting:   UK GOV website: Gatherings of more than 10 people are not permitted. The wearing of masks in public places is compulsory. (date of update not specified)  http://web.archive.org/web/20210301181209/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/haiti/coronavirus    U.S. embassy: Any gathering on public roads involving more than 50 people is prohibited. (updated Feb. 2nd)  http://web.archive.org/web/20210301181113/https://ht.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    Garda world: As part of the domestic pandemic response, authorities have maintained minimal restrictions since the end of Haiti's state of health emergency in July 2020. However, a longstanding nationwide 0001-0400 nightly curfew will remain in effect until further notice, as will requirements that residents wear protective facemasks while in public places and comply with social-distancing standards of 1.5 meters (5 feet) between persons. (updated Feb. 4th)  http://web.archive.org/web/20210301181330/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/438751/haiti-officials-to-enforce-additional-covid-19-testing-requirements-for-international-travelers-from-feb-9-update-11

name: Hungary
notes_H1: Government launches Coronavirus website with tips on how to behave; https://koronavirus.gov.hu/
notes_H3: Chair of Hungarian Chamber of Doctors said on October 29th that current contact tracing efforts are insufficient to monitor the spread of the epidemic.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130162743/http://abouthungary.hu/news-in-brief/tighter-covid-19-restrictions-are-being-considered-by-operative-board/
notes_H2: Hungary aims to advance its testing policies:  Hungary plans to launch rapid antigen tests for coronavirus infections possibly as soon as Tuesday, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said on Monday, as testing in the central European country has struggled to keep up with the pace of infections.    Antigen tests detects proteins on the surface of the virus. They require an uncomfortable nasal or throat swab, and can produce results more quickly than PCR tests - which detect genetic material in the virus - but are considered less accurate.  https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN2742DJ
notes_C7: Downgrading to 0-- local measures in the Budapest and Pest counties expired on Jun 15
notes_C1: From 08 March to 22 March, additional restrictions are in place and include the closure of shops and services. Kindergartens and primary schools will be closed until 7 April.    - Kindergartens and primary schools are not allowed to open until the end of spring break, and the content of digital education is determined by the ministers concerned. Digital education in secondary schools and higher education will continue.    The Ministry said there would be an extraordinary break in kindergartens, with the first working day after that on April 7. Education in schools will take place on a digital work schedule outside the classroom until 31 March, with the first day of school after the spring break there after 7 April. All public education institutions have been informed of the measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314200716/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/emmi-hetfotol-hatalyosak-az-uj-intezkedesek-koznevelesi-intezmenyekben  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314200812/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/ket-het-szigoritasrol-dontott-kormany-abban-remenyben-hogy-husvetkor-ujra-tudjuk-inditani-az  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314195209/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/kormanyinfo-szigoritasokrol-dontott-kormany  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314193404/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/
notes_H6: From 08 March to 22 March, additional restrictions are in place and include the closure of shops and services. Kindergartens and primary schools will be closed until 7 April.    - Shops must be closed. Exception: grocery stores, pharmacies, petrol stations, drugstores, tobacco shops, shops selling materials and equipment essential for economic, agricultural and forestry activities, as well as pet food and feed shops, the market and the farmers' market.  - All services are suspended, except for private health, social, financial, postal and vehicle service services. In view of Women's Day, flower shops can remain open on Monday 8 March, but then they have to close.  - Restaurants will still be able to buy takeaways.  - Kindergartens and primary schools are not allowed to open until the end of spring break, and the content of digital education is determined by the ministers concerned. Digital education in secondary schools and higher education will continue.  - Given the low infection rates, daycares do not close.  - The evening curfew will remain in effect.  - Masking is mandatory on all streets and public areas within the populated area.  - If possible, keep a protective distance of at least 1.5 metres from the other person.  - Work is possible, but we recommend working from home where possible. In the administration, work at home may be ordered, except in the case of those involved in the defence.  - Outdoor sports activities are possible, where a distance of 1.5 meters can be maintained. Training of certified athletes is permitted, matches are only possible behind closed gates.  - Parks, arboretums and forests remain open.  - We're tightening up border crossings, but we're not restricting transit and freight traffic.  - We are extending wage subsidies and tax breaks to sectors that need to close.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314200812/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/ket-het-szigoritasrol-dontott-kormany-abban-remenyben-hogy-husvetkor-ujra-tudjuk-inditani-az  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314195209/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/cikkek/kormanyinfo-szigoritasokrol-dontott-kormany  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314193404/https://hu.usembassy.gov/covid-19/
notes_E2: "Measures were also taken to provide financial relief to households and corporates borrowers, including: (i) the provision of a grace period of repayment of loans to the Growth Funding Facility (subsidized lending to SMEs supported by the MNB); (ii) the extension of short-term loans to businesses until June 30; (iii) a repayment moratorium on all existing loans, corporate and retail, until the end of this year, with a reprofiling of debt payment thereafter to avoid an increase in monthly payments; and, (iv) a cap on the average annual percentage rate (APR) on new unsecured consumer credit at the central bank base rate (currently, 0.9 percent) plus 5 percent."     [as these measures are limited, I think this should be coded and back-coded as a '1']    http://web.archive.org/web/20200820152515/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: The government will ask the Hungarian Parliament tomorrow to grant another 90 days of extraordinary powers, and Hungary plans to introduce the following measures to take effect at midnight on November 11:  The state will reimburse hotels 80 percent of the value of bookings made for the next 30 days before November 8, on the condition that hotels will not lay off workers and continue to pay their salaries.  Employers will get a 30-day exemption from having to pay social contributions for staff at restaurants and recreational facilities Also, the state will cover 50 percent of these employees’ salaries on the condition that employees keep their jobs and continue receiving their salaries.  These measures will be in effect for 30 days.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201109233926/http://abouthungary.hu/blog/pm-orban-announces-new-restrictions-aimed-at-slowing-the-spread-of-the-coronavirus-heres-a-complete-list/
notes_C3: The government will ask the Hungarian Parliament tomorrow to grant another 90 days of extraordinary powers, and Hungary plans to introduce the following measures to take effect at midnight on November 11:  There will be a general ban on events.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201109233926/http://abouthungary.hu/blog/pm-orban-announces-new-restrictions-aimed-at-slowing-the-spread-of-the-coronavirus-heres-a-complete-list/
notes_C6: After Cabinet meeting on 3 November 2020 the Prime Minister announced that there will be restrictions on being outdoors in public between midnight and 5 a.m. This means that everyone must arrive home by midnight.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201109232835/http://abouthungary.hu/speeches-and-remarks/special-announcement-by-prime-minister-viktor-orban/  On November 5, the night curfew restriction came into effect.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201110005044/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/korlatozasok
notes_C8: Hungary has closed its borders since 1 September 'to all foreigners - with a few exceptions for military convoys humanitarian transit, business or diplomatic travel, as well as travelers from Poland, the Czech Republic and Slovakia. Additionally, Hungarian citizens returning from abroad will have to self-quarantine for two weeks, or until they provide authorities with two negative test results - whose cost will be at their own expense for non-essential travelling.'    https://archive.vn/B7T55

Kindergartens and primary schools will be closed until 7 April.    - Shops must be closed. Exception: grocery stores, pharmacies, petrol stations, drugstores, tobacco shops, shops selling materials and equipment essential for economic, agricultural and forestry activities, as well as pet food and feed shops, the market and the farmers' market.  - All services are suspended, except for private health, social, financial, postal and vehicle service services. In view of Women's Day, flower shops can remain open on Monday 8 March, but then they have to close.  - Restaurants will still be able to buy takeaways.  - Kindergartens and primary schools are not allowed to open until the end of spring break, and the content of digital education is determined by the ministers concerned. Digital education in secondary schools and higher education will continue.  - Given the low infection rates, daycares do not close.  - The evening curfew will remain in effect.  - Masking is mandatory on all streets and public areas within the populated area.  - If possible, keep a protective distance of at least 1.5 metres from the other person.  - Work is possible, but we recommend working from home where possible. In the administration, work at home may be ordered, except in the case of those involved in the defence.  - Outdoor sports activities are possible, where a distance of 1.5 meters can be maintained. notes_C4: The government will ask the Hungarian Parliament tomorrow to grant another 90 days of extraordinary powers, and Hungary plans to introduce the following measures to take effect at midnight on November 11:  Family gatherings and private events may only be attended by a maximum of 10 people.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201109233926/http://abouthungary.hu/blog/pm-orban-announces-new-restrictions-aimed-at-slowing-the-spread-of-the-coronavirus-heres-a-complete-list/

notes_C5: After Cabinet meeting on 3 November 2020 the Prime Minister announced that to reduce crowding on public transport we have ordered the provision of more frequent services during the morning and afternoon peak periods.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201109232835/http://abouthungary.hu/speeches-and-remarks/special-announcement-by-prime-minister-viktor-orban/     -	From November 3, free parking across the country came back into effect  .  -	A company providing local public transport services in Budapest and in cities with county status is obliged to  prepare a flight compression plan for the periods between 7 am and 9 am on weekdays and between 3 pm and 7 pm.  Information Leaflet:   http://web.archive.org/web/20201110005044/https://koronavirus.gov.hu/korlatozasok

Feb 22, 2021 - https://archive.vn/QAlCd#selection-913.0-913.73
notes_H2: **Upgraded to reflect recent improvements in testing capacity.**   Generally available with provision of free antigen tests and nasal testing at train stations.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210222212813/https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2021/02/14/indonesia-making-micro-lockdowns-as-new-measure-to-tackle-covid--19  http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/indonesia-covid-19-breath-test-train-stations-coronavirus-14105542

notes_C1: "At the moment, there are about 40 COVID-19 red zones in Indonesia, where schools must remain closed." - https://archive.vn/WsDKA, March 01, 2021    This report comports with the US Embassy report in mid-Feb about schools being shut: "Essential services are available, schools are closed, and public activities (including offices, religious activities, social and cultural gatherings and public transportation) continue to be limited to maintain social distancing." - https://archive.vn/qJAxN#selection-3161.0-3161.229
notes_H6: JAKARTA: The Indonesian authorities have made the wearing of face masks compulsory when one is away from home, as the total number of Covid-19 deaths in the country rose to 209 today since the start of the pandemic.    Indonesian President Joko Widodo said in a statement issued by the Presidential Secretariat today, that the wearing of face masks was in line with the call made by the World Health Organization (WHO).    Yesterday, Achmad Yurianto, the Indonesian government’s spokesman for COVID-19 matters, had advised the public to wear cloth face masks for a maximum of four hours before washing them for reuse.    “There is no need to use N-95 face masks. Face masks made of cloth are sufficient. The N-95 masks are only for healthcare personnel,” he said.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201014144009/https://www.nst.com.my/world/world/2020/04/581887/indonesia-makes-wearing-face-masks-compulsory-when-leaving-home
notes_E2: Since April (and initially for three months) the President announced that Indonesia's poorest households would receive free electricity and discounts to help them cope with the economic shocks caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. This debt relief benefits 24 million households in the 450-volt ampere (VA) category – the lowest out of six categories listed under existing regulations. The policy also provides a 50 percent discount in energy bills for 7 million households in the 900 VA category – the second lowest – for the same three months.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200824010126/https://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2020/03/31/jokowi-announces-free-electricity-discounts-for-households-hardest-hit-by-covid-19-impacts.html
notes_E1: The government is set to launch a financial stimulus scheme for active employees below a certain pay grade later this year amid the ongoing health crisis, State-Owned Enterprise (SOEs) Minister Erick Thohir said on Thursday. Through the program, employees earning less than Rp 5 million (US$344.16) per month will be eligible for monthly payments of Rp 600,000 over a period of four months.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200824003737/https://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2020/08/06/govt-to-provide-rp-600000-monthly-payments-to-employees-earning-less-than-rp-5-million-per-month.html
notes_C3: US Embassy in Indonesia: "While the government has lifted most restrictions regarding transit and daily activity, measures remain in place limiting large-scale gatherings and non-essential travel." https://web.archive.org/web/20201206224550/https://id.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/    In addition PSBBs are in effect in multiple places across the country giving Local Govt Officials broad authority to shut down workplaces and business in response to a rapid spread of the virus. Refer to notes for IDN C2 Dated Nov 19 2020.
notes_C6: PSBB measures are in effect until 22 February in Jakarta.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210222205929/https://indonesien.ahk.de/en/infocenter/news/news-details/covid-19-developments-in-indonesia  http://web.archive.org/web/20210222205830/https://megapolitan.kompas.com/read/2021/02/08/14541341/anies-psbb-jakarta-diperpanjang-2-pekan?page=1  https://archive.vn/IUF7U

notes_C4: Indonesia announced tighter social distancing measures in capital Jakarta, including [a] ban on gathering of more than five people to prevent the spread of coronavirus pandemic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200430182919/https://www.bloomberg.com/tosv2.html?vid=&uuid=811cb020-8b10-11ea-9ead-771ac57388a8&url=L25ld3MvYXJ0aWNsZXMvMjAyMC0wNC0wNy9qYWthcnRhLW9yZGVycy1vZmZpY2VzLXRvLWNsb3NlLWJhbnMtZ2F0aGVyaW5ncy10by1jb21iYXQtdmlydXM=

name: India
notes_H1: From March 5, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare started a range of initiatives as a part of a coordinated public campaign. They started running TV and radio spots, released covid-19 information videos on youtube, released comic books targeting awareness building among children and published more regular advisories on social distancing. Their engagement with the public on twitter also increased around the same time. Subsequently, the Ministry also organization several webinars and awareness programs.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200518162707/https://www.mohfw.gov.in/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200518162435/https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1a9DHjZmejE-Ep2PAu2OR8HBfLP0BLIk  https://web.archive.org/web/20200518163028/https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/Corona_comic_PGI.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20200518163218/https://twitter.com/MoHFW_INDIA
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20200414012528/https://icmr.nic.in/sites/default/files/upload_documents/Strategey_for_COVID19_Test_v4_09042020.pdf
notes_H2: "Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in India? Yes, tests are widely available throughout India in both private and government facilities.  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes, results are generally available in that timeframe. While in some cities results make take 24-48 hours when done by a private lab, there have been no reports of travel delays due to unavailable test results.  Travelers need to schedule tests with sufficient advance notice and should be aware that testing is generally not possible on Sundays as most labs are closed.  S. citizens should contact their doctor in India to request assistance scheduling a COVID test prior to travel. Citizens who do not have a doctor can locate a testing facility near them by going to the Indian Council for Medical Research website or by calling the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare’s toll free COVID helpline number by dialing 1075.Testing at government hospitals throughout India is free to the public.  Costs for testing at a private facility or in a private residence are set by state governments and range from Rs 400 to Rs 2250 per person.  Travelers can expect to receive results via phone or email."  - https://archive.vn/LGOaW#selection-2409.0-2435.59
notes_C7: "There shall be no restriction on inter-State and intra-state movement of goods and persons including those for cross land-border trade under treaties with neighboring countries. No separate permission/approval will be required for such movements."   Issued 01/27/2021 https://web.archive.org/web/20210201182323/https://www.mha.gov.in/sites/default/files/MHAorderdt_27012021.pdf  Extended 02/26/2021: Order dated on Jan 27 (see above) Extended to be in effect till Mach 31 2021: https://archive.vn/Bysk5;
notes_C1: Different states are requiring/recommending in-person attendance for students for different levels -- which also means that depending on the state, they are requiring students at certain grades/classes/levels to NOT attend.    "Haryana Schools For Classes 1-2 to Reopen From March 1 ... School Reopening News: The development comes after the state government opened the schools for classes 3-5 from February 24." - https://archive.vn/VHv5I#selection-733.0-733.124    https://archive.vn/DmOLd -   "Feb 28 2021: School reopening news: Mizoram, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, Bihar will be reopening their schools for more students and colleges from March 1.   Mizoram will be reopening its colleges, universities and other higher educational institutions from March 1.   Meghalaya has already reopened its schools for Classes 9 to 12.   Bihar will be reopening its schools for Classes 1 to 5 from March 1. Schools will be allowed to hold classes for each batch on alternate days. The government had issued guidelines to reopen their schools. Offline classes for students of Classes 9 to 12 had started on January 4 in Bihar. Following this on February 8, schools in Bihar were reopened for students of Classes 6 to 8.  Uttarakhand will be reopening its colleges and universities from tomorrow for the first time since the COVID-19 lockdown. Earlier, the schools in Uttarakhand for students of Classes 6 to 9 reopened on February 8. Schools in the state had been reopened earlier in November last year only for classes 10 and 12.  Uttar Pradesh will be reopening schools for Classes 1 to 5 from March 1."
notes_H6: "Face masks are almost universally worn in public, especially in urban areas, indoors, and on public transportation. notes_E1: No evidence found of an extension to policies introduced on March 26th, or new policies, to provide income support, in India.   On March 26th, the Government of India announced income support measures, due to last three months, including: “Help to poor: A total of 20.40 crores PMJDY women account-holders would be given an ex-gratia of Rs 500 per month for next three months.”; “Wage-earners below Rs 15,000 per month in businesses having less than 100 workers are at risk of losing their employment. Under this package, government proposes to pay 24 percent of their monthly wages into their PF accounts for next three months.”, and “Employees’ Provident Fund Regulations will be amended to include Pandemic as the reason to allow non-refundable advance of 75 percent of the amount or three months of the wages, whichever is lower, from their accounts.” Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823012825/https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/MoFPMGaribKalyanYojanaPackage.pdf
notes_C3: India remained in "Unlock 5.0" until Nov 30th.     Public gatherings are banned in "containment zones"  Outside of containment zones, limits on outdoor gatherings have been removed, while indoor gatherings are restricted to 50% capacity.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201130194933/https://indianexpress.com/article/india/unlock-5-coronavirus-guidelines-6619158/
notes_C6: Official guidance by the Min. of Home Affairs: https://web.archive.org/web/20210201182323/https://www.mha.gov.in/sites/default/files/MHAorderdt_27012021.pdf  It mostly states that States and local governments will place appropriate restrictions on workplaces, shops, public places, and public gatherings.    "Normal services are available throughout the country, including grocery stores ... . Most retail shops and restaurants are open, though they may have reduced hours and limits on the number of patrons allowed inside. Public gatherings are restricted in size. Contact tracing and temperature scans are widely practiced, and most restaurants will require patrons to provide their name and a mobile number in order to enter the establishment.  Local areas may have additional restrictions.";   snapshot from 02/22/21 https://archive.vn/LGOaW;  snapshot from 01/25/21 https://web.archive.org/web/20210215092844/https://in.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    Marking this as 3T because of flexibility that local authorities have to place restrictions on certain areas and localities.
notes_C8: 27th October 2020, The government has now decided to make a graded relaxation in visa and travel restrictions for more categories of foreign nationals and Indian nationals who wish to enter or leave India. Under this graded relaxation, the government has decided to restore with immediate effect all existing visas, except electronic visa, tourist visa and medical visa, the statement said. All international travellers will, however, have to strictly adhere to the guidelines of the Union Health Ministry regarding quarantine and other health/COVID-19 matters. Earlier, the Health Ministry issued a set of guidelines for international arrival as per which all travellers should submit a self-declaration form on the website of Delhi airport at least 72 hours before the scheduled travel.     India has so far established air bubbles arrangements with Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bahrain, Oman, Canada, France, Germany, Iraq, Japan, Maldives, Nigeria, Qatar, the UAE, Kenya, Ukraine, Bhutan, the UK, and the US.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201030085828if_/https://www.livemint.com/news/india/who-all-can-fly-abroad-and-which-countries-from-india-new-international-travel-rules-here-11603676272956.html
notes_C2: Work from home should be followed as far as possible by the National Directive of COVID 19 management.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201013071047/https://covidindia.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/MHAOrderDt_30092020.pdf
notes_C4: All districts in the state of Rajasthan will be placed under Section 144 (restrictions on gatherings above 4) from Nov 21.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130195402/https://zeenews.india.com/india/night-curfew-section-144-check-latest-govt-covid-19-restrictions-in-delhi-mumbai-ahmedabad-2325800.html    Additionally, to arrest a second wave in Uttar Pradesh, the Yogi Adityanath government clamped Section 144 in the state capital, as Lucknow now is among six cities with high virus load. In accordance with the prioritization as guided by the NEGVAC, the next phase of vaccination is due for citizens of age appropriate categories, including initially the people above 60 years of age and those aged from 45 years to 60 years and have the comorbidities. To augment and simplify the process of registration vaccination, the MoHFW is coming with COWIN 2.0, based on the feedbacks received during the implementation of Phase 1 of Covid-19 vaccination drive."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210228110952/https://www.mohfw.gov.in/pdf/GuidancedocCOWIN2.pdf  - https://archive.vn/TNRgi    "This phase of vaccination is for citizens above 60 years of age and those aged from 45 years to 60 years and have the following comorbidities. These protections include a rent freeze and a 90-day notice period when ending a tenancy":  http://web.archive.org/web/20210130185538/https://www.citizensinformation.ie/en/housing/renting_a_home/tenancies_and_covid19.html
notes_E1: An eligible employer will be supported up to 70% of an employee’s take home income up to a maximum weekly tax free payment of €410 (that is, 70% of take home weekly income of €38,000 per anuum).    The scheme will provide support on incomes up to €76,000 or twice average earnings. It will be capped at net €350 for incomes between €38,000 and €76,000. The employer is expected to make best efforts to maintain as close to 100% of normal income as possible for the subsidised period. Unemployment Payment will now get an increased payment of €350 per week (instead of €203) at their next payment date; self employed entitled to this latter scheme. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200430221715/https://www.gov.ie/en/press-release/eaad55-government-announces-new-covid-19-income-support-scheme/#self-employed-workers]. The 70% coverage appears to apply only forformal workers

name: Iran
notes_H1: There are regular updates on this page. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118065126/http://irangov.ir/cat/509/2
notes_H2: No Changes in policy per previous note  Notes  'Dr Rouhani said, "The Ministry of Health now performs 25,000 COVID-19 tests per day and the government will provide the cost of another 15,000 tests. Thus, the number of daily corona tests in the country will reach 40,000".  The president added, "If the Ministry of Health has to buy new COVID-19 test kits, the government will help, and today I told the Minister of Health that in the first phase we will buy 20 million new kits, but in the meantime, we will buy as much as necessary".'    http://archive.today/2020.10.26-185526/http://www.president.ir/en/117856

Uk Government Foreign Office advice does not refer to general travel restrictions, although notes that there may be regional variations introduced at short notice.    The announcement on 14th October includes the following:    "President Hassan Rouhani authorized travel restrictions to be imposed in the capital Tehran as well as in Karaj, Mashhad, Isfahan and Urmia, said Health Minister Saeed Namaki on Wednesday."    "According to the new restrictions, only the cars belonging to the citizens of these five cities are allowed to enter their hometown, and other cars will be denied entry, unless they prove they live in one of those cities."    Link:  http://archive.today/2020.10.26-200607/http://irangov.ir/detail/349121
notes_C1: No change in policy.
notes_H6: According to Aljazeera, a mandatory mask rule will continue to be enforced across the country. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118060512/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/12/5/iran-extends-restrictions-as-covid-19-deaths-surpass-50000
notes_E2: In Iran, employees can defer tax payments for the next three months, and the 3 million poorest Iranians will receive an additional cash subsidy. There will be additional tax relief for small to medium-sized enterprises. The 2019 fourth quarter VAT returns were postponed to April 19 and qualifying businesses may apply to extend the deadline further to May 20. Iran has announced a support package worth about 10 percent of GDP in response to the coronavirus.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202121809/https://taxfoundation.org/coronavirus-country-by-country-responses/#Iran
notes_E1: https://web.archive.org/web/20201202121809/https://taxfoundation.org/coronavirus-country-by-country-responses/#Iran    In Iran, employees can defer tax payments for the next three months, and the 3 million poorest Iranians will receive an additional cash subsidy. There will be additional tax relief for small to medium-sized enterprises. The 2019 fourth quarter VAT returns were postponed to April 19 and qualifying businesses may apply to extend the deadline further to May 20. Iran has announced a support package worth about 10 percent of GDP in response to the coronavirus.
notes_C3: During the Eid al-Adha festivities (30th-31st July 2020), authorities have banned the slaughter of livestock, except for in designated slaughterhouses in accordance with strict guidelines, and where livestock should be packaged before distribution.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200802114703/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1709886/middle-east
notes_C6: Coding updated from !g to 2T, as Iran began implementing a system of city-wide lockdowns in areas that were particularly badly impacted with Coronavirus cases in November of 2020, with the following reported:      Targeted stay-at-home requirements implemented in cities most affected by Covid-19 have been implemented by the Iranian government - "According to the spokesperson for the National Coronavirus Headquarters, more than 100 cities categorized as high-risk red zones are partially shut down under the new program. In these areas, which include almost all provincial capitals, restrictions are imposed on the businesses and activities of the occupation categories 2, 3, and 4 (non-essential occupations). The limitations enforced in the orange zones would apply to 150 cities, while at least 155 other towns will come into the category of yellow zones with low risk of coronavirus, the spokesperson added. According to the new restrictions in the areas categorized as red zone, only a third of the employees will be allowed to leave home for work purposes, and road travels (entering and leaving the zone) would be also limited." - https://web.archive.org/web/20210222063001/https://ifpnews.com/iran-starts-enforcing-partial-lockdown-to-contain-covid-19     This is also reported on the official Iranian Government web site, at https://web.archive.org/web/20210222161603/http://irangov.ir/detail/351030
notes_C8: Rouhollah Latifi told IRNA on Saturday that the border seal-off for the purpose of quarantine has remained only with two neighboring states.  With enforcing protective and health protocols in coordination with two neighboring states, the remaining borders will reopen, the spokesman said.Earlier this month, Iran’s acting minister of industry, mining and trade announced that the country’s 80 percent of trade border points, which had been closed due to the coronavirus pandemic, have been reopened.  Link:https://web.archive.org/web/20200725080432/https://www.tehrantimes.com/news/449858/Cross-border-trade-running-despite-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C2: Targeted measures announced affecting 43 cities.  Details of each of the "occupation groups" referred to in this announcement are given (ranging from schools, universities, shopping malls, social cultural and religious events).      "Government Spokesman Ali Rabiei announced on Saturday that from Monday, October 26 until November 20, only half of the government employees will be at work.    The government spokesman noted that the National Coronavirus Headquarters has approved tough restrictions for 43 cities that are in emergency situation due to non-compliance with health protocols; and these restrictions will be applied as of Monday this week. He said the list of these cities will be announced to the governors later on.    Rabiei stated that with these restrictions, occupation groups 2, 3 and 4 will be shut down to harness the disease prevalence."    “Obviously, jobs related to daily life and essential needs of the people, including emergency services, service and administrative centers, security centres, chain stores, supermarkets, bakeries, etc., will continue their operation,” he noted.     http://archive.today/2020.10.26-170449/http://irangov.ir/detail/349645
notes_C4: https://web.archive.org/web/20201202120136/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1756581/middle-east    JEDDAH:: Mosques, schools, universities, beauty salons, cafes, gyms, museums, theaters and swimming pools in 25 of Iran’s 31 provinces were ordered to close for 10 days from next Wednesday.    In Tehran, the closure of beauty salons, teahouses, cinemas, libraries and fitness clubs has been extended for a week.     Police will make unannounced visits to other high-risk businesses, and any found to be breaking health rules will be shut down. Weddings, funeral gatherings and conferences in the capital have been banned.
notes_H7: A.    Iran began its rollout of the Russian Sputnik V vaccine, according to a live broadcast on state television.   Health Minister Saeed Namaki said the top priority groups for vaccination are doctors and nurses working at intensive care units of the hospitals.  https://archive.vn/tGm5s
notes_C5: No changes cases continue to increase  As in previous note, UK Foreign Office continues to report that "Large events such as concerts and sports matches remain either cancelled or held behind closed doors."  http://archive.today/2020.10.26-201833/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/iran/coronavirus    In addition, targeted measures are in place for 43 cities involving shutting down "occupation groups 2, 3 and 4"    "Occupation group 4 are social, cultural and religious events, sports such as wrestling, karate, and judo, holy shrines, dorms, cafes, teahouses, zoos, fun fairs, indoor sports, and aqua recreational centres. "    http://archive.today/2020.10.26-170449/http://irangov.ir/detail/349645

In addition, the following private labs offer testing and are authorized by the Government of Iraq to provide tests to those intending to travel  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314204822/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
