notes_H6: In the Iraqi Kurdistan Region (IKR), Decree #57 (December 24, 2020) imposes a 20,000 to 50,000 Iraqi dinar fine (approximately $17 to $42) on individuals who do not wear masks in public and on public transportation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210126180831/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: https://web.archive.org/web/20200525200132/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19    Key Policy Responses as of May 21, 2020    FISCAL  To support the Ministry of Health's efforts to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, the Central Bank of Iraq has established a fund to collect donations from financial institutions with initial donations of $20 million from the CBI itself and $5 million from the Trade Bank of Iraq. The authorities have reduced spending in non-essential areas and have safeguarded budgetary allocations to the Ministry of Health. The Supreme Committee for Health and National Safety is introducing a cash transfer scheme, targeting workers in the private sector that do not receive salaries or benefits from the government. Each eligible individual is expected to receive 30,000 dinars each month, with an expected cost of around 600 billion dinars over 2 months.    MONETARY AND MACRO-FINANCIAL  The Central Bank has announced a moratorium on interest and principal payments by small and medium-sized enterprises through its directed lending initiative (the “one trillion ID” initiative), and encouraged banks to extend maturities of all loans as they deem appropriate. The Central Bank also encouraged the use of electronic payments to contain the transmission of the virus, and instructed vendors to eliminate commissions on such payments for the next six months.    EXCHANGE RATE AND BALANCE OF PAYMENTS  No measures.
notes_E1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200525200132/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19    Key Policy Responses as of May 21, 2020    FISCAL  To support the Ministry of Health's efforts to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, the Central Bank of Iraq has established a fund to collect donations from financial institutions with initial donations of $20 million from the CBI itself and $5 million from the Trade Bank of Iraq. The authorities have reduced spending in non-essential areas and have safeguarded budgetary allocations to the Ministry of Health. Each eligible individual is expected to receive 30,000 dinars each month, with an expected cost of around 600 billion dinars over 2 months.    MONETARY AND MACRO-FINANCIAL  The Central Bank has announced a moratorium on interest and principal payments by small and medium-sized enterprises through its directed lending initiative (the “one trillion ID” initiative), and encouraged banks to extend maturities of all loans as they deem appropriate. The Central Bank also encouraged the use of electronic payments to contain the transmission of the virus, and instructed vendors to eliminate commissions on such payments for the next six months. notes_C3: Wedding halls, funeral homes, and mosques will be closed until further notice.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210222181239/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Starting February 18, the Government of Iraq of will impose full curfew on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  A partial curfew from 8PM to 5AM will take place on Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Iraqi security forces, ministry of health staff, service departments, bakeries, grocery stores, and pharmacies are exempted from the full curfew.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222181239/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: The January 14, 2021 international travel restrictions imposed by the Government of Iraq were lifted as of March 10, 2021.  U.S. citizens may face complications with regional travel and should work closely with airlines when planning travel.    Entry and Exit Requirements  Are U.S. citizens permitted to enter? Yes.  As of March 10, previous travel restrictions for travelers from the U.S. have been lifted.  There is currently a ban on tourist travel to Iraq. S. may enter Iraq with a negative PCR test and a valid visa.  Airports throughout Iraq are open. Travelers should be aware that flight suspensions may be implemented at any time and on short notice.  Is a negative COVID-19 test (PCR and/or serology) required for entry? Yes.  The PCR and/or serology results must be completed less than 72 hours prior to departure for Iraq.  Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry? Yes.  Quarantine Information: Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314204822/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: The measures include:    Imposing a total curfew on Friday, Saturday and Sunday of each week from 18/2/2021, and a partial curfew between 8 PM and 5 AM on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday until 8/3/2021.  The curfew excludes employees of the Ministry of Health, the security forces and government departments providing essential services. It also excludes grocery, fruit and vegetable stores, bakeries and pharmacies which will be allowed to open from 5 AM to 7 PM when the total curfew is in force, media.   Order the closure of all beauty centres from 18/2/2021 for a period of two weeks  Order the closure of entertainment centres, parks, cinemas, sport halls, gyms and swimming pools from 18/2/2021 for a period of two weeks  Order the closure of malls and cafes from 18/2/2021  for a period of two weeks  Order the closure of  restaurants, and permit delivery services only, from 18/2/2021 for a period of two weeks,  Reduce the working hours at government departments and institutions by 50% except for the Ministry of Health  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314203737/https://gds.gov.iq/covid-19-iraqi-government-imposes-nationwide-curfew-other-restrictions/
notes_C4: Ban the conduct of public funeral services and mourning rites, and impose a fine of 5 million Iraqi dinars for any violation of these rules  Order the closure of all mosques and other places of worship until further notice  Ban wedding ceremonies at event halls from 18/2/2021 until further notice, and impose a fine of 5 million Iraqi dinars for any violation  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314203737/https://gds.gov.iq/covid-19-iraqi-government-imposes-nationwide-curfew-other-restrictions/
notes_C5: Transportation Options  Is public transportation operating? Yes.  Taxis, trains, and public buses are operational, as are some minibuses.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314204822/https://iq.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Iceland
notes_H1: Targeted Public information for Travellers  (https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.landlaeknir.is/english/news/detail/item38811/information-for-travelers)  About novel coronavirus, now called COVID-19:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201028151628/https://www.landlaeknir.is/um-embaettid/greinar/grein/item38798/corona-virus-china-2019
notes_H3: not sure about the start date, but it should be after the first case (Feb 28) and before the report (MAR 9th)   ““From the beginning, Icelandic authorities have taken important steps for effective detection of infections. Therefore, we have been able to identify a high number of infected individuals,” Þórólfur Guðnason, Chief Epidemiologist says. “The National Police has contacted all Icelanders who have returned from high-risk areas and those who may have been in contact with them to reiterate requirements for quarantine."  https://www.government.is/news/article/?NewsId=422e5545-5e45-11ea-9455-005056bc530c  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.government.is/news/article/?NewsId=422e5545-5e45-11ea-9455-005056bc530c
notes_H2: the report on Mar 13 says that "Those numbers include the first results of the voluntary tests on people with no symptoms, which started last Friday." https://web.archive.org/web/20200412153448/https://www.buzzfeed.com/albertonardelli/coronavirus-testing-iceland
notes_C1: Primary schools:  Primary schools are permitted to continue schoolwork on condition that employees ensure they maintain the 2 metre social distancing when face masks are not used. No more than 30 individuals born 2004 or earlier may be in the same area. This also applies to after school centres, community centres and sports activities in primary schools. As a rule, parents and relatives are not to enter school buildings except when absolutely necessary.    Secondary schools and universities:  School work in secondary schools may continue, provided that students and staff can ensure at least 2 metre social distancing and the maximum number of students in each schoolroom does not exceed 30. The mixing of students between groups is not permitted during classes but employees and teachers are permitted to go between groups. The limit on the number of people and mixing of groups may be departed from in shared premises within the school, such as entrance, foyers, in restrooms and hallways if face masks are used. Under certain circumstance, such as practical classes, art classes, clinical studies, students and teachers must use face masks.    Physical contact between students during training sessions and competition is permitted in sports classes at secondary schools. The 2-metre social distancing rule, however, must be observed in changing rooms and other areas outside competition and training facilities.    Shared contact surfaces in classrooms are to be disinfected after the use of each student group. In addition, shared equipment and contact surfaces are to be disinfected daily and emphasis placed on personal infection prevention measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028085021/https://www.covid.is/sub-categories/children  https://web.archive.org/web/20201028085202/https://www.covid.is/sub-categories/what-is-ban-on-public-events
notes_H6: As of August 14th: In situations that demand closeness between individuals, such as in public transport, facial masks should be used.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200930165211/https://www.covid.is/sub-categories/icelands-response
notes_E2: Tax reliefs already implemented early on during the crisis, especially for the tourism sector but other sectors could postpone their tax payments as well or had them reduced.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504134335/https://www.government.is/news/article/2020/03/10/-Economic-response-to-COVID-19-/
notes_E1: No change: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 *but no suggestion of informal workers being entitled to income support, as is coded above but without evidence
notes_C3: Venues for public events are able to open.  "Stage performances, choirs, cinema showings and other cultural events: Up to 50 persons will be permitted on stage, both at rehearsals and at performances. Face-masks shall be worn where possible and the 2-metre social distancing rule shall be observed to the extent possible. Audiences of up to 100 adults and 100 children born in or after 2005 may be admitted; they shall be seated in numbered seats with their names recorded, and adults shall wear face-masks."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210117075249/https://www.government.is/government/covid-19/covid-19-news/2021/01/08/COVID-19-Relaxations-to-the-restrictions-on-gathering-sizes-to-apply-from-13-January/
notes_C8: As of 20 March 2020, foreign nationals - except EU/EEA, EFTA or UK nationals - are not allowed to enter Iceland unless they can demonstrate that their travel is essential.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201022184340/https://utl.is/index.php/en/about-directorate-of-immigration/covid-19/currently-not-in-iceland-q-a-for-non-eu-eea-nationals
notes_C2: Bars, clubs, and slot machine venues, closed since early October, are permitted to reopen today subject to certain restrictions. Like restaurants, bars are subject to gathering limits, must close no later than 10.00pm, and may not admit new guests after 9.00pm. All guests must be seated and bar service is not permitted.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210215202745/https://www.icelandreview.com/society/iceland-relaxes-domestic-covid-19-restrictions-today/
notes_C4: Audiences at performances in venues such as theatres, cinemas, concerts, etc., may not consist of more than 20 persons.  Link: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.government.is/news/article/2020/10/07/COVID-19-Stricter-rules-to-combat-infection-in-the-metropolitan-area-/
notes_H7: A, C:    Iceland received the first doses of COVID-19 vaccine on December 28 and vaccination began on December 29. At the moment, Iceland is expecting to receive vaccine for at least 30,000 people before the end of March.  COVID-19 vaccination is optional and free of charge in Iceland. Vaccines are being administered according to priority groups defined by health authorities, though the Chief Epidemiologist may grant exceptions to that order. The first to be vaccinated were frontline healthcare workers and nursing home residents. According to the current vaccination schedule, the next priority groups are people over the age of 70, paramedics who transport COVID-19 patients, and some additional healthcare workers        https://web.archive.org/web/20210106190138/https://www.icelandreview.com/ask-ir/whats-the-status-of-covid-19-vaccination-in-iceland/      http://web.archive.org/web/20210103140447/https://www.covid.is/categories/information-on-covid-19-vaccine

name: Israel
notes_H1: The coronavirus was communicated by the government and media since late January, but official awareness campaign by ads was launched on Feb 9: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=19IGaFdDvt4
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20201103133754/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/guides/information-corona?chapterIndex=2
notes_H2: When in doubt, there is no doubt, get tested!  Starting Today, Anyone Can Be Tested, and if You Have the Slightest Doubt – Don’t Hesitate, Get Tested   Anyone wishing to be tested for coronavirus may do so     In the Home Front Command's testing sites (whether "Test and Drive" or the pedestrian site) – no referral is needed. Call *3101 to schedule an appointment    In the HMO clinics – using a referral that can be provided through your insuring HMO's customer service center (you do not need a physician appointment)   If you feel well (no symptoms), if you do not know that you came in contact with a confirmed patient and if you did not return from a red destination – you do not need to self-isolate until receiving your test results.    Anyone tested due to any reason that requires self-isolation is required to self-isolate. In case of isolation, due to arrival from abroad or due to contact with a confirmed patient, negative test results do not absolve you from the isolation requirement. You need to complete you required isolation period in full. If your test results return positive, you are required to self-isolate and to follow confirmed patients' guidelines.      Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201110055501/https://www.gov.il/en/Departments/Guides/ramzor-cites-guidelines?chapterIndex=6
notes_C7: On the 1st March, government movement restrictions put in place to control COVID19 during the Purim festival were lifted.  https://www.siasat.com/israel-lifts-night-curfew-2100373/
notes_C1: Reopening policy begins in schools, access dependent on rate of virus in locality and age group.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210211222820/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/news/09022021-01
notes_H6: Masks are required while in public settings and at work.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201110061431/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/general/corona-masks
notes_E2: ***Recoded from 2 to 1. Evidence seems to draw primarily from businesses rather than households. The whole column should be reviewed.     Limited evidence of policies for household, but no broad or comprehensive policies found.     See previous coding note:     Keeping debtors connected to electricity  If you owe a debt to the Israel Electric Corporation you won’t be disconnected.  Contact the Israel Electric Corporation if you’ve been disconnected or if you have a pre-paid bill counter.    Business continuity  ILS 5.2 billion  Get help paying your fixed expenses, such as rent and utilities - Apply for a grant for businesses for help with fixed expenses during the coronavirus crisis  If you’re a small business owner whose business has been hurt by the coronavirus crisis, you may be eligible for up to ILS 400,000 to cover your fixed expenses.  The grant sum depends on the impact to your business turnover.  The grant will be paid to small businesses with a turnover of up to 20 million, by the Tax Authority.    Postponement of payments to VAT, NII, electricity, water, etc.  ILS 9 billion  VAT, NII, electricity, and water payments have been postponed to provide relief to businesses.  Postponement of electricity bills for small and medium businesses from various sectors on a case-by-case basis.  If your payment hasn’t been postponed, contact the service provider directly.    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201110054710/https://www.gov.il/en/Departments/Guides/mof_economic_plan?chapterIndex=6
notes_E1: Pay for workers on unpaid leave  ILS 15.4 billion  Claim up to 80% of your last salary  To claim the unpaid leave pay:    Register with the Israel Employment Service - https://www.taasuka.gov.il/he/pages/registertolishka.aspx  Submit a claim to the NII - https://www.btl.gov.il/benefits/Unemployment/Pages/submit.aspx    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201110054710/https://www.gov.il/en/Departments/Guides/mof_economic_plan?chapterIndex=6
notes_C3: Events are now allowed under capacity restrictions and organiser guidelines for green pass holders only.      For those without a green pass, events are restricted by the virtue of the restrictions on gatherings (10 people inside, 20 people outside).    Coding as 1 because measures are very much in place - but only those with a green pass can access.  Please see https://archive.vn/4zluu
notes_C6: On the 1st March, government movement restrictions put in place to control COVID19 during the Purim festival were lifted.  https://www.siasat.com/israel-lifts-night-curfew-2100373/
notes_C8: "We decided to close the skies of Israel, and foreigners will not be allowed to enter the country, except in exceptional cases such as diplomats, due to the spread of the new coronavirus mutation,” Gendelman said, adding, “This decision is necessary as we are obligated to preserve your health and your life and it will currently be in effect for 10 days.”    Authorities have also introduced new strict restrictions requiring all citizens returning to Israel starting Wednesday from abroad to quarantine in a “state-run hotel facility,” according to a local media report.    Those returning from the UK, Denmark and South Africa were already required to quarantine from Sunday, news outlet Globes reported.    “All non-Israeli passport holders will henceforth be barred from the country including those with special permits to attend family events, students studying in Israel and business people,” according to the report."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201221144335/https://english.alarabiya.net/en/coronavirus/2020/12/21/New-coronavirus-strain-Israel-suspends-air-travel-bans-entry-of-foreigners
notes_C2: Tougher restrictions for Purim ended at 5:00 AM on Sunday, February 28.    Source: https://archive.vn/1NoWe
notes_C4: The cabinet approves the Health Ministry regulations for the Third Phase beginning Sunday 7 March. These changes include the lessening of gathering restrictions.     Gatherings are now restricted to up to 20 people indoors and up to 50 people outdoors. If the gathering place includes both indoor and outdoor spaces – up to 20 people.     NB The press release published on 1 March notes "Gathering restrictions: Up to 20 people indoors and up to 50 people outdoors (except in red localities where the ratio will stay at 10:20). " That red localities restriction is not included in the release of 6 March.    Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308185332/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/news/06032021-01    https://archive.vn/Cb3Cq
notes_H7: HMOs are offering the vaccine to all members over 16. The army is vaccinating forces. The percentage of the population vaccinated is now over 47% indicating both availability and delivery. Vaccination is voluntary.    "The majority of the Israeli population will be vaccinated. In the first stage, certain groups, such as children (under 16 years of age) and recovered patients, will not be vaccinated due to a lack of information about vaccination among these populations."    Percentage of vaccinated in the total population: 21/2  	• 47.06% first dose vaccinated  	• 32.29% second dose vaccinated    Who will get the vaccine first?  	• The vaccine is given to individuals who are 16 years of age or older.  	• Pregnant women or women who plan to be pregnant can get the vaccine.   	• People with an acute illness, especially if their body temperature is 38 degrees Celsius or higher, should recover before getting the vaccine.    Who will not get the vaccine at this stage?  	• People who are younger than 16 years of age.  	• People with a history of severe allergic reactions. They are required to tell staff before they are vaccinated and ask if they can have the vaccine.  	• Certified recovered COVID-19 patients.    Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20210224150712if_/https://datadashboard.health.gov.il/COVID-19/general    https://web.archive.org/web/20210223153943/https://govextra.gov.il/ministry-of-health/covid19-vaccine/en-covid19-vaccination-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226115508/https://govextra.gov.il/ministry-of-health/covid19-vaccine/en-covid19-vaccine-faqs/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226113624/https://www.timesofisrael.com/poll-some-25-of-israelis-who-havent-vaccinated-have-no-intention-of-doing-so/
notes_C5: The Ministerial Committee on Dealing with the Corona Crisis has approved  the proposal of the Ministry of Health to extend the transportation regulations by an additional 28 days, until the 28.01.2021. In addition, it has been decided that in a taxi, a person suffering from a disability will be permitted to sit next to the driver, if they cannot sit on the back seat due to their disability.    Note: These measures were approved on December 30 meaning these were already in place previously.    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104215849/https://www.gov.il/en/departments/news/29122020-04

name: Jamaica
notes_H1: "Minister of Health and Wellness, Dr. the Hon. Christopher Tufton, says a Ministry-led national public education campaign is under way to heighten citizens’ awareness about the novel coronavirus.  Addressing journalists at a media briefing at the Ministry’s offices in New Kingston on February 5, Dr. Tufton said newspaper advertisements have commenced, and there are social media postings on his personal page as well as those of the Ministry and Regional Health Authorities.  “I understand we will hear some radio ads coming out soon,” the Minister added.  “We would have done a series of interviews… myself [and] the various medical team members. I get a call almost every day for a comment… and I try to respond because I know it’s important." https://web.archive.org/web/20200416163126/https://jis.gov.jm/public-education-campaign-to-heighten-awareness-about-coronavirus/
notes_H3: Actions the Ministry of Health and Wellness are taking include continuing “contact tracing, testing and quarantine of MOHW workers who are contacts of a confirmed case at the MOHW Head Office.”, and escalating “the identification of cases and contacts, contact tracing, establishment of national quarantine and isolation facilities and installation of equipment and materials for case management.” The Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) situation report for Jamaica states 8,064 contacts have been identified and 2,465 close contacts are being followed (contact tracing figures were updated at 18:00 on September 3rd). Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906102239/https://www.paho.org/en/situation-report-covid-19-jamaica
notes_H2: Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Jamaica? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes  U.S. Citizens can obtain a COVID-19 test in Jamaica at the following locations: https://www.visitjamaica.com/travelauthorization/testing-labs. Travelers are responsible for costs of testing. Cost of tests range from $60.00 to $100.00 for antigen tests and from $150.00 to $230.00 for PCR tests.  Method of result delivery to the traveler varies by location.  /web/20210216003154/https://jm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-jamaica/
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes   /web/20210216003154/https://jm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-jamaica/
notes_C1: Monday 4th Jan sees the start of the new school term, with some 129 schools offering face-to-face teaching and learning, providing they are safe to do so. Though some schools are still recommended to close and delivering virtual learning     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104145320/https://www.loopjamaica.com/content/129-schools-approved-face-face-learning-january-4
notes_H6: On April 20th, during a virtual press conference in Jamaica House, in Kingston, Prime Minister, the Most Hon. Andrew Holness said: “The wearing of a mask is now mandatory in all public spaces and that would include all public passenger vehicles". Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200906212950/https://jis.gov.jm/all-jamaicans-must-wear-a-mask-in-public-pm/
notes_E2: The Government through the NHT put in place special relief for mortgagors who may lose their jobs as a result of COVID-19. Effective immediately, mortgagors who are laid off can apply for a moratorium on all loan payments of three months in the first instance. The NHT will also provide a special one-off offer to contributors, the option to reschedule delinquent loans. The option will only be made available where the Trust has not already entered into a commitment to dispose of the property.    The opportunity will be extended for 6 months, effective April 1, 2020. During this period, the NHT will consider each mortgage on a case-by-case basis, with the option to extend the tenor of the loan or reduce the interest rate.    The measures include:    - Effective April 1, 2020 the NHT will reduce interest rates on all new loans by 1% (benefitting some 8,000 new mortgagors annually)  - All existing NHT loans will be reduced by 0.5% (benefitting some100,000 existing mortgagors).  Interest rate discounts currently offered to special groups, such as mortgagors aged 55 years and over, the disabled as well as public sector workers will continue.  - The interest rate discounts for the disabled will be effective April 1, 2020 and will also be extended to include the parents of disabled children.  - The NHT will expand the Intergenerational Mortgage Program. Beginning April 1, 2020, the NHT will extend this benefit for eligible applicants for other loan products, such as open market purchases and construction loans. Funding under this Program will be capped at the prevailing loan limit.  - The NHT will also provide greater benefits to contributors over 65 years. Persons in this category will be designated as Voluntary Contributors and therefore be able to access housing benefits with tenures extending up to age 70.  - The NHT will establish a special arrangement whereby, following maturity of the loan, the insurance arrangement at special rates may be continued. The cost savings will enable beneficiaries to continue the protection of their properties in a period of life when their earning power may be at its lowest.  - The NHT will, during FY2020/21, seek to leverage its current mortgage loan portfolio through a securitization transaction to generate additional inflows.    Covid Student’s Loan Bureau  Jamaica will be deferring principal and interest payments on student loans for the three-month period April – June to cushion the impact on young graduates while giving new graduates 14 months to start payment their student loans after graduation. The Constituency Development Fund will also be increased by $3 million to address Covid Compassionate Grants and Care packages for the vulnerable on a constituency basis. This will cost approximately $200 million.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200531114621/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/jamaica-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_E1: Covid Allocation of Resources for Employees (CARE) program  All grants under CARE:  1. SET CASH - SUPPORTING EMPLOYEES WITH TRANSFER OF CASH  2. BEST CASH - BUSINESS EMPLOYEE SUPPORT & TRANSFER OF CASH  3. COVID-19 GENERAL GRANTS  4. COVID-19 COMPASSIONATE GRANTS  5. COVID-19 PATH GRANTS  6. COVID-19 SMALL BUSINESS GRANTS  7. COVID-19 TOURISM GRANTS  8. COVID-19 STUDENT LOAN RELIEF  9. OTHER COVID-19 SUPPORT PROGRAMMES  The Business Employee Support and Transfer of Cash (BEST Cash):  This will provide temporary cash transfers to registered businesses operating in the hotel, tours, attraction companies, segments of the tourism industry who are licensed with the Jamaica Tourist Board based on the number of workers they keep employed who are under the income tax threshold of $1.5 million. When such businesses file and pay their payroll returns as usual on the 15th of April, May and June, for each employee, with taxable income that is less than 1.5 on whose behalf statutory returns are applied, the Government will transfer funds at a rate of $9,000 per fortnight to that tourism related business, by direct transfer to their bank account, paid monthly. For the months of April, May and June that will equate to $54,000 for each employee they retain whose taxable income is less than $1.5 million    Informal sector - The Government will allocate $1 billion in additional funding to the Ministry of Labour and Social Security to provide Covid Grants to those who are marginally self-employed and informally employed.    The application portal for CARE opened on 9th April, 2020.     Minimum wage in Jamaica is $7000 per week i.e. $28000 p.m. Under this package, the maximum allocation over three months (April, May, June) is $57,000 i.e. $18,000 p.m. Hence, this will be less than 50% of lost income for many workers.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200531114547/https://jis.gov.jm/media/2020/04/CARE-Brochure-Ministry-of-Finance-2020.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20200531114621/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/jamaica-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: gatherings of more than 10 people in any public place are not permitted  weddings have been banned  churches can perform funerals of up to 10 family members and up to 5 religious leaders  /web/20210216001754/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C6: There is an island wide curfew from 8pm to 5am.  /web/20210216001754/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C8: 2. Jamaica’s most recent disaster risk management order, published on August 5th, stated: “All persons arriving in Jamaica are required to undergo a health screening and risk assessment.”  “ A person seeking to enter Jamaica at any time during the period from August 7, 2020, to September 30, 2020, who is ordinarily resident in Jamaica shall, on being permitted to enter Jamaica, be required to remain in quarantine, in isolation from other persons, in accordance with— (a) a home quarantine order; or (b) a Government facility quarantine order, issued to the person by a Medical Officer (Health)”   In the case of a “non-resident visiting Jamaica for business (duration of stay-less than fourteen days)” “the Medical Officer (Health), Medical Officer or public health officer has determined that you require testing for COVID19 and you are to be quarantined until released by the Parish Health Department. If you test negative and will be in country for less than fourteen days, the Parish Health Officer will advise you of your result and your release from quarantine.”  Also, any “non-national visiting Jamaica for tourism and staying in the resilient corridor” is “required to remain in the hotel property stated below within the COVID19 Tourism Resilient Corridor for the duration of your stay. You are required to report symptoms 842 PROCLAMATIONS, RULES AND REGULATIONS [AUGUST 5, 2020 to the health desk in your hotel or to the health department and based on assessment, you may be required to do a COVID-19 PCR test”.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906095950/https://jis.gov.jm/media/2020/08/Disaster-Risk-ManagementEnforcement-Measures-No.-11-Amendment-Order.pdf  Also, “from 20 August, visitors from high risk places the USA, Brazil, Mexico and the Dominican Republic will be required to upload a valid Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test result, no more than seven days old. Approval for travel will be subject to the upload of the test result.” Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906175955/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/entry-requirements
notes_C2: The main business district, the Corporate Area of Kingston, will be restricted for the purposes of essential activity and residents should only venture out for such purposes  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111143809/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C4: gatherings of more than 10 people in any public place are not permitted  /web/20210216001754/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C5: "It also reminded commuters that passengers will only be carried between 6:00 am and 6:00 pm daily, in keeping with the latest restrictions announced by the Government."  Source: http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/auto-front-page/new-rules-for-public-transportation_192749

name: Jordan
notes_H1: On March 5, abriefing noted that a free hotline number, 111, will be established soon under the title "Ask about Corona" for inquiries about the virus, its symptoms and preliminary diagnosis.    The ministry also organised a media tour of Queen Alia International Airport to view the newly installed thermal detectors and precautionary measures in dealing with arrivals.    The Ministry of Health called on the public to avoid direct contact with any person showing symptoms of respiratory diseases and to maintain personal hygiene.    The Jordan Ministry of Health has established the following hotline numbers for virus-related enquiries: 065004545 and 0778410186.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://jordantimes.com/news/local/health-ministry-bolsters-measures-combat-spread-coronavirus
notes_H3: Health experts in the country said the resurgent pandemic illustrated the limits of lockdowns and closed borders without a strong testing and contact-tracing system, especially when dealing with a lengthy pandemic:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201213954/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/nov/04/jordan-suffers-covid-surge-after-early-success-against-virus
notes_H2: UPDATED NOTE:  The Jordanian Ministry of Health has designated the following seven hospitals for COVID-19 testing and isolation:  Al Bashir Hospital – Amman Jordan University Hospital- Amman Prince Hamzah Hospital- Amman Zarqa New Public Hospital- Zarqa King Abdullah University Hospital- Irbid Karak Public Hospital – Karak Prince Hashim Military Hospital – Aqaba  Foreigners may be tested at these hospitals but only when referred by health authorities and at the direction of a medical provider.  U.S. citizens who feel ill should first call a health care provider for instructions prior to seeking in-person medical care.  The Embassy cannot request tests on behalf of U.S. citizens in Jordan.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824165227/https://corona.moh.gov.jo/ar/MediaCenter/20
notes_C7: There are no restrictions on intercity or interstate travel during non-curfew hours.? However, all travel is banned during the?nightly curfew.?    "Jordan has a nightly curfew that begins at 9 p.m. for commercial establishments and 10 a.m. for individuals and ends the next morning at 6 a.m. On February 24, the Government of Jordan announced the resumption of the Friday comprehensive curfew starting on February 26.  The Friday comprehensive curfew will begin at 10 p.m. Thursdays and end at 6 a.m. Saturdays. Individuals are required to stay in their homes during the set curfew hours.? There are some exceptions to this..."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308145220/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: Starting February 7, children in grades kindergarten to third grade and twelfth grade will gradually resume in-person?classes. ?This re-opening will include both private and public schools. ?Nurseries are open.??Students in grades four through eleven, universities, cultural centers, and vocational training institutes?will continue remote learning until further notice.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210215173432/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Face-masks and protective gloves remain mandatory in public spaces and infractions are punishable by fines.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201103013431/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/395416/jordan-five-day-nationwide-lockdown-to-be-imposed-from-november-11-update-45
notes_E2: Unable to find new updates regarding the same.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308145220/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210308150310/https://corona.moh.gov.jo/en/MediaCenter/2660
notes_E1: "In an attempt to reduce the consequences on the poorest households, the Jordanian government established official prices for different commodities, including bread and vegetables. ... According to Basma Ishaqat, minister of social development, around 350,000 families have received financial and in-kind support since the virus outbreak." https://web.archive.org/web/20200615110849/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/coronavirus-jordan-economy-year-over-for-us
notes_C3: Public swimming pools and gyms will reopen from 1 February. Hotels, cafes, restaurants, mosques and churches have reopened at limited capacity.  Other recreational sectors including cinemas, entertainment venues, children’s play areas, exhibition and conference centres are due to reopen in March.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210215173432/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: As of 6th October 2020, there will be a nationwide comprehensive curfew? every Friday at 12:00 a.m. until 12:00 a.m. Sunday. The nightly curfew will remain in effect nationwide from 1 a.m. to 6 a.m., and 12:00 a.m. to 6 a.m. for commercial establishments.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201015100923/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Update: Jordanian authorities suspended flights between Jordan and the UK from Dec. 21-Jan. 3 due to concerns regarding the spread of a newly discovered coronavirus disease (COVID-19) strain; the measure applies to both direct and indirect flights.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175540/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/418901/jordan-authorities-suspend-flights-with-the-uk-through-jan-3-due-to-new-covid-19-strain-update-59
notes_C2: The Government of Jordan continues to implement social distancing regulations and mandatory mask?wearing in business establishments, public transportation, and government facilities due to COVID-19.  The tourist sector has reopened for domestic tourism. Leisure facilities will reopen gradually. Public swimming pools and gyms will reopen from 1 February. Hotels, cafes, restaurants, mosques and churches have reopened at limited capacity.  Other recreational sectors including cinemas, entertainment venues, children’s play areas, exhibition and conference centres are due to reopen in March.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210215173432/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: " Jordan restricts gatherings to 20 people."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200819000926/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Jordan on Wednesday began its vaccination campaign against the coronavirus pandemic, with healthcare workers and the elderly prioritized for the first shots.    Dr. Daoud Hanania, the country’s former director of medical services, became the first person to receive the injection in an event aired by state TV.    Health Minister Nazir Obeidat earlier said that the vaccination program will prioritize the most vulnerable groups including the elderly, those who suffer from chronic diseases, and medical personnel.    According to the Health Ministry, 29 centers across the kingdom will receive the vaccines.    The jabs arrived in Jordan on Saturday and Monday, starting with 3,800 tons of the Chinese Sinopharm virus vaccine and the Pfizer-BioNTech respectively, according to official media sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118223154/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/jordan-begins-covid-19-vaccine-rollout/2108497
notes_C5: "Delivery services for food and public transportation remain available during non-curfew hours.  Masks are required and social distancing practices are in effect for public transportation.? For taxis and app-based methods of transportation, passengers are required to sit in the back seat of the vehicle."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308145220/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Japan
notes_H1: Cabinet Office Twitter -- Published informational leaflet on COVID-19 control; free to reprint, reproduce (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413192433/https://twitter.com/kantei_saigai/status/1224589187719946240)
notes_H3: Cabinet Office  http://www.kantei.go.jp/jp/singi/novel_coronavirus/th_siryou/sidai_r020130.pdf (in Japanese)  The first case confirmed on 15th Jan.
notes_H2: Japan has been critisised for not testing as well as their counterparts. However, its testing policy was revised to target most symptomatic individuals.  This might contribute to their testing policy. http://web.archive.org/web/20200901195910/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/backstories/1082/ https://web.archive.org/web/20200625085357/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/06/02/national/science-health/japan-saliva-pcr-virus-test/
notes_C7: Nationally, there is no explicit guidance to not travel.  https://archive.ph/X69fv    However, in the prefectures that remain under a state of emergency, the recommendation is to remain at home, implying that it is recommended to refrain from domestic travelling.  https://archive.ph/r8TUy    In addition, several other prefectures also give explicit strong recommendations to its citizens to not travel:  Shizuoka: https://archive.ph/tq8k5  Hyogo: https://archive.ph/NyqCC  Niigata: https://archive.ph/dVGYj
notes_C1: Some schools are closed because of outbreaks or local govt recommendations, but most schools are open with some measures in place  In most prefectures of Japan, schools have reopened by June 1. However, the situation continues to be monitored on the local level, and municipalities can choose to keep some schools closed or to close them again. Most universities are still conducting research and teaching in an online format to the greatest possible extent. (1.) For example, on June 13,  a local cluster was found in a Kitakyushu school, leading to an announcement that the school will be closed again. (2.)     (1.) https://archive.vn/oUa0v   (2.) https://archive.vn/D8EL1    https://www.mext.go.jp/content/20200603-mxt_kouhou01-000004520_4.pdf (For reviewers and updaters: Web archive services are unavailable in China, please archive this link when you see this)  Education Ministry  98% of the schools in total of all levels have reopened as of 1 June.    Note from 21 Aug: "Many schools across the nation reopened Monday after summer vacations were shortened to allow students to catch up on classes missed when schools closed due to the novel coronavirus pandemic."      https://web.archive.org/web/20200821005509/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/08/17/national/japan-schools-restart-coronavirus/
notes_H6: "People have posited several reasons for Japan's success, including an existing culture of mask-wearing."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130181516/https://www.businessinsider.com/how-japan-tackled-coronavirus-without-a-lockdown-2020-5      "Infections among essential workers have also been limited in Japan in comparison to Western countries, which is probably due to avoidance of the three Cs and wearing of masks.  The national state of emergency has been lifted, but heightened awareness of the danger of the three Cs remains and this has helped to curtail any major increase in infections even after the end of the “soft” lockdown."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130181501/https://www.nippon.com/en/in-depth/d00592/
notes_E2: ***Recoded from 0 to 2 to reflect new policies located. May exist pre-Jan 22, but this is the farthest back located on the policy. Should be reviewed historically.   htps://archive.vn/9q2Pst    Coding Note:     Found new information, and have to revise coding up to 2.    Support for improvement of household finances: the government provides support for the use of delinquent rent, taxes, utility charges, etc., as well as various benefit systems.    10-day life support: For those who have lost their residence, the government provides necessary support for daily life such as food, clothing, and housing for a certain period of time.    Housing Security Benefits: Rent expenses will be provided for a long-term period of time to those who are financially distressed due to turnover, etc., and who have lost their residence or who are likely to do so, provided that they are seeking employment.    These details about the measures are provided on the related ministry’s website, linking of to pdf docs:   https://archive.vn/9q2Ps  PDF does not get archived, so uploaded as shared file to oneDrive: https://1drv.ms/b/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgCGc6g4PGdeq-rkQ?e=a8Nhb5  Auto-translated Word doc:  https://1drv.ms/w/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgDpXFXEH8efFJpJQ?e=IuM6VT
notes_E1: ***Recoded from 1A to 2A based on new information, see below:     Have to revise up because I found new information.    Eligible: workers from small and medium-sized businesses which were closed between April 1, Reiwa 2 (2020) and February 28, Reiwa 3 (2021) because of the novel coronavirus and measures to prevent its spread, so who were unable to receive payment of wages (leave allowance) during this period.    Amount paid:  Of pre-holiday wages 80% (Maximum daily amount 11,000yen)  In addition, as maternal health management measures related to the novel coronavirus infection, a paid leave system is established. This applies to pregnant female workers who are required to take leave under the guidance of a doctor or midwife has been established.    The application period for this is valid from June 15 2020 to May 31 2021.    These details about the measures are provided on the related ministry’s website, linking of to pdf docs:   https://archive.vn/9q2Ps    PDF does not get archived, so uploaded as shared file to oneDrive: https://1drv.ms/b/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgCGc6g4PGdeq-rkQ?e=a8Nhb5  Auto-translated Word doc:  https://1drv.ms/w/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgDpXFXEH8efFJpJQ?e=IuM6VT    While the latest information I can find that confirms freelancers are eligible for this support is from May 2020, I also can’t find any information that expressly excludes freelancers in subsequent extensions of this support policy, so coding as A rather than F.  https://archive.vn/WFdtg#selection-773.157-773.179
notes_C3: Some events have been cancelled, postponed, or held online.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102183310/https://www.japan.travel/en/coronavirus/
notes_C6: Voluntary restrictions have been loosened again in Tokyo.  https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/09/10/national/tokyo-bars-hours-coronavirus/
notes_C8: "To contain the spread of COVID-19, the Government of Japan will reimplement strict travel regulations barring most foreign entry into Japan effective Monday, December 28. While Japanese citizens and foreign residents with a reentry permit will be generally permitted to reenter the country, these reimplemented restrictions include suspension of short-term travel programs, suspension of quarantine relaxations for certain travelers, imposition of travel deadlines for already-issued visas, and enhanced COVID-19 screening protocols for travelers arriving from specific destinations."      https://web.archive.org/web/20210104182744/https://jp.usembassy.gov/health-alert-december-28-2020/      "From December 28, 2020, until the end of January 2021, entry into Japan from all countries and regions (except for the United Kingdom and Republic of South Africa) under this framework will not be permitted.  The GOJ decided that all foreign nationals who stayed in the United Kingdom (from December 24, 2020) and South Africa (from December 26, 2020) within 14 days prior to submitting the application of landing with this framework will be denied to enter Japan until further notice."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104183340/https://www.mofa.go.jp/ca/cp/page22e_000925.html      Dec 26, 2020: "The Japanese government has decided to suspend new entries of foreign nationals in an effort to stop the influx of a new coronavirus variant."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201226141906mp_/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/20201227_01/
notes_C2: "The government of Hokkaido, which has been asking nightlife establishments not to operate between 10 p.m. and 5 a.m. since Nov 7, also decided Thursday to extend the duration of its request to Dec 11. The local government originally planned to lift the request Saturday."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130175735/https://japantoday.com/category/national/4-major-cities-seek-shorter-business-hours-amid-pandemic
notes_C4: National guidelines continue to be events are allowed, but with a restriction to 5000 people.  (Maximum number of people / accommodation rate)  [Indoor] 5000 people or less and 50% or less of the capacity  [Outdoor] 5000 people or less and a sufficient distance between people (2m as much as possible)    https://archive.vn/kqhkl
notes_H7: A: medical personal  Vaccines: Pfizer approved and being used. AstraZeneca under review.  https://archive.vn/iuQV6#selection-2727.0-2743.29    The period of inoculation has started February 17, 3rd year of Reiwa (2021). Initially, vaccinations will be given to medical staff. After that, it is expected that vaccination will proceed in the order of elderly people and those with underlying diseases. The inoculation of elderly people is expected to start after April 1st at the earliest.  https://archive.vn/SqjEL#selection-2283.0-2289.128    Health care workers began to receive vaccination. A total of about 40,000 people from 100 medical institutions nationwide, including the National Hospital Organization , are scheduled to receive it. Of these, 20,000 will be subject to health surveys, and information such as side effects will be collected during this period, which will lead to vaccination of a wide range of residents including the elderly from April.  Priority vaccination of about 3.7 million medical workers following the advance vaccination is scheduled to start in March, but if a sufficient amount is secured for the advance vaccination, it can be advanced at the discretion of the medical institution.  https://archive.vn/Q296C
notes_C5: Emergency measures have been cancelled in all but four prefectures.  In Tokyo, the schedule changes to reduce late night crowds on public transportation continue to be in place.  https://archive.vn/ZOfeD    Since from Mar 1 there no longer seems to be national guidance for these kind of reductions, but only in the prefectures under emergency status, coding as T.

name: Kazakhstan
notes_H1: On March 16 Kazakstan declared the state of emergency, followed by massive information campaign: (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413200152/https://liter.kz/v-kazahstane-vvedeno-chrezvychajnoe-po/)
notes_H3: No manual contact tracing is reported in Kazakhstan. Some cities launching pilot testing of the Ashyq app that allows identifying infected people. However, this is not a manual tracing.  Link: https://archive.vn/uhqGf
notes_H2: The government is not testing everyone showing COVID-19 symptoms. The price of the COVID-19 test is still expensive for the general public. The government has promised to reduce the price of the COVID-19 test soon.   Link: https://archive.vn/WKHZu
notes_C7: East Kazakhstan region established 2 sanitary posts.   Link: https://archive.vn/WpQjU
notes_C1: From January 11, Grades 1-5 will study in a traditional format in duty classes. For Grades 9, 11, 12 - 70% of subjects will be held in a traditional format, 30% - remotely. Other grades will study fully remotely. Links: https://archive.vn/LucfO https://archive.vn/uLQBC
notes_H6: Face masks are required at all times in public places.  *******  Quote from archived link:  "Masks Required: The Chief Sanitary Doctor of Kazakhstan has mandated that masks be worn nationwide in public settings, including both indoor and outdoor spaces and on public transportation. Failure to comply with this measure could result in administrative penalty."  _______________________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived Link:  http://archive.today/2021.02.15-161556/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/      ******  Quote from archived link:  "Residents must wear protective facemasks and practice social distancing at all times while in public."    _____________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived link:  https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/430916/kazakhstan-as-of-jan-18-authorities-re-add-nur-sultan-to-red-zone-for-covid-19-infections-update-30
notes_E2: No debt and contract relief for a household is provided.  Link: https://archive.vn/aC6JN
notes_E1: Income support was provided during strict lockdown measures in 2020. However, the government has not announced any income support measures in 2021 for those who lost their jobs. Links: https://archive.vn/1e9Dy https://archive.vn/aC6JN
notes_C3: Government cancels all public events, including the Norouz holiday celebrations and a military parade devoted to 75th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200825082025/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-kazakhstan/kazakhstan-suspends-all-public-events-over-coronavirus-idUSKBN20Z0OD https://web.archive.org/web/20201113213642/https://www.rferl.org/a/armenia-puts-restrictions-on-public-and-private-events-amid-spike-in-coronavirus-cases/30492284.html https://archive.vn/wjQVP
notes_C6: Is a curfew in place?  No  The government is not recommending people to stay at home.   Link: https://archive.vn/tFKCX
notes_C8: According to the US embassy, the Kazakhstani border remains closed to foreigners with highly limited exceptions, including citizens of those countries with which Kazakhstan has resumed direct flights (China, South Korea, Japan, Thailand, and Turkey).  http://web.archive.org/web/20200808130057/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: A wide variety of businesses – including gyms and fitness centers, pools, beaches, cultural facilities, museums, exhibits, entertainment centers, religious facilities, some movie theaters, food courts, and recreational facilities – are open,  in some cases subject to restrictions on hours of operation subject to capacity limitations.   However, some regional and local governments periodically impose restrictions in response to increases in the infection rate.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210314173918/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: According to a new decree of Chief Sanitary Doctor from December 25, more than 5 people in a group are not allowed to walk outside.  Link: https://archive.vn/Ywh7y
notes_H7: An announcement was made by the government of Kazakhstan to commence mass vaccinations from 1 Feb 2021    A - Key workers : E.g. doctors, teachers, and law enforcement workers  (Sputnik V)    **************  Quote from site linked:  "Kazakhstan launched local production of the Russia-developed vaccine (Sputnik V) in December 2020 and started voluntary vaccination of the local population on February 1. The authorities plan to vaccinate six million people (about one third of the population) free of charge by end-2021. The first stage vaccination is expected to cover groups with high risk exposure, including doctors, teachers, and law enforcement workers. In addition, a locally developed vaccine (QazCovid-in) and the vaccine developed by Pfizer are expected to be available for vaccination later in the year."    _____________________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived link:  http://archive.today/2021.02.15-163514/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19%23top    AND    http://archive.today/2021.02.15-161556/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    AND    http://archive.today/2021.02.15-180358/https://www.gov.kz/memleket/entities/dsm/press/news/details/148026?lang=ru
notes_C5: Is public transportation operating? Yes  Link: https://archive.vn/tFKCX

notes_H3: Because testing is generally available through the voluntary testing scheme, it may be assumed that contract tracing is also comprehensive.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.africanews.com/2020/05/31/kenyans-heed-govt-s-voluntary-covid-19-testing-scheme//

notes_E1: Labour and Social Protection Cabinet Secretary Simon Chelugui has indicated that the cash transfers to poor households will be terminated in the first week of October when funds will dry up. This will end six months of social safeguards to the poor. The government has been sending about Sh1.3 billion every month. Since May, some 341,958 households have received the weekly Sh1,000 stipend to cushion them from the economic hardships caused by the pandemic.  Link: https://archive.vn/I9Pc8
notes_C3: On March 13, the Health Ministry announced that for at least 30 days, "All Kenyans should observe the following: [...] Suspend all public gatherings, meetings, religious crusades games events etc. Normal church services can go on provided they provide sanitizing/and hand washing." notes_C8: Travellers must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test upon entry. Travellers not from one of 186 quarantine exempt countries must quarantine upon arrival. notes_C2: Note: The government has adopted a number of containment measures, including social distancing and encouragement of teleworking where possible. name: Kyrgyz Republic
notes_H1: There is a dedicated government website on the epidemic: covid.kg , which reports daily cases and advice for keeping safe, as well as a Telegram channel: https://xn--r1a.website/s/RshKRCOV.    The Kyrgyz Ministry of Health also publishes COVID-related advice  on their website: med.kg
notes_H3: Contact people are tested in case of COVID-19 symptoms are discovered.  Link: https://archive.vn/ib3Dl

notes_C1: Some levels of school have been gradually reopening back to in-person classes since late 2020, with further school levels being added to return to offline classes come March 9 2021. notes_E2: Quote from linked article 1:  "Key Policy Responses as of February 05, 2021    FISCAL:    -To mitigate the impact on the economy, the authorities have approved the first package of anti-crisis plan economic measures of $15 million (0.2 percent of GDP) including the postponement of tax payments, time-bound exemptions of property and land taxes, and temporary price controls on 11 essential food items. They prepared a second and a third package of economic measures of about $540 million (7 percent of GDP), including temporary tax exemptions for SMEs, support food security program to the vulnerable groups, and subsidized credit to banks to provide funding to small and medium-size enterprises through soft loans." name: Cambodia
notes_H1: MOH in cooperation with Unicef is distributing posters and billboards, there are radio and TV announcements, and until recently MOH was issuing text messages to mobile phones recommending safety steps (haven’t seen any for about 10 days now). For the materials funded by Unicef see:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200729232153/https://www.unicef.org/cambodia/ and click on ‘communication materials’ at top of page.

notes_H6: "On December?21, 2020, the Cambodian Ministry of?Health announced the following guidelines:?   - The public is directed to wear masks, use?hand sanitizers and?practice?social distancing.?   - Shops, restaurants, cafeterias, supermarkets, banks and other commercial areas?must?require customers to?wear masks, use?hand sanitizer, and engage in social distancing.?"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210221195115/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Different news articles call for govt stimulus packages, but no report about any support being given for 2021:  https://archive.vn/tfqWF
notes_E1: In December 2020, the government extended until the end of March this year: i) allowance subsidy for garment and tourism sectors; ii) tax exemption for tourism and aviation sector; and iii) cash relief program for poor and vulnerable families.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308024659/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Until December 16th 2020 gatherings of all sizes should be avoided and gatherings larger than 20 people are prohibited - Including Weddings, religious gatherings, parties, sports and group exercise.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201204232420/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: On December 21, 2020, Cambodian Ministry of Health has lifted its stay at home directive and instead announce the following guidelines that will be in place indefinitely with no restrictions on curfews or interstate travel: 1) The public is directed to wear masks, use?hand sanitizers and practice social distancing. 2) Shops, restaurants, cafeterias, supermarkets, banks and other commercial areas?must?require customers to wear masks, use?hand sanitizer, and engage in social distancing. 3) The public is directed to avoid close contact with others, remaining in closed air-conditioned rooms, and gatherings of more than 20 people to minimize community transmission. 4) Individuals who are unwell and suspect they are may have COVID-19 must seek consultation by calling 115 or visiting a designated government hospital.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210118013024/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Since the last update by the US embassy it seems like everyone must abide by the 14 day quarantine, even if everyone entering the country has a negative test result:  "Cambodian authorities have also introduced the following requirements for prevention, containment, and response to the spread of COVID-19 for all travelers entering Cambodia by air, land, and water.? All arriving foreigners must:  Fully abide by locally enforced quarantine measures for 14 days at a hotel designated by the Government of Cambodia."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201124224049/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Authorities have closed certain business, buildings, and schools as a result of the February 20 outbreak. Hotspots have also been identified by government officials for a number of locations linked to positive cases.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210228072147/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://archive.vn/RN6mr
notes_C4: Until December 16th 2020 Gatherings of all sizes should be avoided and groups larger than 20 people are prohibited.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201204232420/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: A, teachers, soldiers, bodyguards, officials around the king: Vaccinations from China’s Sinopharm and Sinovac as well as the British-Swedish AstraZeneca    "The first people to get the jabs include frontline health workers, teachers, soldiers, the premier’s bodyguards, and officials around the king, the premier said. Cambodia plans to vaccinate at least 10 million of its 16 million population with shots from both China’s Sinopharm and Sinovac as well as the British-Swedish AstraZeneca."    http://web.archive.org/web/20210208180543/https://www.msn.com/en-ph/news/world/china-delivers-600-000-vaccine-doses-to-cambodia/ar-BB1dv8Ob      NOTE: not for the elderly!   "Chinese embassy informing him that the vaccine is intended for people between the ages of 18-59. The safety and efficacy of the vaccine for people over 60 years old was still being studied."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208180114/https://www.nationthailand.com/ann/30402374      "[T]he Cambodian leader posted on Facebook. “Save money to buy this vaccine and give it to our people for free as a first step.” He said that these would be doled out free of charge to frontline medical workers and others at high risk of contracting the disease."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208181355/https://thediplomat.com/2020/12/cambodia-vaccine-push-offers-window-into-elite-networks/

name: Kiribati
notes_H1: Article suggests that Kiribati has a suspected case of Covid-19 (a person from Papua New Guinea who recently came to Kiribati on a flight from Fiji on 19th March).    The article also refers to the provision of information about Covid-19 on multiple media channels (radio, TV and internet) by the Ministry of Health and Medical Services (MHMS), hence the change of code for H1 from "0" to "2".  It is entirely possible that a coordinated campaign has been in existence prior to this, although no policy announcement about such a campaign has been found.    "People were also kept reminded by the MHMS over radio Kiribati, the media and tv of steps to combat with the deadly convid-19 on all levels.    On the island people had their hand-held mobile smart telephone on site with them for any current viral news for the corona virus updates. They can access the latest news with their mobile any moment."    http://archive.today/2021.01.24-161213/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/kiribati-is-now-on-level-2-in-the-convid-19-scale-in-tarawa/
notes_H2: Article from Kiribati updates.    Notes that a suspected Covid case (a captain of a ship) had been tested for Covid-19 and the results had come back negative.  This suggests a policy of testing is in existence and is likely to have been in place prior to 28th March, although no policy on testing has been found, so code prior to this has been left as "0".  The tests were carried out in Australia.  It is assumed that reliance on other countries for testing will mean that testing is limited to symptomatic / suspected cases and is not available more widely.      Link:  http://archive.today/2021.01.26-174948/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/convid-19-results-proof-negative-in-tarawa/    Subsequent Facebook posts by the Australian High Commission for Kiribati notes the delivery of testing supplies and equipment (GeneXpert) on 1st May, 21st May, 25th August and 9th November 2020 which suggests that testing capacity within Kiribati progressively increases over the coming months.  A further post by the High Commission on 12th November comments on support provided for Kiribati to develop a PCR lab at Tungaru Central Hospital which will reduce its need for sending samples overseas for testing.  Taken as a whole, these comments suggest that whilst testing capacity increases, it has remained limited and is therefore unlikely to meet coding criteria for "2" or "3" throughout 2020.    Additional context: borders remained closed from March 2020 and Kiribati has continued to report no confirmed cases of Covid-19 throughout 2020.
notes_C1: From UN Sustainable Development Group (UNSDG).  Article not dated, link below.    "COVID-19 pandemic  A National State of Public Health Emergency was first declared by the Kiribati government on 25 March 2020; and a partial lockdown was effective between 30 March to 20 April 2020, [...] schools [...] closed. Schools reopened on 20 April 2020 "    http://archive.today/2021.02.15-164719/https://unsdg.un.org/un-in-action/kiribati
notes_C6: The previous code of "2" was given in light of both the policy relating the persons under 18 years of age and the associated police Facebook post referring to enforcement of stay at home requirements.  As the policy was set to end on 16th April and as no further policy announcements have been found, it is assumed that the stay at home requirement for persons under 18 years of age ceased after 16th April.  Hence the code of "0".
notes_C8: IMF    "borders have been closed on March 21, except for delivery of essential goods (quarantine requirements apply at all ports). "    https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#N

name: South Korea
notes_H1: http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/en/
notes_H3: Extensive public information campaign, most notably location tracing apps. The Corona 100m (Co100) app launched on February 11 and, using government data, alerts users when they come within 100 metres of a location visited by an infected person. Coronamap website shows the travel histories of confirmed COVID-19 patients and Coronaita aims to function “like a search engine” for information on coronavirus-hit areas.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202823/https://www.smartcitiesworld.net/news/news/south-korea-to-step-up-online-coronavirus-tracking-5109   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202916/http://www.korea.net/NewsFocus/Society/view?articleId=183129
notes_H2: KCDC- The newly developed diagnostic will be available at the 50 designated health facilities from 7 February. The improved real-time PCR can detect the novel Coronavirus within six hours.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200406091812/https://www.cdc.go.kr/board/board.es?mid=a30402000000&bid=0030  BBC- South Korea managed to get testing centres up and running 17 days after the 1st case (20th of January)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200406084319/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-51836898
notes_C7: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL   http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)
notes_C1: ***Recoded from 2G to 1G. Under current restrictions, schools are open with restrictions. With the previous localized closure expired at the end of February, there is no evidence of any closures of any levels.     No change at social distancing level: Level 2 for Greater Seoul, Level 1.5 for non-Greater Seoul  https://archive.is/EnyfJ    In-person class attendance capped at one-third at level 2, two-third at level 1.5     Korean social distancing level: http://web.archive.org/web/20210211130346/http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20201106000174
notes_H6: Facemasks are compulsory in public places and on public transport. Failure to wear a mask can result in a fine of up to 100,000 Korean Won (£66).    South Korea is currently at level 1 on its five-level national social distancing scale. Under this level facemasks are compulsory in most public places and on transport, and local authorities are able to impose their own restrictions in some circumstances.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109100146/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/south-korea/coronavirus
notes_E2: On March 17, 2020, the National Assembly Strategy and Finance Committee made an announcement on the “Amendment to the Restriction of Special Taxation Act” to minimize and to overcome the economic impact due to COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215120/https://www.rsm.global/korea/tax-benefits-due-covid-19-korea  South Korean authorities in March 2020 approved tax relief in an effort to address the impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215233/https://home.kpmg/us/en/home/insights/2020/04/tnf-korea-tax-relief-includes-reduced-rates-temporary-increased-deductions.html
notes_E1: Quotation: "President Moon Jae-in announced Monday during a meeting with a special task force that the government will pay about $820 to all households except for those in the top 30% income bracket, bringing the total amount to $7.4 billion."  Link: https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/s-korea-offer-emergency-payments-help-ease-impact-covid-19
