notes_C6: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL   http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)
notes_C8: South Korea said on December 23, 2020, it will suspend flights leaving for and arriving from United Kingdom until the end of the year (December 31) over concerns about a new strain of the novel coronavirus. The country will also place all international arrivals from United Kingdom in a 14-day quarantine and conduct an additional virus test at the time of the quarantine being lifted, according to health authorities. The measure takes effect immediately, according to health authorities.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201226075508/https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20201223004400320
notes_C4: Previous directive of Stage 2.5 in metropolitan areas and Stage 2 in non-metropolitcan areas will be extended for two further weeks until January 17. In addition, measures to ban private gatherings from 5 people will be expanded nationwide and implemented for the two weeks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102055818/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=362858&contSeq=362858&board_id=&gubun=ALL
notes_H7: A,C: AstraZeneca  https://archive.is/8SfOa  ***Recoded from A;B to A;C as it appears that its healthcare staff at nursing homes and nursing home patients, meaning 'C' is a beter fit than 'B'

name: Kuwait
notes_H1: From 18 Feb, the government has ramped up its public information activities in a coordinated manner.  On 18 Feb, the Ministry of Health allocated a hotline for citizens to answer any queries. A protocol of cooperation between Kuwait National Guard and Ministry of Health media office was activated on the same day to enhance awareness of the National Guard.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120433/http://www.arabtimesonline.com/news/hotline-allocated-to-answer-inquiries-on-coronavirus/  On 12 March, the government launched a website with all the latest updates and information.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120229/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2877656&Language=en  The Kuwait Ministry of Health has also been also providing regular updates in Arabic and English on its Twitter feed.
notes_H3: /web/20200409143715/https://twitter.com/KUWAIT_MOH/status/1236360623921008647  Screening to all people in contact with travelers.
notes_H2: 'The Ministry of Health is randomly testing citizens and residents daily as part of its measures to curb COVID-19. Detailed instructions will be sent to those selected for a COVID swab via text message.'    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013195918/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: U.S Embassy in Kuwait reports that no restrictions currently exist in relation to inter-city and inter-state travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201017080651/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: On Feb 26, the Ministry of Education announced universities and schools would be suspended for a period of 2 weeks starting 01 March. /web/20200409075927/https://twitter.com/MOEKUWAIT/status/1232659575565885447  Kuwait has further extended the closure of schools and universities, with the latest update on 20 March when the government announced suspension until August 4.  Education Minister Saud Al-Harbi said the decision applies to public and private schools, and that teachers will be paid with full salaries in the duration of the suspension.  The minister said the next school year will begin in December 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200426194131/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1644186/middle-east
notes_H6: 18th May 2020, Kuwait imposes mandatory wearing of masks in public, the country’s health ministry has revealed those who fail to adhere to the strict guidelines could be looking at up to three months in prison or be hit with fines of up to $16,200 (5,000 dinars).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200915055927/https://www.arabianbusiness.com/culture-society/446880-kuwait-imposes-mandatory-wearing-of-masks-in-public
notes_E2: Suspension of loan payments  https://www.zawya.com/mena/en/business/story/Loan_payment_collection_postponed_in_Kuwait_for_six_months-SNG_173867630/  postpone social security contributions for 6 months for private sector companies;    (ii) remove government fees on selected sectors provided that savings are passed on to customers;  https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: "3. Establishing a mechanism to secure the minimum income that ensures facing the cost of living for workers affected by the current crisis and linked to contracts    4. Support the salaries of those under Chapter 5 in social Security in the affected sectors.    5. Assist owners of small, medium, industrial and agricultural projects by postponing the installments funded by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprises Development and the agricultural finance portfolio in the Industrial Park    6. Providing loans on concessional and long term to small and medium enterprises, through joint financing from local banks and the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) Development"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501022530/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2882522&Language=en
notes_C3: https://gulfbusiness.com/kuwait-begins-phased-plan-to-reopen-economy-over-a-million-expats-remain-in-lockdown/ mosques reopen but Friday prayers are not allowed. Public events remained cancelled
notes_C6: July 28 2020 onward, Kuwait Authorities announce third phase of COVID-19 reopening of economy.    It is imperative that all activities asses their ability to work remotely and that these activities adhere to this throughout the pandemic period, regardless of the overall risk level. If you are not able to work completely remotely, you can apply working remotely partially.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200810225430/https://corona.e.gov.kw/Re-Open-PhaseIII-En.pdf
notes_C8: "For a two-week period starting on February 7, non-Kuwaiti citizens are not permitted to enter Kuwait. There may be exceptions available for first-degree relatives of Kuwaiti citizens, domestic employees traveling with them, governmental medical staff, and private sector medical staff as approved by the Ministry of Health. Details can be found at corona.e.gov.kw/en. U.S. citizens are permitted to enter Kuwait only if in possession of a valid visa or residency. "    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: "Government offices and private businesses, banking, financial, and construction sectors, retail stores, shopping malls, public parks, restaurant takeout and dine-in services, hotels, and tailors are open with physical distancing measures. Beginning February 7 for a one-month period, all commercial businesses, including restaurants, are closed from 8 PM to 5 AM daily, with the exception of pharmacies, co-ops, and grocery stores. Takeout orders and delivery is not restricted.  Beginning February 7 for a one-month period, health clubs, salons, barber shops, and spas are closed."
notes_C4: Kuwait reopens mosques after months of coronavirus closure.  http://archive.fo/muGeK
notes_H7: Everyone can sign up for the vaccine for free, but the elderly, healthcare workers and clinically vulnerable people are given priority.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002053if_/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/kuwait-all-citizens-to-get-covid-19-vaccine-for-free-1.75488993  https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002646/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/covid-19-more-than-1000-people-vaccinated-on-1st-day-in-kuwait-1.76123900
notes_C5: July 28 2020 onward, Kuwait Authorities announce third phase of COVID-19 reopening of economy.  Reopening Taxi Services (Permitted to One Passenger Only).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200810225430/https://corona.e.gov.kw/Re-Open-PhaseIII-En.pdf

name: Laos
notes_H1: The Prime Minister Exective order mentions about public awareness  through departments and official media. The Exective order implementation is from 30th March.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200618220009/https://www.norway.no/en/vietnam/norway-vietnam/news-and-events/order-of-laos-prime-minister//
notes_H3: Appears to be comprehensive: https://web.archive.org/web/20200619232042/https://laotiantimes.com/2020/04/12/laos-confirms-19th-case-of-covid-19-infection/ http://web.archive.org/web/20200619232100/https://www.who.int/news-room/feature-stories/detail/support-for-lao-pdr-s-response-to-covid-19
notes_H2: The WHO report shows that the testing capacity is enhanced. Tests are being conducted everyday and there are no reports of laboratory or case reporting backlogs.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.who.int/laos/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-situation-report-for-lao-pdr-12-21---27-august-2020
notes_C7: "The government has lifted travel restrictions to enable people to travel freely around the country as Laos eases more Covid-19 prevention measures to minimise the impact on livelihoods and the economy." https://web.archive.org/web/20200526102008/http://www.vientianetimes.org.la/freeContent/FreeConten_Travel_93.php
notes_C1: schools/universities are open    http://web.archive.org/web/20201129203136/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Facial masks are mandatory required when stepping out of house  Social distancing of one to two meters must be observed    Reference:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201024141830/http:/www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-09/30/c_139409766.htm
notes_E2: Recent mitigation policies include income tax exemption for both civil servants and employees of private sector with income less than 5 million kip per month for three months; profit tax exemption for microenterprises with annual income between 50-400 million kip for three months; duty fee exemption for imports of goods to be used towards the outbreak; deferring tax collection from tourism related businesses for three months; postponing mandatory contribution to social security by affected businesses for three months and extending the submission of the 2019 financial report (annual tax filing) by two months and road tax payment by three months.    Measures include, establishing a separate task force to address the economic impact of COVID-19. A new electricity tariff, to ensure supply of electricity, in effect from May 1, 2020 through December 31, 2025, is in place.     https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_E1: The government has agreed to compensate 60 percent of workers’ salary, who currently participates in the Social Security Scheme, and has had their work suspended during May and June 2020.  https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_C3: Public transportation has resumed operation. Restaurants, grocery stores, and schools/universities are open, and large gatherings and religious ceremonies are permitted. Entertainment venues such as karaoke lounges are opened.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201129203136/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Everyone is now allowed out, but face-masks must be worn and everyone must "maintain a physical distance of at least one meter from each other". https://web.archive.org/web/20200526095640/https://www.thestar.com.my/news/regional/2020/05/05/laos-reopening-businesses-after-no-virus-cases-for-23-consecutive-days
notes_C8: All entrants will be subject to COVID-19 testing and a 14-day self-quarantine requirement at a designated facility or hotel at their own expense.   http://web.archive.org/save/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

notes_H7: Laos has received 2,000 doses of a Covid-19 vaccine from China. These vaccines are used for emergencies only, so they will available for people who work in at-risk fields including medical staff, elderly people, health workers, immigration officials, etc  http://web.archive.org/web/20210125163008/https://laotiantimes.com/2020/12/31/laos-receives-2000-doses-of-covid-19-vaccine-from-china/

name: Lebanon
notes_H1: I could not find a specific date for an official public campaign beginning, but given that on Mar 6 the Health Minister stated "Lebanon is no longer in Coronavirus containment stage", and that on the same day the first domestic restrictions got into place, this seems like the proper time point.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504213031/https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/news-bulletin-reports/505703/health-minister-hassan-lebanon-is-no-longer-in-cor/en
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20200221-lebanon-confirms-first-case-of-coronavirus-2-more-suspected/
notes_H2: Lebanon has a mixed approach to testing with symptomatic and eligible ppl able to access testing + population level random testing of ppl without symptoms or eligibility to attempt to estimate the population level of infection.     /web/20200608224645/https://www.executive-magazine.com/economics-policy/healthcare/coronavirus/testing-for-covid-19-in-lebanon On April 20, the Ministry of Public Health began population screening or what they called “random testing” (though it is not so random, see below) in different areas of Lebanon. "
notes_C7: From 21st August 2020, Lebanon has reinstated a nationwide curfew from 1800-0600 daily, during which internal movement will also be restricted (with the exception of travelling to and from the airport).   https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: A nationwide lockdown will come into effect in Lebanon from 5am on Saturday 14 November 2020, until 5am on 30 November to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Public institutions and schools will close.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Fabric masks covering the mouth and nose must be worn when outside the home and in vehicles (unless travelling alone, or exercising).    Masks are required outdoors in all public spaces.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus
notes_E2: Extension of deadlines for paying taxes and utility bills, banks are allowed to extend 5yr no interest loans./web/20200611013320/https://www.hrw.org/news/2020/04/08/lebanon-direct-covid-19-assistance-hardest-hit
notes_C3: From 21st August, all public events are banned.  2020https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Previous curfew ended at 5am, a new curfew began as part of the four-phase easing of restrictions programme.    The first phase: starts from five o'clock in the morning of Monday, 02/08/2021, until five o'clock in the morning of Monday, 02/22/2021.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210208174424/http://drm.pcm.gov.lb/Media/News/Daily-situation-report-06-Feb,-2021_English-Versio.pdf
notes_C8: Lebanon has declared a total curfew which it will lift gradually to allow more businesses to operate. Movement is generally prohibited. You must not leave your accommodation. All hospitality businesses and public institutions will close and banks are operating a greatly reduced service. There are some exemptions for essential work and you can apply by mobile phone or internet to leave your accommodation to undertake certain activities such as medical appointments, chemists and food shopping. Food delivery services are operating, including in the evenings.      The Lebanese government have introduced an online system where you can request an exemption from the curfew for essential purposes e.g. going to a chemist, medical appointment or to buy food. You can do this online via this link.    Beirut International airport will remain open, but land and sea borders will close, apart from for those transiting Beirut airport who hold tickets for flights on that day. All passengers are required to have their tickets with them when transferring to and from the airport. Some exemptions to COVID-19 restrictions are applied to aid workers. For further clarification, aid workers should contact the United Nations for advice.    When travelling to and from the airport, private cars should have no more than four people in them (including the driver). Wearing masks for all passengers is obligatory. Given the total curfew, you are advised to book taxis to and from the airport ahead of time.    Fabric masks covering the mouth and nose must be worn when outside the home and in vehicles (unless travelling alone).    Lebanese authorities may issue fines, impose road blocks, or imprison those violating these measures for up to three years. You should comply with all measures introduced by the Lebanese authorities and obey the instructions of the security forces. These measures may be changed at short notice.    Keep up to date with information from your tour operator, transport or accommodation provider on the impact on any existing travel plans.    https://archive.vn/wip/W7EtA  https://archive.vn/RnP8Q  https://archive.vn/Xk48E
notes_C2: From 21st August 2020, malls, gyms and restaurants will be closed, although restaurants will be permitted to make deliveries 0600-1800. Grocery stores will be allowed to operate from 0600-1700.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Phase Target population Population  size[1]  Share of  population*  First 35%[2] High risk health workers 55,000 0.8%  Aged 65 and older 600,143 9.2%  Those below age 65 (55 – 64 years) but with comorbidities 237,183 3.6%  All those between ages 55-64 not covered earlier,  16-54 years with co-morbidities[3]  ,  health workers not covered earlier  237,183  1,150,671  5,000  3.6%  17.7%  0.1%  Persons and staff in elderly shelters, prisons, and  individuals essential for preserving the essential function  of the society (the national COVID-19 vaccination  committee will define strict criteria to identify recipients  of the latter group).  25,000 3.4%  Next 35%  Other vulnerable populations, schoolteachers and school  staff**, childcare workers, other critical workers in high  risk settings, remaining health care workers, family  caregivers of those age =65 or with special needs, and all  those above the age of 16 willing to be vaccinated  2,449,820 35%    https://archive.vn/6PeGm

[1] Nor is there any reference to internal movement restrictions on the Ministry of Health website [2] or any proclamations from the President since the state of emergency expired on July 21st, 2020.     [1] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104065732/http://moh.gov.lr/press-release/2020/revised-covid-19-declaration-of-national-health-emergency-by-the-ministry-of-health/  [2] https://web.archive.org/web/20210104203113/http://moh.gov.lr/

notes_H6: On April 24, on the advice of health professionals, the president extended the stay-at-home order’s application period and geography (to all 15 counties in the country). During this time, residents may leave their homes only to procure food or health items, an activity limited to one person per household for a maximum of one hour, so long as the person does not venture out of his or her local area. Anyone in public must wear a face-mask. See: https://blogs.loc.gov/law/2020/05/liberia-government-measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-covid-19/ (accessed 14th September 2020, web archive unavailable)
notes_E1: For example, stimulus package that includes disbursement to private school teachers. See https://moe-liberia.org/ministry-of-education-continues-disbursement-of-stimulus-package-to-private-school-teachers/ [web archive unavailable]
notes_C3: Still in place.    SPORTING EVENTS, WEDDINGS, AND FUNERALS ARE ALLOWED PROVIDED PERSONS IN ATTENDENCE FOLLOW THE HEALTH PROTOCOLS LISTED IN COUNT 1 ABOVE.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018192601/https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=1026786474444887&id=699881103802094
notes_C6: The Revised Declaration (July 23rd)  (See C2 note for additional context) specifies that people must stay home when sick, but does not recommend the general public stay home. notes_C8: Quarantine Information:  Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? No  All arriving passengers who have not been tested at point of departure will be required to take a rapid test and a PCR swab at the airport upon arrival in Liberia.  In the event of a positive rapid test result, the passenger will be taken to a government-designated Precautionary Observation Center (POC) pending the final PCR test result.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201018193504/https://lr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: State of emergency extended for 2 more weeks. name: Liechtenstein
notes_H1: Hygiene measures are a must for everyone Strict adherence to the hygiene rules is still the best measure against a possible contagion in the unavoidable social contacts. The hands are  Wash thoroughly with soap, avoid shaking hands and kissing people and all you have to do is cough or sneeze into a handkerchief or the crook of your arm. People who have a fever and cough should stay at home.    Appeal to the population    The government appeals to all residents of the country who Government action with common sense and the greatest discipline implement. In case of doubt, the principle of caution should be applied. The government is aware of the fact that some of these measures have far-reaching consequences. But it is a question of solidarity with the elderly Generation and those with certain pre-existing conditions that we all share get together and cope with the tasks ahead of us together.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_C1: 16 March 2020, The government has already decided that all public and private Educational institutions and out-of-home childcare institutions and Playgroups are closed. This measure already applies from Monday, 16. March 2020, until the Easter holidays. In urgent cases, up to and including Friday, March 20, 2020, a bridging offer in daycare centers, kindergartens and primary schools created. Fortunately, groups of people now spontaneously form who Want to organize childcare services. When designing these offers is on to keep group sizes as small as possible, so that the purpose of closing schools and childcare facilities, namely, minimizing contagion can be tracked.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_H6: Beginning 6 July 2020 the wearing of a mask is compulsory on all public transport in Liechtenstein and Switzerland in order to mitigate infections.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315080200/http://www.liechtensteinusa.org/article/measures-taken-in-liechtenstein-in-response-to-the-coronavirus-pandemic
notes_C3: 16 March 2020,  Events will be handled with extreme restrictions, the operation of restaurants and bars are completely prohibited and all entertainment and leisure activities are ceased.    The government decided today to close all events with more than five people prohibit. This measure applies to all public and private events. This also includes all religious meetings such as church services. Burials are close at hand Family group approved.    Entertainment and leisure businesses are generally being discontinued. This includes  especially all public and private museums, libraries, courses and Training courses, casinos and gaming salons, sports centers, sports facilities, fitness centers, Wellness centers, youth centers, indoor swimming pools and the Malbun mountain railways.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_C8: 16th March 2020, The government recommends that you only travel when it is absolutely necessary. It is to be expected that there will continue to be changes to the entry and Quarantine regulations in other countries sometimes come without notice, accordingly, further restrictions on travel are to be expected. All People who are currently abroad will be able to return as soon as possible came to Liechtenstein.    Information on border controls in Austria    Austria has introduced border controls at the borders with Liechtenstein. From Wednesday,  March 18, 2020, the border crossings to Austria remain in Schellenberg and Mauren blocked. The border crossings Ruggell and Schaanwald, however, remain around the clock open to commuters and goods. That means that freight and commercial traffic (exception: passenger transport), commuter traffic, for emergency services and for transit through Austria possible without a stopover are. For all other cases the obligation to bring one applies Health certificate with molecular biological test in German, English, Italian or French language, which must not be older than four days. Should If such a certificate is not available, entry will be refused. Austrian Citizens and people with residence or ordinary In any case, residence in Austria is allowed to enter the country, whereby this is daily home quarantine.  Avoid travel    https://web.archive.org/web/20210110095401/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_C2: 17th March 2020, the operation of restaurants and bars will be completely prohibited and all entertainment and leisure activities will be discontinued. Entertainment and leisure businesses are generally being discontinued. This includes especially all public and private museums, libraries, courses and Training courses, casinos and gaming salons, sports centers, sports facilities, fitness centers, Wellness centers, youth centers, indoor swimming pools and the Malbun mountain railways.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210223071523/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667
notes_C4: 17th March 2020, Closure of restaurants and bars Having maximum occupancy in restaurants, bars, discos over the weekend and nightclubs have been limited to 50 people, these establishments will commence Tuesday completely closed. Exceptions are company canteens, take-aways and  Restaurant meal deliveries, pizza couriers and the like.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210223071523/https://www.regierung.li/media/attachments/120-corona-massnahmen-verschaerft-0316.pdf?t=637203447788083667

name: Sri Lanka
notes_H1: From 14 March, Sri Lanka announcements start increasing. Since then the President and Ministry of Health have been quite active on social media. This continued throughout the nationwide curfew which started on 20 March.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200504162625/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=225&Itemid=487&lang=en  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504163456/https://twitter.com/gotabayar  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504163534/https://twitter.com/moh_srilanka  https://web.archive.org/web/20200408194539/https://www.thehindu.com/news/international/coronavirus-sri-lanka-bans-public-events-as-cases-rises-to-8/article31069806.ece  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504143121/https://www.deccanherald.com/international/coronavirus-sri-lanka-to-lift-nationwide-curfew-on-april-27-829717.html
notes_H3: Government issues initial testing and contact tracing protocols. https://web.archive.org/web/20200329223450/http://www.epid.gov.lk/web/images/pdf/Circulars/Corona_virus/revisionsummary.pdf
notes_H2: Multiple  new reports from Jan 3 suggest that random Rapid Antigen Tests are being conducted and available at Fish Stalls in the Western Province (the country's capital Colombo is in the Western Province):   - https://web.archive.org/web/20210126065207/https://colombogazette.com/2021/01/03/rapid-antigen-tests-conducted-at-fish-stalls-in-western-province/  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210126065251/https://www.newsradio.lk/local/random-tests-to-be-conducted-at-fish-stalls-markets/
notes_C7: Traveling in and out of industrial zones within the country seem to have targeted movement restrictions:  Nov 02, 2020: www.newsfirst.lk: "Sri Lanka Police introduced a Quarantine Curfew Pass application to be filled by those who require passes in order to resume operations at factories and other production centers"  sources:  - https://web.archive.org/web/20201115210122/https://www.newsfirst.lk/2020/11/02/quarantine-curfew-pass-application-for-industries-available-for-download/    other Govt. notices:  - https://covid19.gov.lk/news/economy/issuing-of-curfew-passes.html (WaybackMachine was returning a 502 error when archiving this website)  - https://covid19.gov.lk/news/economy/issuing-of-curfew-passes-export-processing-zones.html (WaybackMachine was returning a 502 error when archiving this website)    However, internal movements across Sri Lanka, in general, seem to have no other concrete measures.  On Nov 9, according to an AP new report, "Passenger trains resumed operating after nearly two weeks and the government lifted a curfew that had been in effect in the capital, Colombo, and its suburbs."  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115204723/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-sri-lanka-asia-arrests-colombo-0511a1a54f569364f2e8bdb901f42c79
notes_C1: "**Schools re-open today except in Western Province, isolated areas**  Education Minister Prof. G. L. Peris yesterday said that schools will be reopened for grade 2–13 students in all parts of the country today except schools in the Western province and isolated areas. He said that the Ministry arrived at this decision after taking all measures to ensure the health security of the students. Addressing a press conference in Colombo yesterday, the Minister said that reopening of schools from Grade 2 – 13 will take place today on a plan made by the Ministry."    - https://web.archive.org/web/20210119024202/https://dailynews.lk/2021/01/11/local/238439/schools-re-open-today-except-western-province-isolated-areas-minister
notes_H6: "Everyone needs to have their personal hand sanitation bottle and their masks worn at all times outside the house. "    https://archive.fo/Fiv2b    http://web.archive.org/web/20200830173154/https://hpb.health.gov.lk/media/pdf/wearing-masks.pdf
notes_E2: MONETARY AND MACRO-FINANCIAL  The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has reduced monetary policy rates by 100 basis points since March. The required reserve ratio on domestic currency deposits of commercial banks has been lowered by one percentage point, the liquidity coverage ratio and net stable funding ratios have been reduced to 90 percent and the rate at which CBSL grants advances to commercial banks has been lowered by 500 basis points. Commercial banks cannot declare dividends, share buy backs or increase payments to directors until end-2020. The President announced a debt repayment moratorium, which includes a six month moratorium on bank loans for the tourism, garment, plantation and IT sectors, and small & medium industries, with reduced rate working capital loans and investment-purpose loans for these sectors. There will also be a three-month moratorium on small-value personal banking and leasing loans. The interest rate on credit cards will be capped, for transactions up to a certain amount, with a reduction in the minimum monthly repayment. Financial institutions are also requested to reschedule non-performing loans. Lower capital conservation buffer requirements and a relaxation of loan classification rules have been announced. In addition, state-owned institutions will invest in treasury securities to stabilize the money market rate at 7 percent.    http://archive.fo/nKJdw
notes_C3: Targeted lockdowns continue in Sri Lanka, with closures schools, workplaces, public gatherings and restriction on the number of people who can gather, and curfew-style stay-at-home restrictions.     "Dec 17 2020: COLOMBO: Nazeerwatte in the Wellawatte Police Area has been placed under isolation with immediate effect to stop the spread of Covid 19."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104103453/https://www.newsfirst.lk/2020/12/17/nazeerwatte-in-wellawatte-placed-under-isolation/    "Dec 24 2020: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Sri Lankan authorities on Thursday imposed lockdown on three towns on the outskirts of the capital to contain the spread of COVID-19 during the festive season.  Kosgama, Awissawella and Ruwanwella, about 60 kilometers (37 miles) east of Colombo, were locked down from Thursday noon.  Lockdowns have been applied in dozens of towns and villages since a resurgence of the coronavirus in the Indian Ocean island nation in October. Schools and key public offices have been closed, public gatherings banned and restrictions imposed on public transport.   The two clusters that emerged in October — one centered on a garment factory and other on a fish market — account for most of Sri Lanka’s outbreak. The confirmed cases from the two clusters have grown to 34,959 on Thursday. Sri Lanka’s total since March is about 38,600."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104102936/https://apnews.com/article/sri-lanka-coronavirus-pandemic-asia-colombo-asia-pacific-18179ff86b01754480fb3bd2beff8f9b    Other location-specific lockdown press releases (from the middle of December through early January):  - notes_H7: Since the start of vaccine campaign in Sri Lanka, made possible by the gifting of vaccines by India, 500,000 citizens have been vaccinated with the 'Made in India' COVISHIELD vaccine. The vaccine was given to key workers. Since the arrival of the next 500,000 doses (also COVISHEILD) on 25th February, the vaccine has now been rolled out into public where citizens above the age of 30 are receiving the jab. This has been focused in the Western Province primarily given that this is a current 'hotspot' for the country. (no availability of updated information regarding which specific groups are now currently getting the vaccine)     Source: https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/asiapacific/2021-03/02/c_139778159.htm

name: Lesotho
notes_H1: ‘Manthabiseng National Convention Centre has been identified as designated National Command Centre for Coronavirus (COVID-19). All the information about COVID-19 will be coordinated and accessed from this centre so that the public can be only provided with credible information. Meanwhile, a budget of M60 million targeting information dissemination and human resource emprovement amongst others has also been proposed in this regard and it emerged during this meeting  https://web.archive.org/web/20200506104855/https://www.gov.ls/lesotho-government-identifies-national-command-centre-for-covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200506103816/https://www.gov.ls/about-coronavirus-covid-19/
notes_H3: No evidence of contact tracing available.     See the Prime Minister's COVID-19 Announcement on 1 March 2021 (in Sesotho):   https://web.archive.org/web/20210315122030/https://www.gov.ls/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/Puo-ea-Tonakholo-ka-Lipehelo-tse-Ncha-tsa-Covid-19-28-February-2021-1.pdf  See UK government travel advice, especially on healthcare in Lesotho:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114427/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lesotho/coronavirus
notes_H2: Any health personnel who has been exposed to a confirmed case of Covid-19 shall be subjected to testing and self-isolation https://web.archive.org/web/20200615181342/https://www.gov.ls/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/PUBLIC-HEALTH-COVID-19-REGULATIONS-PDF.pdf A person allowed to enter the country during the period of lockdown shall be subject to screening at the designated point of entry, screening shall be done on people who travelled to affected countries.
notes_C7: There are no restrictions on interzonal or intercity travel within Lesotho. Lesotho returned to an amended purple level on 1 March.    See NACOSEC twitter page:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114415/https://twitter.com/nacosec/status/1366095087126593537/photo/1    See also US embassy information for more clarity: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315120010/https://ls.usembassy.gov/lesothos-new-directive-on-coronavirus-international-arrivals-now-asked-to-self-isolate-for-14-days/
notes_C1: Schools open on a rotational basis, adhering to Standard Risk-Based Guidelines. Lesotho returned to an amended purple level on 1 March.    See NACOSEC twitter page for latest updates:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114415/https://twitter.com/nacosec/status/1366095087126593537/photo/1  See also UK travel advice: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114427/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lesotho/coronavirus
notes_H6: Not sure why this might be coded as 1G. according to the UK FCO website for Lesotho, anyone leaving their place of residence in Lesotho must wear a mask or face covering. This includes in public and private vehicles, walking in the street, and in shops and public offices. See https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lesotho/coronavirus. Also, from the IMF policy response website, see: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 (web archive unavailable, accessed 21 September 2020)
notes_E2: No debt relief noted on government sites or IMF. Government funding focuses on health and prevention.  Government looking for private sector to help with relief.  "The IMF reports that the Governments has funded their current COVID response from the existing health care budget, and has been focused on  health care and prevention. The  Government has also called for private sector support, and Banking Sector in the country has contributed M2 million towards the National Response to Coronavirus (COVID-19). As of the 4th of April there are no fiscal policy measures. However, the Central Bank of Lesotho (CBL) announced it will (1) increase of the NIR target floor from US$630 million to US$660 million, and (ii) reduce the CBL rate by 100 basis points from 6.25 per cent to 5.25 per cent  per annum. "  https://web.archive.org/web/20201023140517/https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1s46Oz_NtkyrowAracg9FTPYRdkP8GHRzQqM7w6Qa_2k/edit?ts=5e836726
notes_C3: All public events cancelled. Exceptions made for church services, with a maximum of 50 people inside and 100 people outside and mask-wearing requirements.    See the prime minister's announcement of Lesotho moving to a more stringent "orange stage" on 6 January 2021 (http://archive.today/2021.01.08-070838/https://www.gov.ls/lesotho-moves-back-to-orange-colour/).  See also NACOSEC twitter communications (http://archive.today/2021.01.08-071252/https://twitter.com/nacosec?lang=en).
notes_C6: Curfew from 8PM to 5AM.    See the prime minister's announcement of Lesotho moving to a more stringent "orange stage" on 6 January 2021 (http://archive.today/2021.01.08-070838/https://www.gov.ls/lesotho-moves-back-to-orange-colour/).  See also NACOSEC twitter communications (http://archive.today/2021.01.08-071252/https://twitter.com/nacosec?lang=en).
notes_C8: Some land borders and Moshoeshoe I airport open. Open only for restricted groups: teachers and students crossing daily and registered entrepreneurs. Otherwise bans from arrivals still apply. Lesotho returned to an amended purple level on 1 March.    See NACOSEC twitter page for latest updates:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114415/https://twitter.com/nacosec/status/1366095087126593537/photo/1  See also UK travel advice: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114427/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lesotho/coronavirus
notes_C2: Workplaces such as retail stores, grocery stores, cafes, salons, banks and communication companies open from 8AM until 6PM. Other businesses, private and NGO institutions permitted to operate with 50% capacity and staff under rotation. Lesotho returned to an amended purple level on 1 March.    See NACOSEC twitter page for latest updates:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114415/https://twitter.com/nacosec/status/1366095087126593537/photo/1  See also UK travel advice:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315114427/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lesotho/coronavirus
notes_C4: All social and family gatherings restricted.     See the prime minister's announcement of Lesotho moving to a more stringent "orange stage" on 6 January 2021 (http://archive.today/2021.01.08-070838/https://www.gov.ls/lesotho-moves-back-to-orange-colour/).  See also NACOSEC twitter communications (http://archive.today/2021.01.08-071252/https://twitter.com/nacosec?lang=en).
notes_C5: "...Minibuses, taxis, and bus services are operating at reduced levels subject to social distancing and mandatory use of face masks for passengers and drivers..."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210117190929/https://ls.usembassy.gov/lesothos-new-directive-on-coronavirus-international-arrivals-now-asked-to-self-isolate-for-14-days/

name: Lithuania
notes_H1: On 1 June, a nationwide campaign ‘Thank You, Lithuania’ to take place to show gratitude to the Lithuanian people for the successful efforts in overcoming the first wave of COVID-19 and to ask them to continue staying focused and hopeful, so as to be ready to confront any other challenges lying do it again.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200611135425/http://lrv.lt/en/news/thank-you-lithuania-campaign-in-honour-of-all-those-who-have-helped-to-overcome-first-wave-of-coronavirus    Moreover, the government is publishing extensive information about the virus and implemented measures via a special website, set-up only for topics of the pandemic:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201125101901/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/
notes_H3: Currently, the contact tracing system in Lithuania is overwhelmed. On 3rd December, newly elected Prime Minister Ingrida Simonyte told that NVSC failed to do contact tracing for all positve cases. Moreover, the newly elected Minister of Health Arunas Dulkys on 12th December told that the priority at the time was that NVSC could complete contact tracing for all cases within 48 hours after positive test result, indicating that it is not currently done.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201212143139/https://www.lrt.lt/naujienos/lietuvoje/2/1290792/simonyte-kritikuoja-nvsc-del-nepasiruosimo-vasara-jei-istinka-koma-nuo-200-nauju-atveju-akivaizdu-kazkas-neveikia  https://web.archive.org/web/20201212143341/https://www.lrt.lt/naujienos/lietuvoje/2/1296629/dulkys-tikina-kaledoms-atsipalaiduoti-negalima-nereiketu-del-to-apgaudineti-saves
notes_H2: The Health Ministry said that all people experiencing cold-like symptoms associated with the coronavirus could now be tested.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200527113044/https://www.lrt.lt/en/news-in-english/19/1156515/when-to-get-tested-for-covid-19-new-rules-in-lithuania-explained
notes_C7: Travelling between municipalities is restricted.    Except:    -to go to/from airports, seaports, bus stations serving international passenger routes;  -to go to the municipality where you live;  -for the death of close relatives;  -to do work, where the place of employment is in another municipality;  -for health care services;  -for other objectively justified reasons of urgency, where travelling to a municipality other than -the place of residence is absolutely necessary.    -This restriction does not apply to members of one family and/or household travelling to a municipality other than the place of their residence where they have real estate property that is owned by a member of that family and/or household.    https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/news/covid-19-related-restrictions-updated-on-3-january-2021
notes_C1: Restrictions remain in place (until 31st January)  https://web.archive.org/web/20210124173336/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/covid-19-related-restrictions-1
notes_H6: From the 21st of February, wearing facemasks will not be mandatory in outdoor public spaces as long as people can remain at least 2 metres apart.
notes_E2: Variety of measures implemented.  Among others:    • To extend the deferral period for payments of residential loans (excluding interest) from 3 to 6 months in the form of a state guarantee for those who have lost their jobs.    • Make it possible to defer the contributions or pay them by installments for electricity and natural gas to AB Ignitis.    • Recommend that municipalities should offer a possibility to defer public utility payments and payments for heat energy or pay them by installments.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210107145102/https://eimin.lrv.lt/en/important-information-for-business-on-coronavirus/important-information-for-business-on-coronavirus-1
notes_E1: When an emergency situation or quarantine is declared, remote work is not always possible, so in complicated situations employers may announce downtime or partial downtime, and the State is ready to contribute to the payment of wages to employees.    When an enterprise declares inactivity due to an emergency or quarantine, the worker shall receive at least the minimum monthly salary and shall not be required to arrive to work. Currently, the minimum monthly salary makes EUR 607 gross or EUR 437 net.    An allowance of a fixed amount will be paid from the Guarantee Fund to self-employed individuals who have paid social security contributions for at least 3 months during the last year period prior to the declaration of the emergency or quarantine.    State support in cases of downtimes and partial downtimes. The employee allowance shall be not less than the minimum monthly salary.    • Sickness benefits for carers of children and persons with disabilities during quarantine in educational establishments or in social care and employment centres.    • To pay EUR 257/month to self-employed residents who have paid social security contributions when quarantine prevents them from carrying out their activities.
notes_C3: source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201101210959/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/news/covid-19-related-restrictions-updated-on-28-october-2020  From 30 October to 13 November 2020, there shall be no events and gatherings held indoor and outdoor in public places, except: high-performance sporting and cultural events (with several crowd restrictions described below); funerals.    crowd restrictions:  * they are held indoors with maximum 300 spectators;    * spectators watch an event seated at a 2 m distance from each other except for family members;   * spectators wear protective equipment covering nose and mouth (face masks, respirators or other equipment) during the entire event (the requirement to wear protective equipment covering nose and mouth (face masks, respirators or other equipment) will not be applicable to persons with disability who cannot wear a mask or where wearing it may adversely affect their health condition; they are recommended to wear a face shield instead);    * electronic distribution of tickets and/or registration of spectators and/or participants, as well as control of the access of spectators and/or participants to the venue is ensured;   * they are held outdoors with maximum 400 spectators provided the conditions referred to above are met:;   events are organised and held where the organisers of an event can ensure electronic distribution of tickets and/or registration of spectators and/or participants and control the access of spectators and/or participants to the venue of the event;
notes_C6: Further tightening of restrictions regarding the ongoing lockdown declared early November:    It is required to stay at home except:    -to go to work (for work purposes);  -to go shopping;  -to go to/from airports, seaports, bus stations serving international passenger routes;  -to go to your real estate property;  -to go to a funeral;  -for health and other essential services;  -for other essential services or for objectively justified reasons where it is absolutely necessary;  -to go for a walk in open spaces only with members of your family or household;  -to attend to the sick or to those unable to take care of themselves.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201228144835/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/news/covid-19-related-restrictions-updated-on-23-december-2020
notes_C8: People returning / arriving from affected countries are subjects to 10-day isolation. Isolation does not apply to those who have a negative test for COVID-19 performed not earlier than 48 hours ago.    You can also be tested in Lithuania. In this case, isolation applies to you until a negative laboratory test is obtained.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210107143201/https://nvsc.lrv.lt/en/information-on-covid-19/for-arrivals-from-abroad
notes_C2: No change in policy  https://web.archive.org/web/20210210141940/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/covid-19-related-restrictions-1
notes_C4: Lithuania’s government on Wednesday declared a three-week lockdown starting on Nov.7 (extended end of November), to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus which has accelerated in recent weeks in the Baltic nation.    Public groups of more than 5 people will be banned and no more than 10 people will be allowed at marriages or funerals.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201114114424/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-lithuania/update-1-lithuania-to-enter-three-week-covid-lockdown-on-saturday-idINL8N2HQ525    See also for official communication:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201202092539/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/news/covid-19-related-restrictions-updated-on-25-november-2020
notes_H7: A, B:     The first doses of the vaccine will be given for the medical staff working in the COVID-19 wards, emergency departments, and those at high risk for COVID-19.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210107161149/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/news/lithuanian-healthcare-workers-start-getting-the-covid-19-vaccine
notes_C5: Lithuania’s government on Wednesday declared a three-week lockdown starting on Nov.7 (extended end of November), to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus which has accelerated in recent weeks in the Baltic nation.    "Passengers travelling by public transport (city, long-distance and suburban) will be required to travel seated maintaining the distance of at least one meter between each other."    No other measures to be found on the official websites of the government which is why I keep the level at 0    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202092539/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/news/covid-19-related-restrictions-updated-on-25-november-2020

name: Luxembourg
notes_H1: Opening of a dedicated Site for information relating to COVID and the states response. Mentioned initially in a facebook post on the 28th of February. Site seems to have gone online on 5th of February. www.gouvernement.lu/coronavirus was the initial site, moving to covid19.lu on the 23rd of March.      https://www.infocrise.lu/fr/web/guest/accueil/-/asset_publisher/uJAlpeXURbmf/content/toutes-les-informations-officielles-et-utiles-regroupe-sur-covid19-lu?inheritRedirect=false&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.infocrise.lu%2Ffr%2Fweb%2Fguest%2Faccueil%3Fp_p_id%3D101_INSTANCE_uJAlpeXURbmf%26p_p_lifecycle%3D0%26p_p_state%3Dnormal%26p_p_mode%3Dview%26p_p_col_id%3Dcolumn-1%26p_p_col_count%3D1%23article_78291#p_101_INSTANCE_uJAlpeXURbmf
notes_H3: First case of COVID on March 1st has been reported and the a team of sanitary inspectors have "retracer son entourage", traced whom he has been in contact with. https://web.archive.org/save/https://coronavirus.gouvernement.lu/en/communications-officielles.gouvernement%2Ben%2Bactualites%2Btoutes_actualites%2Bcommuniques%2B2020%2B03-mars%2B01-premier-cas-corona.html
notes_H2: http://web.archive.org/web/20210208230908/https://covid19.public.lu/en/testing.html
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No    Link - https://web.archive.org/web/20210126075125/https://lu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: On-site classes and activities in the educational and school sector from 8 February until 21 February, the end of the school holiday. Only Exceptions are the Graduating classes ("Première"), where on-site classes are maintained.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210208225654/https://covid19.public.lu/en/news-covid19/communiques/2021/02-fevrier/05-education.html
notes_H6: - in all circumstances for activities open to the public that are circulating and which are taking place in a closed place (e.g. in administrations open to the public, shops and supermarkets), as well as on public transport.  - for any gathering of people that brings together more than 4 people at the same time, either in a closed area or in the open air.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210105163404/https://covid19.public.lu/en/health-protection/protective-measures.html
notes_E2: With regard to direct taxes, the modalities of the advance tax payments and payment deadlines will be adapted for corporations and self-employed persons. More specifically, legal persons and natural persons carrying out an activity generating trade and business income, agriculture and forestry income, or income from independent professional services, who are experiencing liquidity problems due to the Covid-19 pandemic, can apply for a cancellation of the two first quarterly advance tax payments of the year 2020 (due in March and June 2020). Covered by this measure are (corporate) income and municipal business taxes.    In addition, these same persons may request, for taxes due after 29 February 2020, a payment extension of four months. On this deferral, no interest on late payment will be due and it covers (corporate) income, municipal business, and net wealth taxes.  https://mfin.gouvernement.lu/en/actualites.gouvernement%2Ben%2Bactualites%2Btoutes_actualites%2Bcommuniques%2B2020%2B03-mars%2B17-mesures-fiscales-covid19.html
notes_E1: No policy change.     More details here:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201130210640/https://meco.gouvernement.lu/dam-assets/dossiers/Neistart-Letzebuerg-Tableau-Mesures.pdf
notes_C3: Re-opening of sports, culture & cults under strict sanitary conditions. Bars and restaurants   remain closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119032645/https://covid19.public.lu/dam-assets/covid-19/toolbox/nouvelles-mesures/affiche/11-01-2021/10206-DISA-Cov19-Mesures-Jan21-A4-EN.pdf
notes_C6: Curfew: between 9 p.m. and 6 a.m., movements of people in the public space are prohibited. Exceptions to this rule: Travel for professional activity, health care, the purchase of medicines, compelling family reasons, for assistance and care for vulnerable or precarious persons or for childcare, in case of force majeure or situation of necessity...    Link - https://web.archive.org/web/20210105162840/https://covid19.public.lu/en/sanitary-measures/curfew.html
notes_C8: “Measures concerning the entry into Luxembourg of third-county nationals” were updated on the 21st August. “Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the ban on the entry of third-country nationals into the territory of Luxembourg is valid until 15 September 2020.” However, there are exceptions, including for diplomats, third-country nationals travelling for the purpose of study, and healthcare professionals, health researchers, and elderly care professionals. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200902223324/https://guichet.public.lu/en/actualites/2020/aout/11-nouvelles-mesures-entree-ressortissant-tiers.html
notes_C2: From 26 Nov, establishments serving food and drinks are closed to the public. Any commercial operation with a sales area = 400 m2 is subject to a limitation of 1 customer per 10 m2.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201130202547/https://covid19.public.lu/dam-assets/covid-19/toolbox/nouvelles-mesures/affiche/11-26/201124-santelu-mesures-affiche-a4-EN.pdf
notes_C4: indoors and outdoors  › 5-10 pers: mask + distance 2m  › 11 -100 pers: mask + distance 2m + seating place    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119032645/https://covid19.public.lu/dam-assets/covid-19/toolbox/nouvelles-mesures/affiche/11-01-2021/10206-DISA-Cov19-Mesures-Jan21-A4-EN.pdf
notes_H7: A,B,C: Phase 2 of the vaccination campaign began, including people over 75 years old and highly vulnerable people (cancer, organ transplant, trisomie 21 etc). For the elderly, BioNTech/Pfizer and Moderna are preferred.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210302163835/https://lequotidien.lu/a-la-une/vaccination-au-luxembourg-au-tour-des-moins-de-65-ans/
notes_C5: Public transport in Luxembourg is open with sanitary measures in place such as wearing a mask at all times and keeping a distance from other users.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201212185644/https://transports.public.lu/fr/actualites/2020/03-mars-covid-19-transports-modifications-mesures-coronavirus.html

name: Latvia
notes_H1: 2 websites are dedicated to Covid-19: the Centre for Disease Prevention and Control and covid19.org.lv, both of which provide sufficient information on various aspects of the pandemic.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200608214453/https://spkc.gov.lv/en/for-general-public/covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20200617213719/https://covid19.gov.lv/index.php/en
notes_H3: There is a voluntary contact tracing app available, however its not mandatory to use.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201014154613/https://www.baltictimes.com/around_40_000_people_have_downloaded_latvia_s_covid-19_contact_tracing_app/
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/latvia/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.5%20Testing&Type=Section
notes_C1: Ministry of Health  Similarly, in order to reduce the spread of the virus and it would be time for epidemiologists to observe fluctuations in the number of infections, the government decided that pupils in grades 7-12 would learn remotely.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.mk.gov.lv/lv/aktualitates/uz-laiku-jaierobezo-cilveku-kustiba-arpus-katra-sociala-burbula
notes_H6: - From 24 October mouth and nose covering should be worn in any public place.  - Mouth and nose covering should be used during indoor cultural events. The covering can not be removed if you are sitting in a fixed, personalized seat at a cultural event.   - A homemade mask should be made of at least three layers of suitable material (cotton, nylon, etc.) and have ties to secure it behind the ears or behind the head  - May not be used for children under 13 years of age and people who cannot use it for medical reasons, such as functional impairment    https://web.archive.org/web/20201026215815/https://covid19.gov.lv/en/support-society/how-behave-safely/covid-19-control-measures
notes_E2: Tax relief measures have been extended to all companies regardless of their industry sector, provided they meet certain criteria:    "Turnover in March or April 2020 compared to the respective month in 2019 decreased by 30% or more.  Turnover in March or April 2020 compared to the respective month in 2019 decreased by 20%, if one of the three following requirements is met:   The company’s revenues from export amounted to at least 10% of total turnover in 2019, but not less than EUR 500,000.  Average salary paid in 2019 was at least EUR 800.  Long-term investments in fixed assets as at 31 December 2019 was at least EUR 500,000."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200615205427/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/latvia-tax-developments-in-response-to-covid-19.html
notes_E1: While Covid-19 restrictions continue, the government has decided on support measures to companies suffering from Covid-19. The government has approved the following support measures:    "Self-employed persons who apply the general tax payment regime, persons who receive royalties, who have not registered as performers of economic activities, and sole proprietorships whose economic activity has been suspended as a result of the restrictions, or whose income from economic activity has decreased by at least 20% in comparison to this year’s August, September and October, will be eligible for support in the amount of 75% of the average income from economic activity or royalties during Q3 this year; but not exceeding EUR 1,000."    "Self-employed persons who pay the micro-enterprise tax will be eligible for 50% of monthly average income for Q3 this year. Payers of patent payments will be eligible for support of EUR 330."    "Employees working at companies affected by Covid-19 will be eligible for idle-time payment. This support will be at least EUR 330, but not more than EUR 1,000 a month. In addition to idle-time payment, the employee can receive an extra EUR 50 for each dependent child under 24."    "The regulations state that support as compensation for idle time will be paid to the employee at the amount of 70% of the reported monthly average gross salary from 1 August to 30 October this year or of the reported monthly average gross salary for those months after 1 August when the employee actually worked. An employee of a micro-enterprise taxpayer will be eligible for idle-time payment of 50% of the monthly average gross salary at the micro-enterprise for Q3 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201118091001/https://www.lexology.com/library/detail.aspx?g=293a20d7-ee9e-4c68-8962-4dca8247c181
notes_C3: In view of the epidemiological assessments of the growing risks of spread of the COVID-19 virus, a national state of emergency will be declared in Latvia, to be in effect between 9 November and 6 December.    All in-person public events (such as theatre and music performances) are cancelled and banned. No more than 10 people, and members of no more than two households may participate in private meetings. No more than 50 people may participate in public gatherings, rallies and political demonstrations. Members of more than two households may attend to a funeral, up to a total of 10 people (not including the individuals conducting the funerary proceedings).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201113081120/https://mk.gov.lv/en/aktualitates/state-emergency-be-declared-latvia-9-november
notes_C6: No specific measures implemented. There are currently no plans to restrict daytime movement. The clarifications in the security measures for the holiday season approved by the Cabinet of Ministers do not restrict freedom of movement. Public transport will continue to run and people are encouraged to take the opportunity to spend time outdoors in nature.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210111214926/https://mk.gov.lv/en/aktualitates/during-holiday-season-period-silence-must-be-observed-reducing-contact-and-refraining  http://web.archive.org/web/20210111220036/https://mk.gov.lv/en/aktualitates/government-conceptually-agrees-new-years-eve-curfew
notes_C8: From 11th of February to 25th of February, entry into Latvia is only permitted for urgent and important reasons. These include work, learning and study purposes, as well as for humanitarian reasons - to reunite a family, to receive medical services, to accompany a minor, to return to one’s place of residence, or to go to a funeral.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210214175907/https://www.mk.gov.lv/en/article/emergency-situation-extended-until-6-april-requirements-site-trade-and-border-crossings-are-strengthened
notes_C2: From the 8th of February, stores and market pavilions must provide an area of 25 square meters per visitor and information on the maximum number of visitors must be displayed in a visible place at the entrance.  Additionally, the entire assortment of goods may be sold on site in stores where at least 70% of the product range is groceries. Similarly, in stores where at least 70% of the product range is hygiene products, also all other products may be sold on site.Bookstores will also be allowed to sell the full range of goods, i.e. goods allowed so far, stationery, and books.        https://web.archive.org/web/20210214175907/https://www.mk.gov.lv/en/article/emergency-situation-extended-until-6-april-requirements-site-trade-and-border-crossings-are-strengthened
notes_C4: From 24 October, private event venues may have a maximum of 10 people indoors and 100 people outdoors . If a private event is held in a public place, such as a restaurant, rented sauna, club, etc., then guests must be provided with fixed, personalized seating, 2 meters distance (except for persons from one household), as well as the event can take place until 24.00;    https://web.archive.org/web/20201026220648/https://www.mk.gov.lv/lv/aktualitates/nosaka-stingrakus-pulcesanas-un-citus-drosibas-pasakumus
notes_H7: A,C: Vaccines have been rolled out to frontline workers (healthcare personnel and long-term social care workers and clients), as well as the elderly (over 70 years old). During the week ending 21 February, an average of 1170 vaccines had been distributed per day. Information on which groups are receiving which vaccines is not readily available, however the Health Ministry has confirmed it currently has a total of c.54k vaccines (30k Pfizer-BioNTech; 7k Moderna; 17k AstraZeneca).    Ministry of Health vaccine progress (LV only, please use translation tools): https://web.archive.org/web/20210222191026/https://www.vm.gov.lv/lv/jaunums/aizvaditaja-nedela-videji-diena-vakcineti-1170-iedzivotaji  Latvian CDC vaccine page (LV only, please use translation tools): https://web.archive.org/web/20210222191226/https://www.spkc.gov.lv/lv/vakcinas-pret-covid-19
notes_C5: "Nose and mouth coverings must be used (a self-made or purchased mask, scarf, shawl, and other solutions are accepted). Hygiene measures must be observed." Those who have tested positive for Covid-19 must not use public transport. Neither should those who have been in contact with a Covid-19 positive citizen. https://web.archive.org/web/20200617214914/https://covid19.gov.lv/en/support-society/how-behave-safely/covid-19-control-measures

name: Macao
notes_H3: 'In response to the first case of new coronavirus infection in Australia, the SAR government has launched and deployed anti-epidemic work in an all-round way, taking necessary measures including implementing heat detection at ports and filling in entry declaration forms to fully respond to, prevent and control the epidemic.'  https://web.archive.org/web/20200403075243/https://news.gov.mo/detail/zh-hant/N20AV4AiJe;jsessionid=AE280AF2AFB28803D49190392A304F09.app03?0
notes_H2: Nucleic acid tests are open for online reservation for cross-boundary travellers starting from 10am on 15 July.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116151921/https://news.gov.mo/detail/zh-hant/N20GONHgtC;jsessionid=1B46FD21318D0ECC755125E34F5001FD.app02?0
notes_C1: Primary school completely resumes. So far, all schools and universities in Macau have resumed, with social distancing and other public health precautions in place. Kindergarten, which is not part of the K-12, remains suspended.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200520135120/https://news.gov.mo/detail/en/N20EKbDD24;jsessionid=A76EFED4B05FE6FC79888F499FE2EFCC.app01?0
notes_H6: Bus, ferry, taxi passengers must wear facial masks. Visitors to casinos or other entertainment venues must wear facial masks. Source:     http://web.archive.org/web/20200928200710/https://www.gov.mo/zh-hans/global-search/page/4/?q=%E6%88%B4%E5%8F%A3%E7%BD%A9%E6%8C%87%E5%BC%95
notes_E2: The Government announces subsidy for a period of three months of all electricity and water tariffs for the housing units of Macao residents ; rebate of 70 percent of the personal income tax for the fiscal year 2018 paid by each Macao resident liable for such tax; waiver of waive property tax levied on all housing units of Macao residents for the year 2019. Links: https://web.archive.org/web/20200521223141/https://news.gov.mo/detail/en/N20BMQ4RQa;jsessionid=D8FFCC6F49F88A8F26D204A136AEEE98.app03?0 ; https://web.archive.org/save/http://finance.eastmoney.com/a/202002141383532963.html
notes_E1: Apart from the e-voucher, there is a 600-pataca medical voucher to every permanent resident, extra 1-month's relief to means-tested fragile families. Source:    http://web.archive.org/web/20200928182541/http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2020-06/24/content_5521649.htm  The Government would allocate an e-voucher – with a value of 3,000 patacas – to each resident. Such e-vouchers would have to be used within a three-month period and would be accepted only in certain restaurants, retail outlets and shopping centres.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200521223141/https://news.gov.mo/detail/en/N20BMQ4RQa;jsessionid=D8FFCC6F49F88A8F26D204A136AEEE98.app03?0.   [second round of income support was announced on 8 April, see below]
notes_C3: The Cultural Affairs Bureau will resume operation of its performance venues from 26 June (Friday) onwards.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201118134442/https://news.gov.mo/detail/en/N20FVolMk4;jsessionid=DFAE36A2FAA3F4D35DF424019F8D34F3.app02?0
notes_C8: non-resident workers from Zhuhai eligible for exemption from 14-day Macao medical observation.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200520134950/https://news.gov.mo/detail/en/N20EJuYISW;jsessionid=A369E9ABEE675477120F48351381622C.app02?0
notes_C2: public services resume as normal  https://web.archive.org/web/20201118121305/https://news.gov.mo/detail/en/N20Bbsudzy?1
notes_H7: Macau's second stage of vaccine roll-out started on 22 Feb 2021: all Macau residents are eligible to get a jab. The government calls all eligible people to book a slot.    https://archive.vn/2ZPEF  https://archive.vn/W2AER

name: Morocco
notes_H1: The telephone platform of listening and guidance "Allo 300", set up since March 25, 2020 to provide citizens with advice and information on the new coronavirus (Covid-19), has so far recorded about 38,000 phone calls, for an average of 9,500 calls per day, a military source said on Monday.    Retrieved from: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409102532/http://www.maroc.ma/en/news/covid-19-allo-300-platform-records-nearly-38k-calls-average-9500-calls-day
notes_H3: The Ministry of Health ('the Ministry') announced, on 1 June 2020, that it is launching the 'WIQAYTNA' tracing app for contact tracing during the COVID-19 ('Coronavirus') crisis. In particular, the Ministry noted that the app will be based on bluetooth technology and will notify users in case they come into prolonged contact with an individual who has tested positive for Coronavirus. In addition, the Ministry is collaborating closely with the Digital Development Agency and the National Telecommunications Regulatory Authority ('ANRT'), and highlighted that the app has been approved by the Moroccan data protection authority ('CNDP').
notes_H2: If you are exhibiting signs or symptoms of COVID-19, please contact the Moroccan Ministry of Health’s hotline at +212 (0)8-0100-4747. Assistance is available in English, French or Arabic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201121090354/https://ma.usembassy.gov/25161/
notes_C7: A nationwide curfew between the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am.  Regional or local authorities may put into place (sometimes with little notice) travel or other restrictions aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19.  Individuals entering or departing from the Casablanca city limits must have a letter of permission issued by Moroccan authorities. In Casablanca, there is an evening curfew between the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am.  Those who circulate within Casablanca during these hours must have proper authorization from local authorities.    Is a curfew in place? There is a curfew in Casablanca between the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes    https://web.archive.org/web/20210101012734/https://ma.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: Schools are fully open with precautionary measures in place.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201121082517/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H6: The use of masks is mandatory.  Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20201019012009/https://ma.usembassy.gov/25161/  Also see:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201019005808/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/morocco/coronavirus
notes_E2: On October 5, the government launched a new facility to provide financing to real estate firms (Damane Relance Promotion Immobilière). On January 6, 2021 the government extended the Damane Relance facility until end-March 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301111203/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: On March 23, it was announced that: Employees affiliated with the social security system will benefit from a 2000 dirhams monthly allocation (approximately 202 USD). They will also benefit from a suspension of loans and consumption credits reimbursements, until 30 June 2020. With high levels of informality, the Economic Watch Committee decided on 23 March to provide financial relief to informal workers suffering from the economic impact COVID-19.   Workers in the informal sector, starting with households benefiting from the medical assistance  plan RAMED and which no longer have an income due to compulsory confinement, will receive  800 DH per month for households of two people or less; 1,000 DH per month for households  of three to four people; 1,200 DH per month for households of more than four people.  Households without RAMED operating in the informal sector and who have lost their income following compulsory confinement will also benefit from this provision by filling out their requests in an electronic platform dedicated to this purpose.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507103621/https://www.oecd.org/mena/competitiveness/The-Covid-19-Crisis-in-Morocco.pdf
notes_C3: Morocco's Interior Ministry announced cancellation of all sporting, cultural, and artistic events in the country, until further notice from 14 March https://web.archive.org/web/20200601135438/https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/2020/03/296129/morocco-bans-public-gatherings-of-over-50-people-cancels-all-events/
notes_C6: A nationwide curfew between the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am. . In Casablanca, there is an evening curfew between the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am.  Those who circulate within Casablanca during these hours must have proper authorization from local authorities.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210101012734/https://ma.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Government reopens borders to 67 visa-exempt countries with some restrictions. Citizens of those countries cleared to travel to Morocco without a visa will be allowed entry, provided that they have an express invitation from a Morocco company or a confirmed hotel reservation.(MSN News, 14.09.2020).    All travellers planning to fly to Morocco must have valid negative Covid-19 test results issued no more than 48 hours before their flight.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200925052707/https://travelbans.org/africa/morocco/
notes_C2: On December 21, the Government of Morocco announced additional restrictions aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19.  The measures will take effect on Wednesday, December 23 and will remain in place for three weeks. The new measures include the following:  A nationwide curfew between the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am;  A daily closing time for restaurants, cafes, shops, and supermarkets of 8:00 pm;  The closure of all restaurants and cafes in Agadir, Casablanca, Marrakech, and Tangier; and  A ban on all public and private gatherings and parties.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210101012734/https://ma.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: On December 21, the Government of Morocco announced additional restrictions aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19.  The measures will take effect on Wednesday, December 23 and will remain in place for three weeks. The new measures include the following:  A nationwide curfew between the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am;  A daily closing time for restaurants, cafes, shops, and supermarkets of 8:00 pm;  The closure of all restaurants and cafes in Agadir, Casablanca, Marrakech, and Tangier; and  A ban on all public and private gatherings and parties.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210101012734/https://ma.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: A,C : AstraZeneca and Sinopharm are being administered   Morocco on Friday, 12th February began vaccinating people older than 65 years against the novel coronavirus, according to an official statement.     The move came a day after the North African country received a second batch of 4 million doses of the AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine.    According to the Health Ministry's latest data, Morocco has vaccinated over 800,000 people since the start of its vaccination campaign.  All members of the public will be vaccinated as soon as possible, the ministry said in the statement.    On Jan. 28, Morocco began a mass nationwide vaccination drive, starting with top officials to encourage public confidence in the vaccines.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301113528/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/covid-19-morocco-starts-vaccinating-people-aged-65-/2143314
notes_C5: 23 October: Tighter curbs announced for Greater Casablanca, which includes the Casablanca and Mohammadia prefectures and Naouceur and Mediouna provinces, as well as the Berrechid and Benslimane provinces. Measures include the prohibition of all forms of night movement between 9pm and 6am; the closing of community grounds and parks; closing restaurants, cafes, stores and large shopping centres at 8pm; the shutdown of public transportation buses and tramways at 9pm; closing local markets at 3pm; and promoting teleworking when possible.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201029142017/https://www.meed.com/tunisia-pushes-finance-bill-to-cope-with-covid-19

name: Monaco
notes_H1: From 9 am tomorrow, Friday 6 March, the COVID-19 Call Centre, a telephone information service, will take over, staffed by a dedicated team from the Department of Health Affairs (DASA), first aiders from the Monaco Red Cross and a medical supervisor.    Monegasque nationals, residents and employees can contact the centre to discuss any questions they may have about COVID-19 by calling 92 05 55 00. The line will be open every day from 9 am to 6 pm. The centre can also be emailed at the following address: covid19@gouv.mc .    The Prince’s Government would like to remind readers that in the event of any doubt, particularly if you have visited an area where the virus is circulating and have significant symptoms consistent with the disease (fever, cough, breathing difficulties, etc.) you should contact the emergency services directly on 18 or 112.    To avoid infecting others, people with symptoms are asked not to visit their normal doctor.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201203123750/https://en.gouv.mc/Policy-Practice/Coronavirus-Covid-2019/Actualites/CORONAVIRUS-Prince-s-Government-to-expand-COVID-19-telephone-information-service
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20210126123014/https://covid19.mc/en/mesures/jai-ete-en-contact-avec-une-personne-positive-a-la-covid-19-que-faire/
