notes_H1: The Ministry of Health starts a National Campaign using social media, TV spots, podcasts, radio, and others.    Campaign website: https://web.archive.org/web/20200131160919/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minsa/campa%C3%B1as/699-protegete-del-coronavirus    Later, when the first case starts, the Government creates a page of daily-updated information on Coronavirus cases in the country  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200315070841/https://www.gob.pe/coronavirus    Also, during the whole state of Emergency (from March 15), the President addresses the Nation daily at noon to give updates and announce new measures.  Videos from President's messages: https://www.facebook.com/pg/presidenciaperu/videos/ (unable to archive this link)
notes_H3: June 9 - The minister revealed the measures that he considers key to the success in managing the outbreak, although victory cannot be claimed yet: "Strict tracking and early confinement". Despite the fact that Costa Rica was the first Central American country in which a positive case of Covid-19 was registered, "we made decisions at the right time, such as the fact of having suspended mass concentrations and the entry of tourists when we had only 41 cases"    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200701204629/https://www.abc.es/sociedad/abci-rastreo-contactos-y-confinamiento-temprano-claves-milagro-costarricense-gestion-coronavirus-202006091319_noticia.html?ref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2F
notes_H2: Selected points accessible free of charge to anyone with suspect of COVID, where testing will be provided only after medical assessment.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210112033220/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minsa/informes-publicaciones/835888-puntos-covid
notes_C7: In 10 "extreme" risk regions all road and most air interprovincial transport is suspended.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210131194624/https://www.gob.pe/en/institucion/mtc/noticias/326588-mtc-se-suspende-el-transporte-interprovincial-aereo-y-terrestre-en-diez-regiones
notes_C1: Schools remain suspended, there is a limited resumption of in-person teaching at primary and secondary located in rural areas with limited communication and internet connectivity     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104174051/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Everyone must wear face masks outside of homes, and must additionally wear facial protectors on public transport
notes_E2: No update:  /web/20201130215012/https://www.nht.gov.jm/nht-cuts-interest-rates-announces-measures-assist-mortgagors
notes_E1: 16-March. The government disposes the transfer of around USD110 per family. This is not universalmeant for food expenses of vulnerable families for two weeks. As the State of Emergency has been extended this transfer has been disposed more times (same amount for every two weeks).    The transfer was then extended to some Independent Workers (many of them informal), which do not currently hold contracts.     On April 23, the President announced the same transfer but this time with "inverse targeting", meaning it would give the same amount for "everyone but the people in no need, who are currently receiving a salary". This is meant to reach 75% of the total population.
notes_C3: All public events suspended   https://web.archive.org/web/20210104174051/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Until 14 February, there are red areas (Extreme risk: Ancash, Pasco, Huánuco, Junín, Huancavelica, Ica, Apurímac, Lima y Callao) where there is a 24/24 hours total confinement with exceptions only for health and working reasons.  Curfews in place in other regions, with more flexible restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210131191757/https://www.gob.pe/8665-sintomas-del-coronavirus-conocer-si-puedo-haber-contraido-el-covid-19
notes_C8: Published legal restrictions from March 14th 2021, state a modification to international travel: 14 day quarantine is now mandatory for Peruvians and foreign residents after coordination with health authority, suspension of entry of non-resident foreigners was suspended until January 31st 2021.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210314120816/https://busquedas.elperuano.pe/normaslegales/decreto-supremo-que-establece-precisiones-y-modifica-el-decr-decreto-supremo-n-004-2021-pcm-1919992-1/
notes_C2: President of Peru announced heighted restrictions, beginning January 31 - Shopping centre, cinemas, casinos, gyms and clubs are closed to the public. Grocery store, bank and pharmacy open but operating at 40% capacity.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210205200847/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: All social gatherings, including those held in homes with family are prohibited in all of Peru     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104174051/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: A; Sinopharm     Vaccine roll-out continues with phase 1 prioritising any person who provides services.    UPDATE: Ministry of Health have decided to also include those over 60 years in phase 1. Initially the population group had not been considered within the first phase, but due to their vulnerability to the coronavirus and the importance of their protection it has been incorporated.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210314123508/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minsa/noticias/345234-minsa-oficializa-incorporacion-de-adultos-mayores-en-fase-1-de-vacunacion-contra-la-covid-19     Ministry of Health vaccination distribution tracker: https://gis.mi=nsa.gob.pe/GisVisorVacunados/
notes_C5: In the extreme tier, "Interprovincial land and air passengers transport is stopped". In the very high tier, "Interprovincial land passengers transport available with 50% capacity".    https://web.archive.org/web/20210216010029/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/peru/coronavirus

name: Philippines
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200504205049/https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_MYCAYdPcKr-JbVxyCBXwBNoRveB6g2B/view
notes_H3: On 2 February, Speaker Lord Allan Velasco filed House Resolution No. 1536, which proposes a unified national contact tracing protocol that includes the designation of a government agency or body as the centralized repository of information to facilitate a faster health emergency response system.    Velasco stressed the need to strengthen the government’s contact tracing efforts using the most effective and safest system to further boost its response to the Covid-19 pandemic.    He cited that the Philippines is only able to identify at least 7 contacts per coronavirus-infected person when the ideal contact tracing ratio should be 1:37 for urban areas, and 1:30 for rural communities.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210302051017/https://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1130162
notes_H2: Good testing capacity, many asymptomatics are being tested, but through contact tracing, not because it is really generally available.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501000000*/https://theaseanpost.com/article/how-philippines-fighting-covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20200803221412/https://catholicphilly.com/2020/07/news/world-news/manila-bishop-tests-positive-for-covid-19-says-hes-asymptomatic/
notes_C7: There is a curfew in place. "The timing for each curfew is set by the Local Governmental Unit (LGU) and varies by region.  ...  Checkpoints are in place and domestic air travel remains limited. LGUs my request information about your purpose of travel. In general, leisure travel is not permitted at this time."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119020640/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: On 10 February, the Commission of Higher Education and the Department of Health approved guidelines for the gradual reopening of colleges and universities for limited face-to-face classes in areas under general community quarantine (GCQ) and modified general community quarantine (MGCQ).    Higher education institutions with medical and allied health degree programs will be prioritized, including medicine, nursing, medical technology/medical laboratory science, physical therapy, midwifery, and public health.     Other institutions wanting to hold limited physical classes must submit an application. Education authorities will then visit the campus to inspect its compliance with requirements for face-to-face classes.    “The subjects or courses under these priority programs shall be allowed for face-to-face delivering are delimited to specialized laboratory courses or hospital-based clinical clerkship/internship/practicum, including clinical rotations for post-graduate medical interns”    Areas under Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) through March 5, 2021:  Pasay City (Barangays 28, 29, 32,40, 57, 58, 66, 68, 71, 76, 81, 95, 98, 100, 107, 109, 118, 122, 132, 135, 136,143, 155, 156, 159, 162, 175, 177, 178, 183, 190, 192, 201 and one establishment);    Areas under General Community Quarantine (GCQ) through February 28, 2021:  Luzon – National Capital Region, Cordillera Administrative Region: Abra, Apayao, Benguet, Baguio City, Ifugao, Kalinga, and Mountain Province, Province of Batangas; Visayas – Tacloban City; Mindanao – Iligan City, Davao del Norte, Lanao del Sur.    All other areas, including cities of Santiago and Ormoc, are under Modified General Community Quarantine (MGCQ).      https://web.archive.org/web/20210301020932/https://doh.gov.ph/sites/default/files/health-update/jmc2021-001.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301032920/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information
notes_H6: All persons are mandated to wear full-coverage face shields together with face masks, earloop masks, indigenous, reusable, or do-it-yourself masks, or other facial protective equipment which can effectively lessen the transmission of COVID-19, whenever they go out of their residences, pursuant to existing guidelines issued by the national government subject to fair and humane penalties or punishments that may be imposed by LGUs or implemented by law enforcement agencies, respectively.       https://web.archive.org/web/20210301032920/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301051743/https://app.adpc.net/sites/default/files/public/publications/attachments/IATF-EID%20210211%20%E2%80%93%20Omnibus%20Guidelines%20on%20the%20Implementation%20of%20Community%20Quarantine%20in%20the%20Philippines%20with%20Amendments%20as%20of%20February%2011%2C%202021.pdf
notes_E2: No current debt or contract relief for households.    The 60-day grace period on loan and credit card payments expired in December 2020.   The grace period on residential rent has expired.       https://web.archive.org/web/20201221224337/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/economic/rent    https://web.archive.org/web/20210303065851/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/static/resources/rent.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210303064609/https://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/downloads/2020/09sep/20200911-RA-11494-RRD.pdf
notes_E1: No current ongoing income support.     The Bayanihan to Recover As One Act (Bayanihan 2) provided one-time cash grants.  The Social Amelioration Program expired in May 2020.       https://web.archive.org/web/20210303064925/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/frequently-asked-questions/5ee1f5b45edc8d0017492870    https://web.archive.org/web/20210303064609/https://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/downloads/2020/09sep/20200911-RA-11494-RRD.pdf
notes_C3: “The NTF and the Department of the Interior and Local Government shall ensure that areas flagged for local action shall implement strict lockdown of areas in line with the Zoning Containment Strategy, strict enforcement of minimum health standards, and intensified tracing and quarantine of close contacts and isolation of confirmed cases,” the resolution read.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200906185101if_/https://www.onenews.ph/list-areas-under-gcq-starting-aug-16
notes_C6: "Due to the rising COVID-19 cases, the barangay has once again strictly enforced quarantine protocol, allowing only money remittance centers, pharmacies and gasoline stations to operate every Sunday starting February 14, 2021."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210221204943/https://www.philstar.com/the-freeman/cebu-news/2021/02/16/2078142/sunday-stay-home-policy-lahug-starts
notes_C8: The following individuals are allowed to enter the Philippines:  9(E) visa holders – diplomats accredited to the Philippines including foreign embassies and Foreign Government and International Organization Officials  Foreign airline crew  9(C) visa holders – Foreign Seafarer Visa  9(D) visa holders – Treaty Trader Visa (US, Japan, and Germany)  Section13 Series of Commonwealth Act No. 613, as amended (13 quota, 13A, 13B, 13C, 13D, 13E, 13G visas)  RA7919 visa holders (The Social Integration Act of 1995) – granted to qualified foreign nationals who entered the country prior to 30 June 1992  EO324 visa holders – Legal residence granted under EO324 for qualified foreign nationals who entered the Philippines before 1 January 1984  Native Born (NB) visa holders – Foreign children born to foreigners with permanent resident status in the Philippines  Temporary Resident Visa (TRV) holders (based on MO ADD-01-038 / ADD-02-015 [Indians])  MCL-07-021 Permanent Resident visa holders – Chinese nationals married to Filipino citizens    The entry of all persons allowed to enter the Philippines under relevant IATF resolutions shall be subject to the following conditions:  Pre-booked accommodation for at least 7 nights in an accredited quarantine hotel/facility  COVID-19 testing at the quarantine hotel/facility on the 6th day from date of arrival      https://web.archive.org/web/20210211040850/https://www.philippineairlines.com/en/ph/home/covid-19/ArrivingInThePH/EligiblePaxForTravelToPH    https://web.archive.org/web/20210226082834/https://dfa.gov.ph    https://web.archive.org/web/20210224220511/http://www.immigration.gov.ph
notes_C2: In areas under Enhanced Community Quarantine, the following businesses are allowed to operate at full capacity:  Public and private hospitals; health, emergency and frontline services, including those provided by dialysis centers, chemotherapy centers; manufacturers of medicines, medical supplies, devices and equipment, including suppliers of input, packaging, and distribution; industries involved in agriculture, forestry, and fishery and their workers, including farmers, Agrarian Reform Beneficiaries (ARBs), fisherfolk, agri-fishery stores, and such other components of the food value chain; delivery and courier services, whether in-house or outsourced, transporting food, medicine, or other essential goods, including clothing, accessories, hardware, housewares, school and office supplies, as well as pet food and other veterinary products.    In areas under Enhanced Community Quarantine, the following business are allowed to operate at a maximum of 50% capacity:  Private establishments and their employees involved in the provision of essential goods and services, and activities in the value chain related to food, medicine and vitamins production, medical supplies, devices and equipment, and other essential products. Such establishments shall include, but shall not be limited to, public markets, supermarkets, grocery stores, convenience stores, laundry shops, food preparation establishments insofar as take-out and delivery services, water-refilling stations; media establishments and their total permanent staff complement, inclusive of reporters and other field employees; workers accredited by the Department of Transportation (DOTr) to work on utility relocation works.    Areas under Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) through March 5, 2021:  Pasay City (Barangays 28, 29, 32,40, 57, 58, 66, 68, 71, 76, 81, 95, 98, 100, 107, 109, 118, 122, 132, 135, 136,143, 155, 156, 159, 162, 175, 177, 178, 183, 190, 192, 201 and one establishment);    Areas under General Community Quarantine (GCQ) through February 28, 2021:  Luzon – National Capital Region, Cordillera Administrative Region: Abra, Apayao, Benguet, Baguio City, Ifugao, Kalinga, and Mountain Province, Province of Batangas; Visayas – Tacloban City; Mindanao – Iligan City, Davao del Norte, Lanao del Sur.    All other areas, including cities of Santiago and Ormoc, are under Modified General Community quarantine (MGCQ).      https://web.archive.org/web/20210301040743/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/economic/establishments    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301051743/https://app.adpc.net/sites/default/files/public/publications/attachments/IATF-EID%20210211%20%E2%80%93%20Omnibus%20Guidelines%20on%20the%20Implementation%20of%20Community%20Quarantine%20in%20the%20Philippines%20with%20Amendments%20as%20of%20February%2011%2C%202021.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301035212/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/static/resources/estab.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301032920/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information
notes_C4: "To curtail the coronavirus outbreak, the government has implemented non-pharmaceutical interventions, including school closures, community quarantines, and postponement of large-scale public events."  https://web.archive.org/web/20210127211646/https://www.news-medical.net/news/20210118/Understanding-the-Philippines-relative-success-with-COVID-19.aspx
notes_C5: In areas under General Community Quarantine and Modified General Community Quarantine, the road, rail, maritime, and aviation sectors of public transportation are allowed to operate at such capacity and following the protocols as provided for by the DOTr.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210301051743/https://app.adpc.net/sites/default/files/public/publications/attachments/IATF-EID%20210211%20%E2%80%93%20Omnibus%20Guidelines%20on%20the%20Implementation%20of%20Community%20Quarantine%20in%20the%20Philippines%20with%20Amendments%20as%20of%20February%2011%2C%202021.pdf      General Community Quarantine (GCQ) through March 31, 2021:  Luzon?– National Capital Region, Batangas, Baguio City, Apayao, Kalinga, and Mountain Province in the Cordillera Administrative Region.   Visayas?–Tacloban City; and Mindanao – Davao City, Iligan City, and Lanao Del Sur.  All other areas are under?Modified General Community Quarantine (MGCQ).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210309014800/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Papua New Guinea
notes_H1: This document uploaded on 12th April on website of Ministry of health mentions about comprehensive public awareness campaigns  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.health.gov.pg/subindex.php?news=1
notes_H3: Contact tracing is ongoing for the cases confirmed in the last week. However, additional resources are required to improve monitoring of persons in quarantine, facility assessments and in instituting home quarantine.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200815212756/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/Situation%20Report/PNG%20COVID-19%20Health%20Situation%20Report%2033%20%282020-08-09%29_FINAL.pdf
notes_H2: "COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Papua New Guinea? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes  Symptomatic persons are generally able to obtain government-paid or government-subsidized testing services at Port Moresby General Hospital and the Taurama Aquatic Center drive-through testing site operated by St. John Ambulance service. Testing services outside of Port Moresby may be obtained by visiting a provincial hospital or by calling 1800 200 and asking for more information.  Non-symptomatic persons and persons who need testing services in connection with travel may obtain such services through approved swabbing centers and private medical facilities, including:  St John Ambulance  2K Medical Clinic  Pacific International Hospital  Aspen Medical  Sky Medical Services  Testing conducted through private medical facilities may cost as much as 250 USD.  Though electronic test results from such facilities are generally available within 24-48 hours, U.S. citizens who need tests in connection with travel are advised to request clear estimates of the turn-around and delivery methods for test results."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119024845/https://pg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: http://web.archive.org/web/20210315135519/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/452771/papua-new-guinea-authorities-tightening-covid-19-restrictions-in-morobe-province-through-march-19
notes_C1: Policy remains same where schools remain open however they are instructed to follow restrictions such as:  1) Social distancing of 1.5 meters  2) Wash hands with soap and use hand sanitizers  Refer to: https://web.archive.org/web/20201006124957/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/National%20Pandemic%20Measures/Pandemic%20Measures%2005102020/M%209%20Oct%202020.pdf
notes_H6: People must wear face coverings at all indoor locations, including offices and government agencies, public transport, and airplanes, nationwide, except if under 12 years old or while eating. The government is requiring businesses and public transport operators to deny entry to people without face coverings. All companies with indoor operations must provide workers with face coverings and ensure their use.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210315135045/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/453736/papua-new-guinea-authorities-issue-additional-covid-19-restrictions-nationwide-as-of-march-11-update-27
notes_E2: Commercial banks agreed to provide loan repayment holidays to affected households and businesses for three months (a package estimated at PGK 600 million). See World Bank PNG Economic Update, archived https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/png/publication/papua-new-guinea-in-the-time-of-covid-19---from-relief-to-recovery
notes_E1: Couldn't find any indication of monetary support. Extending a credit line or allowing employees to dip into their provident funds cannot be counted here.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221143702/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Papua New Guinea continues to implement social-distancing measures nationwide due to ongoing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) activity. Authorities continue to ban gatherings of more than 50 people. Religious congregations, sporting events, and markets are exempt from the restrictions, but these establishments must ensure adequate social distancing and that patrons observe safe hygiene practices. Tighter measures, including a curfew and travel restrictions, are ongoing in West New Britain Province through at least Jan. 22.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210111174819/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/424826/papua-new-guinea-covid-19-restrictions-continue-nationwide-as-of-jan-4-update-24  Authorities have increased social distancing and other restrictions in West New Britain Province through at least Jan. 21, due to a coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak. A daily 2200-0500 curfew will continue throughout the province. Residents seeking medical or police support or employees who must travel during curfew hours are exempt from the measure. The government has banned most public gatherings, including sporting and cultural events; however, religious services can continue with social-distancing measures in place. Provincial or national church gatherings remain banned. Markets, fuel stations, ports, and essential businesses can continue to operate. Restaurants will remain open for takeaway services, except alcohol sales; establishments inside hotels can continue to serve alcohol with food.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210104093800/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/424821/png-west-new-britain-enacting-covid-19-restrictions-as-of-jan-4
notes_C6: Authorities have increased social distancing and other restrictions in West New Britain Province through at least Jan. 21, due to a coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak. A daily 2200-0500 curfew will continue throughout the province. Residents seeking medical or police support or employees who must travel during curfew hours are exempt from the measure. The government has banned most public gatherings, including sporting and cultural events; however, religious services can continue with social-distancing measures in place. Provincial or national church gatherings remain banned. Markets, fuel stations, ports, and essential businesses can continue to operate. Restaurants will remain open for takeaway services, except alcohol sales; establishments inside hotels can continue to serve alcohol with food.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210104093800/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/424821/png-west-new-britain-enacting-covid-19-restrictions-as-of-jan-4
notes_C8: ALL INCOMING PASSENGERS REQUIRED TO UNDERGO 14-DAY QUARANTINE REGARDLESS OF COUNTRY   https://covid19.info.gov.pg/index.php/2021/01/27/all-incoming-passengers-required-to-undergo-14-day-quarantine-regardless-of-country-of-origin-says-manning/
notes_C2: NATIONWIDE    See Measure No. 9 of the National Pandemic Act 2020, updated 20th Jan 2021:    "2. Licensed premises that sell takeaway alcohol, shall not sell alcohol on Saturdays or Sundays.    7. Licensed bookmakers may only operate:  a. on Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays; and  b. only at venues located in places listed in Schedule 1"    See document, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/ec8qwl77a71xv89/PNGMeasure09-20210120.pdf
notes_C4: As per the Australian government's advisory on PNG, there is a restriction on gatherings to 50 people in PNG. See section labelled "COVID-19".    See the Australian Government's SmartTraveller page on PNG, archived at https://archive.vn/DZccl
notes_C5: See Measure No. 11 of the National Pandemic Act 2020, updated 20th Jan 2021:    "2. Taxis may operate so long as the driver and all passengers are wearing a mask or face covering in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin.    3. All persons on public transport including the driver and passengers must at all times while on the public transportation wear a mask or face covering in compliance with the requirements in Measure 10."    Document archived on Dropbox, available at https://www.dropbox.com/s/mgizm9o5mojnlpg/PNGMeasure11-20210120.pdf

name: Poland
notes_H1: Health authority launches a 24/7 coronavirus hotline and a broader public information campaign: https://gis.gov.pl/aktualnosci/calodobowa-infolinia-nfz-o-koronawirusie/
notes_H3: Poland introduces an app to support contact tracing efforts in April 2020. Unable to find sufficient evidence of comprehensive contact tracing to warrant a 2 code.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201126151616/https://eandt.theiet.org/content/articles/2020/06/poland-switches-to-privacy-conscious-contact-tracing-app/
notes_H2: Testing is widely available for those showing symptoms. Drive-through centers aroudn the country can perform the test for symptomatic individuals, although an appointment arranged by phone is needed.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200610224903/https://ug.edu.pl/news/en/295/first-covid-19-walk-thru-mobile-testing-center-poland-opened-university-gdansk
notes_C7: Restrictions return to previous levels following a ban of movement from December 31, 2020 to January 1, 2021, from 19:00 to 6:00.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210101210448/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/przedluzamy-etap-odpowiedzialnosci-i-wprowadzamy-dodatkowe-ograniczenia
notes_C1: "Niedzielski announced earlier that shopping malls, hotels and schools in the Warminsko-Mazurskie region would have to close as it has reported a relatively high number of new coronavirus infections."     Takes effect from Saturday, Feb 27 for initially two weeks.     https://archive.is/fCphU
notes_H6: ***Recoded from 3G to 2G; while masks are required in many public spaces, they are not required at others (see list of exemptions below)     Covering the mouth and nose in public spaces is obligatory throughout the entire country!    It is mandatory to cover your mouth and nose in such places as:    -on streets, roads and in town squares, within cemeteries, promenades, boulevards, vehicle parking areas, forest car parks,  -in buses, trams and trains,  -in shops, malls, banks, markets and post offices  -in cinemas and theatres,  -at physician’s offices, in outpatient clinics and hospitals, in massage and tattoo parlours  -in churches, at schools and universities,  -In government offices (when going there to take care of certain matters) and other civic centres.    Where is it not mandatory to cover your mouth and nose? In forests, parks, green squares, botanical gardens, historic gardens, family community gardens and on beaches as well as while travelling by private car.    Important!  Exemption from the obligation to cover the mouth and nose is limited only to persons who have a medical certificate or a document confirming:    -a pervasive developmental disorder,  -a mental disorder,  -moderate, severe or profound intellectual disability,  -difficulties in uncovering the mouth or nose on their own.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210127093533/https://www.gov.pl/web/coronavirus/temporary-limitations
notes_E2: According to the announcement of the Polish government:  - 90% reduction rents for tenants of premises and the so-called islands in shopping malls, as long as these facilities are prohibited from operating normally;  - exemption from charging contractual penalties for - related to the epidemic - delays in the execution of tenders;  - enabling municipalities to refrain from charging real estate tax on companies that have lost their liquidity due to the coronavirus epidemic.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507081400/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/tarcza
notes_E1: Note: New 2020 budget - Wage subsidies for employees of affected businesses and self-employed persons. Businesses, regardless of their size, may apply for a three-month subsidy in the event of work stoppages or reduced working time. This subsidy covers social insurance contributions, and it ranges from 50 to 90 percent of the minimum wage for each employee, depending on recorded decrease in turnover in 2020. The subsidy includes furloughed employees. See: [web archive unavailable, accessed 28th September 2020]
notes_C3: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C6: The following restrictions will come into effect on Saturday, October 24:     - The entire territory of Poland will become a 'red' zone;     - Restaurant activity will be limited for two weeks to serving only takeaway food;    - Grades four to eight in elementary schools will switch to remote learning;     - Secondary schools and higher learning institutions will switch to remote learning.    - Between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., children under the age of 16 will be allowed to leave their homes only in the company of an adult;    - Spectators will be banned from sporting events;    - There will be a 25-percent cap on audiences at all cultural events;    - Swimming pools, aquaparks and fitness clubs will be closed;    - Sanatoria will be closed;    - The number of people at retail premises of up to 100 square metres will be capped at five per checkout;     - The number of customers in retail premises above 100 square metres will be limited to one person per 15 square metres;    - Public transport will be limited to 50 percent of seating capacity or 30 percent of total capacity;    - Gatherings of more than five people will be banned, except for people living together in one home;    - Persons aged 70 and above are to encouraged to stay at home, apart from performing their professional activities, meeting their essential daily needs and participating in religious ceremonies.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C8: Poland has reopened all its EU borders for the first time in nearly three months.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200623114912/https://www.euronews.com/2020/06/13/coronavirus-poland-reopens-all-its-eu-borders-for-first-time-in-nearly-three-months
notes_C2: Poland will close restaurants and bars for two weeks.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C4: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_H7: The Polish Vaccine roll out begins on the 30th of December. Medics, social workers, uniformed services, teachers and senior citizens are the first groups to get the jab (groups A and C). The current vaccination on offer is the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccination.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210101162924/https://www.thefirstnews.com/article/poland-receives-first-covid-19-vaccines---pm-18660
notes_C5: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia

name: Puerto Rico
notes_H1: Public information campaigns were publicized by the Department of Health of Puerto Rico since March 2:  https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=661482714669484  The videos are available in the Facebook account of the Department: https://web.archive.org/web/20200803151642/https://www.facebook.com/deptsaludpr/?__tn__=kC-R&eid=ARC3Vwj74KwE9-GMzQeZkNJ_1hj5gfYxoCy6PtAVUUgwqza0HttA5YBU6Bn8XwEhMGWbFm6Eaj8qlUsQ&hc_ref=ARSt2fHLxygDFAEJ6R6xPuHgB7pbLLqLKkxYPNo6ooSUNKrodY5H2fiX7V8m8blvv44&fref=nf&__xts__%5B0%5D=68.ARC8cC1Mns5OgVSuEFm1KM7WD1VZ3NRbP6GB8cATeggM5F_JHj3snzo05ASvH6WeMq3aXI5vca0EXWjF89QAXgAgkgyCkGlFXOaQHXJQr3qUJhZigCB18Va7y2quZ2EAZbOkPAX4Jft_ILwqn_1JLK0NrztGTBnFBlC7sE9avFXurNkCvBV7V5mbkFZyjAV1H9sjCAqkGnGYqw9mZpMHt70Xl7syN-EKGK-mMDeTSSd6MaW3-aWWFhm_lVSaDDIySJ4lP81CMdYZyE8ji5omB-NCVZH4bOK4vEwdWaGo29iZEocbzl7aeHdDEoF4Xmj5NyrMj72vF01Kl-oWjUJWp6t6mA Another example from April 5, here: https://web.archive.org/web/20200803151927/https://www.telemundopr.com/fotosyvideos/asi-fue-la-campana-de-prevencion-contra-el-covid-19/2067138/
notes_H3: A: If you develop symptoms, you should call your doctor or the emergency room beforehand and mention your symptoms or if you have had contact with someone who has symptoms or is sick with COVID-19. If you are not ill, but have had contact with someone with symptoms of illness, contact a healthcare provider and provide this information. Using this information, your healthcare professional will determine if you need a lab test for COVID-19.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308181637/https://states.aarp.org/puerto-rico/covid-19-vaccine-distribution
notes_H2: Q: Can I have a lab test to see if I have COVID-19?  A: If you are hospitalized, you will be tested. If you feel unwell and have symptoms, you should see your doctor so that he can evaluate you and give you a referral for sampling. A medical order is required to perform it. Some clinical laboratories are doing it privately, as well as some municipalities. In most cases they will ask you to have a medical order, but in the case of some municipalities the order is not necessary. Contact your laboratory or municipality to see if they are doing it.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308181637/https://states.aarp.org/puerto-rico/covid-19-vaccine-distribution
notes_C7: No evident policy change. Some internal transport services are reserved for locals only. Ferry service to Vieques remains available to residents only.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116183439/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines
notes_C1: According to the Miami Herald, Governor Pedro Pierluisi announced yesterday schools will open gradually starting March 1st.  In order to open, schools will need to comply with guidelines outlined by the health department and receive an authorization for in-person classes following an inspection.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308174640/https://www.wmfe.org/puerto-rico-to-begin-opening-school-campuses-for-in-person-learning/174773
notes_H6: Face coverings are required in public.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308170126/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines
notes_E2: Disaster relief rules are in place for loans in US and Puerto Rico qualified plans.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308180437/https://www.natlawreview.com/article/us-and-puerto-rico-issue-rules-non-covid-19-disaster-relief-retirement-plans
notes_E1: On February 12, the call to submit applications through the SURI platform of the Department of Treasury will be opened. This call is to provide financial assistance to formal small merchants whose operations were interrupted by the prevention measures that have been taken since March 15, 2020. http://web.archive.org/web/20210214032412/https://www.fortaleza.pr.gov/content/gobernador-anuncia-las-gu-para-proveer-nueva-asistencia-econ-mica-peque-os-comerciantes  http://web.archive.org/web/20210213124714/http://www.hacienda.gobierno.pr/publicaciones/carta-circular-de-rentas-internas-num-21-04-cc-ri-21-04
notes_C3: "Section 13 of the Executive Order provides that proposals for virtual concerts and theater activities may be submitted for the approval and authorization of the Governor’s Chief of Staff.     Mass gatherings where the crowding of persons is encouraged are unauthorized by the Executive Order. "    Starting on July 17th, and within permissible curfew hours, only individual sports and recreational training that do not entail physical contact are allowed. Competitive activities of any kind, professional or non-professional, are not allowed during the effectiveness of the Executive Order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200725085640/http://www.mcvpr.com/newsroom-publications-Executive-Order-EO-2020-054    https://web.archive.org/web/20200725085640/http://www.mcvpr.com/newsroom-publications-Executive-Order-EO-2020-054
notes_C6: As part of the Executive Order 2020-062 (20 August), citizens are allowed to leave their houses to practice exercise and outdoor activities from Monday to Saturday (in non-curfew hours). On Sundays, people are required to stay at home.    * Official decree (see 2020-062, page 33)  http://web.archive.org/web/20200831194511/https://www.estado.pr.gov/en/executive-orders/    * Other sources  http://web.archive.org/web/20200831201234/https://www.elpais.cr/2020/08/19/decreto-de-gobernadora-de-puerto-rico-cierra-playas-por-covid-13/
notes_C8: Travelers entering the Island are required to fill out a Travel Declaration Form through the Puerto Rico Health Department’s online portal, get a PCR molecular COVID-19 test (nasal or throat swab) no more than 72 hours prior to visiting the Island, and show proof of a negative result or they must quarantine.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308170126/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines
notes_C2: As part of the Executive Order 2020-062 (20 August), the Governor announced a the start of a 24-hour lockdown every Sunday until 11 September. During these days, only pharmacies, grocery stores, gas stations, and hardware stores will be allowed to open.  * Official decree (see 2020-062, page 37) http://web.archive.org/web/20200831194511/https://www.estado.pr.gov/en/executive-orders/  * Other sources http://web.archive.org/web/20200831184222/https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/video/puerto-rico-decreta-cuarentena-total-los-domingos/
notes_C4: Group gatherings are prohibited.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308170126/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines
notes_H7: Puerto Rico is administering COVID-19 vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna to adults age 65 or older, with priority initially given to adults over 75 and frontline workers.  Health care workers and residents and staff of long-term care facilities, community centers and homes for those with intellectual disabilities are also being vaccinated.  https://archive.st/archive/2021/1/states.aarp.org/7yrh/states.aarp.org/puerto-rico/covid-19-vaccine-distribution.html
notes_C5: The Puerto Rico Metropolitan Bus Authority (AMA) and Tren Urbano subway system are operating. Face coverings are mandatory for drivers and passengers.  Ferries to Culebra are operating. Ferry service to Vieques remains available to residents only.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308170126/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines

name: Portugal
notes_H1: https://twitter.com/DGSaude/status/1221389443623505920    From 26th january on the social medias from Portuguese government have been posting about COVID-19, the symptons and cases when people have to inform the government about returning from a trip.
notes_H3: The Prime Minister announced that "At the moment, fortunately, there are no overdue epidemiological inquiries, and all the delays that existed have been recovered. We can even reduce the number of people involved in tracking activities, namely from the Armed Forces military".      Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210309231920/https://www.rtp.pt/madeira/politica/nao-ha-inqueritos-epidemiologicos-atrasados_55370
notes_H2: https://www.americanprogress.org/issues/security/news/2020/04/10/482998/migrant-model-follow-portugals-response-coronavirus/  https://www.themayor.eu/en/porto-opens-first-coronavirus-drive-thru-testing-centre-in-portugal
notes_C7: "Until further notice, there is a ban on travelling between municipalities at the weekend from 8pm on Friday to 5am the following Monday morning. If you have to travel for essential purposes, such as to go to work or for medical treatment, be prepared to show evidence of the essential nature of your journey, if required to do so by the police."     http://web.archive.org/web/20210314164727/https://pt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210226224854/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/portugal/coronavirus
notes_C1: "The Prime Minister announced a 15-day school break (for all levels), starting on Friday (January 22), which is justified by a "precautionary principle" because of the increase in the number of cases of the most contagious variant of SARS-CoV-2 , which have grown from around 8% prevalence in the past week to around 20% today."     "The Government closed the schools again, due to the exponential increase of cases of covid-19 in the country, and, after a suspension of the teaching activities, the classes will resume at a distance on Monday, February 8th."    Sources:   http://web.archive.org/web/20210130172354/https://sicnoticias.pt/especiais/coronavirus/2021-01-21-Covid-19.-Governo-decide-fechar-todos-os-niveis-de-ensino-por-15-dias  https://web.archive.org/web/20210206172748/https://tvi24.iol.pt/sociedade/ensino-a-distancia/telescola-estes-sao-os-novos-horarios-para-as-aulas-em-casa
notes_H6: Portugal's parliament on Friday passed a bill which imposed the mandatory use of a mask on the street and public spaces in an effort to contain the spread of the coronavirus.    The order was passed a day after authorities reported 3,270 new coronavirus cases, the highest single-day increase since the beginning of the pandemic. It will be in effect for at least 70 days.    The use of a mask is compulsory for all people "over ten years old to access, circulate or stay in public spaces and roads whenever the physical distance recommended by health authorities are impossible", according to the bill.    The obligation between "people from the same household, when they are not in the proximity of third parties" can be waived or by means of a "medical certificate" that the clinical condition or cognitive impairment does not allow the use of masks.    It is also not mandatory to wear a mask when "it is incompatible with the nature of the activities that people are carrying out."    Those who violate the order face fines of between 100 euros ($118) and 500 euros ($590). Other items such as visors will not be acceptable as substitutes.    The order will be reassessed following the expiry of the mandated period with a renewal a possibility."    These rules will be applied from Wednesday, October 28."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20201028100351/https://newsaf.cgtn.com/news/2020-10-24/Portugal-s-Parliament-approves-mandatory-use-of-masks-in-outdoor-areas-UPMSI69oJy/index.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20201028100922/https://sicnoticias.pt/especiais/coronavirus/2020-10-27-A-partir-de-quarta-feira-vai-ter-de-usar-mascara-na-rua
notes_E2: "The Portuguese government has approved a moratorium on bank loan repayments for households and companies affected by the coronavirus outbreak which has been extended until end-September 2021. The date by which households and companies can avail themselves of the moratoria was recently extended until the end of March 2021."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210213155040/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#P    The Government will support all families, irrespectively of their income, during the general lockdown (that started on Friday, January 15), by paying 10% of their electricity bills. The measure will cost between 20 and 25 million euros (monthly). For low income families, the reduction in the electricity bill might reach 40%.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210118164726/https://eco.sapo.pt/2021/01/12/governo-apoia-familias-com-cerca-de-10-da-fatura-da-luz/    "After a discussion in plenary on December 18, 2020 (...) it became evident that there was a parliamentary majority to guarantee the suspension of the termination of lease agreements, housing and non-housing, until 30 June 2021.    Landlords will not be able to terminate lease agreements, even if the tenancy period has expired, unless there is an agreement with the tenant or the latter fails to pay any rent. This suspension will remain in place until at least June 30, 2021."    Source: https://archive.vn/dK7NP
notes_E1: "The Government approved a diploma that follows the rule of the State budget that provides that the mechanisms for reducing or suspending workers' contracts - the so-called lay-off, which currently has three versions - no longer imply wage cuts, passing the maturity to be guaranteed to 100%.    However, according to the document shared by the Council of Ministers, in the case of the classic lay-off of the Labor Code, which has existed for several decades, wage cuts of one third of the salary continue to apply if the lay-off has started before 1 January 2021.     "It is established that all workers who are covered by the simplified lay-off, lay-off of the Labor Code (motivated by the Covid-19 disease pandemic and which begins after January 1, 2021) and extraordinary support for the progressive resumption of activity will receive 100% of their normal gross remuneration up to 3 Minimum Guaranteed Monthly Remuneration (RMMG) ", that is, 1,995 euros," with no additional effort by employers ", indicates the Government in the statement of the Council of Ministers .    Thus, a lay-off that started in October, for example, and continues until March 2021, will NOT be covered by the 100% payment guarantee."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210130171645/https://www.jornaldenegocios.pt/economia/detalhe/governo-aprova-lay-off-com-salarios-pagos-a-100-mas-abre-excecoes    Note: Since the measure only applies to those who make the request AFTER January 1, 2021 ("wage cuts of one third of the salary continue to apply if the lay-off has started before 1 January 2021") and not to all workers in lay-off, the code remains unchanged.
notes_C3: No guidance found. But it seems that public events are not taking place.
notes_C6: "The State of Emergency was decreed until 30 January, defining circulation restrictions from 0:00 on 15 January. (...) There will be a general duty of home retreat. It will not be allowed to circulate in public spaces and roads, with the exception of authorized travel on which the following stand out: acquisition of essential goods and services; access to public services; professional activities (if accompanied by a statement); health reasons; assistance to vulnerable people; short walks for physical activity, individually or with members of the same household; pet walk; travelling necessary to enter or leave the mainland, including those necessary to travel to and from the place of accommodation; homecoming within the framework of permitted situations; refuelling at petrol stations as part of permitted journeys."    Source: https://archive.vn/japFQ#selection-2285.0-2285.111
notes_C8: https://www.publico.pt/2020/03/10/economia/noticia/governo-suspende-voos-territorio-italiano-causa-coronavirus-1907157    Portugal suspends flights to Italy.     Bans flights from and to Spain.
notes_C2: The country entered the new confinement after midnight on Friday, January 15. The measures essentially focused on the compulsory home collection and the physical closure of commercial establishments considered non-essential.    However, the number of infected people in Portugal continues to grow and the Prime Minister António Costa announced new containment measures - that will come into force on January 20 -  in an attempt to halt the exponential growth of the pandemic. The ADDITIONAL measures announced include (see previous note):    - The sale or delivery of products to the wicket is prohibited in any establishment of the non-food business, such as clothing;  - Prohibited the sale or delivery of products of any type of drinks, such as coffee, in food establishments that are authorized to practice take-away;  - All dining spaces in shopping centers must close, even for take-away;  - Senior Universities, Day Centers and Community Centers are required to close;  - All workers who have to travel to provide face-to-face work, need a credential issued by their employer;  - All service companies with more than 250 workers must, within the next 48 hours, send to the authority for working conditions, the nominal list of all workers whose face-to-face work they consider indispensable;  - All establishments of any nature must close at 8 pm on working days and at 1 pm on weekends, with the exception of the food retail which may be open until 5 pm on weekends.    Source: https://archive.vn/Lezq6
notes_C4: On September 15, Portugal has entered into a state of contingency "in what the Prime Minister António Costa calls a “new phase”, and with that comes new measures to avoid the spread of the virus. Among the first measures adopted by the government, announced this Thursday, "are the reduction of the limit of people in gatherings as well as the number of people seated per table in restaurants.    After a Council of Ministers meeting, António Costa announced to the country what will change in the coming days. The main measures announced are:    Gatherings limited to ten people;  Commercial establishments are not allowed to open before 10 am, with exceptions;  Establishments must close between 8 pm and 11 pm, and the time must be set by the mayors of the respective municipalities;  In the catering areas of shopping centres no more than four people can sit at a table.  Ban on the sale of alcoholic beverages at petrol stations and, from 8 pm onwards, in all establishments (except meals)."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201018213856/https://econews.pt/2020/09/10/portugals-state-of-contigency-is-coming-prime-minister-reveals-new-measures/  http://web.archive.org/web/20201018213429/https://www.sns.gov.pt/noticias/2020/09/10/covid-19-situacao-de-contingencia/
notes_H7: Phase 1 From December 2020: Health professionals involved in patient care, Professionals in the armed forces, security forces and critical services, Professionals and residents in Residential Structures for the Elderly (ERPI) and similar institutions, Professionals and users of the National Integrated, Continuing Care Network (RNCCI).    From February 2021 : People aged =50 years, with at least one of the following pathologies: Cardiac insufficiency Coronary heart disease, Renal insufficiency (Glomerular Filtration Rate <60ml / min)  (COPD) or chronic respiratory disease under ventilatory support and / or long-term oxygen therapy.  People aged 80 and over.    The Prime Minister said "this week we started the second part of the first phase, now addressing everyone over 50 years old who have a set of associated diseases and to the entire population over 80 years old, and also to all those who provide essential services to the country, namely those who work in the security forces and services "    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210206180604/https://covid19estamoson.gov.pt/vacinacao-covid19/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210206180731/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/pt/gc22/comunicacao/noticia?i=comeca-vacinacao-das-forcas-de-seguranca-armadas-e-de-trabalhadores-de-servicos-essenciais
notes_C5: Limits in the number of passengers in public transport to 1/3 of capacity  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f     "O estabelecimento da redução do número máximo de passageiros por transporte para um terço do número máximo de lugares disponíveis, por forma a garantir a distância adequada entre os utentes dos transportes"

name: Paraguay
notes_H1: Since March 23 the Ministry of Health published campaign materials about COVID::  https://www.mitic.gov.py/noticias/coronavirus-covid19-materiales-de-comunicacion-para-empresas-y-organizaciones   See videos published by the Ministry of Health  here:  https://www.facebook.com/ministeriodesaludparaguay/videos/
notes_H3: As informed previously, the government has kept doing limited contact tracing.
notes_H2: Testing of those who are symptomatic (defined as possessing present three or more symptoms related to the disease: fever, cough, nasal congestion, sore throat, shortness of breath, headache, nausea or vomiting, loss of smell and taste, extreme fatigue or tiredness, or diarrhoea).	  Also welcome to be tested are close contacts of a positive case, regardless of whether they have symptoms.    Source: https://archive.vn/B3rJQ
notes_C7: From 5 October, the government’s announcement ending the ‘social’ and ‘smart’ quarantine phases comes into force. The government has introduced new flexible quarantine measures on a nationwide level.  Inter-departmental circulation is allowed without restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201019214004/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/paraguay/staying-during-coronavirus
notes_C1: Schools re-opened for some students on 2 March.   "On the first day of classes, after a year without them, some schools remained closed to students while others began receiving small groups of students.   During the coming days, more students will gradually be allowed to come back to the school – and to others around the country – but they will alternate between virtual and in-person classes."    This was coded as a 2 not a 1 because the article indicated that not all schools are open.    Source: https://archive.vn/tryIy
notes_H6: Beginning 27 Nov 2020, masks are required indoors or outdoors, in public or in private, when 1.5 metre distance cannot be maintained.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201129225824/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/portal/22236/en-vigencia-ley-de-uso-obligatorio-de-mascarilla.html
notes_E2: No evidence of a policy change.
notes_E1: Ñangareko is a program of monetary transfers of G. 500.000 for the purchase of food and hygiene products. The target population were people with needs (workers or not) and those who did not benefit from other social programs such as Tekopora and pensions for the elderly. The population that started receiving the transfers since March 31. Until April 26, 328.045 individuals were notified of their inclusion in the programme. The monetary assistance was been transferred to 224.001 families.  With the programme the government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary of workers. Here’s the links of the news reports that explain the programme:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191513/https://www.lanacion.com.py/pais/2020/03/30/manana-inicia-transferencia-del-programa-nangareko/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504183917/https://www.abc.com.py/edicion-impresa/suplementos/economico/2020/04/26/asistencia-social-y-la-experiencia-en-el-uso-de-medios-de-pago-electronicos-en-programas-nangareko-y-pytyvo/
notes_C3: No change, events limited to 4 hours through February 21st.  source: https://archive.vn/0rRGu
notes_C6: In nationwide Phase 2: "The existing isolation order for all persons in Paraguay to remain in their homes except for necessary travel to obtain food, medicine or cleaning supplies is otherwise still in effect."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200626105822/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C8: Those entering Paraguay must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test completed within 3 days of entering the country (antibody tests not accepted). The mandatory quarantine for travelers ended on November 16.   source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221212445/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C2: No evidence of a policy change. Restaurants and other food establishments may be open between 05:00 am and 11:59 pm with reservations only. Sales of alcohol remain banned between 23:59 pm and 05:00 am. "Corporate offices should maintain a maximum of 50% of staff attending the office at any one time with rotations where possible."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314162953/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/paraguay/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314163020/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/dependencias/portal/adjunto/d21cbe-DECRETO488067dmn8zv.pdf (in Spanish)
notes_C4: Social events in the home are limited to 12 people only. Cultural and creative events can have a maximum of 75 people together at one time.   source:  https://archive.vn/Pdt9e
notes_H7: A  Health care workers working in intensitve care units began receiving COVID-19 vaccines in Paraguay on February 22. They are receiving the Sputnik V vaccine.  source: https://archive.vn/ipeOv
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating.All travelers must wear a mask to board public buses.?   The Paraguayan government has authorized up to four persons to travel together in private cars and SUVs and two persons by motorcycle.? This information is still in effect. Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200902145858/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

name: Palestine
notes_H1: The state of emergency declaration marks the beginning of a coordinated public information campaign at Mar 5. Quoted from the C19 Response Plan document by the PA (unable to archive, original link attached): "The GoP immediately declared a State of Emergency when the first cases in the State of Palestine were diagnosed on 5 March 2020 and launched robust national containment measures, supported by an evidence-based communications campaign to encourage our citizens to protect themselves and follow government guidance."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102006/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=ctGcj9a115309634715actGcj9  http://www.emro.who.int/images/stories/palestine/documents/Palestine_Authority_COVID-19_Response_Plan_Final_26_3_2020.pdf?ua=1
notes_H3: "The GoP has quarantine facilities in each of the governorates and conducts testing at the Central Health Laboratory. Individuals suspected to have COVID-19 are home quarantined until symptoms develop or they have a positive test: all in-coming travellers are placed in government quarantine for two weeks. Individuals with positive samples or symptoms are cared for in government hospitals. There are contact and trace units in each governorate."  https://web.archive.org/save/https://reliefweb.int/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/state-emergency-palestine-s-covid-19-response-plan
notes_H2: Gaza Strip: Since 1  December,  although testing  for  people displaying COVID-19  type  symptoms continues, those who  have been in contact with confirmed positive cases are only tested if they are above 50 yearsof age, and for younger people,only if they have known underlying health conditions    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118165002/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_25-17-30_dec_2020.pdf
notes_C7: No change in policy.
notes_C1: Palestinian Authority Prime Minister Mohammed Shtayyeh announced the shut down of  schools in the occupied West Bank for 12 days effective form Sunday in an effort to stop a sharp rise in coronavirus variant infections. High schools will be exempt from the closure.    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210302003539/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/2/27/palestine-west-bank-schools
notes_H6: Palestinian authorities in the West Bank have extended the existing state of emergency (SoE). The measure grants authorities the power to enact localized lockdowns in areas witnessing spikes in coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases  Facemasks and social distancing are mandatory in public; violators may be fined.    Source:  https://archive.is/Yr5wo
notes_E2: https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_21_covid_19.pdf
notes_C3: The Palestinian Prime Minister Mohammed Shtayyeh announced the 12-day West Bank lockdo own  late on Saturday to be effective from Sunday. Under the West Bank lockdown, schools, universities and non-essential shops will all be shut.    Source:  https://archive.is/f9S27
notes_C6: The Palestinian Prime Minister Mohammed Shtayyeh announced the 12-day West Bank lockdo own  late on Saturday to be effective from Sunday. Under the West Bank lockdown, schools, universities and non-essential shops will all be shut.    Source:  https://archive.is/f9S27
notes_C8: Entering via Israel: Israel is in full lockdown from 8 January 2021. During this time international travel is prohibited with some exceptions.  The Israeli authorities have announced that with effect from 23 December, foreign nationals will not be permitted to enter unless they are citizens of Israel, with some limited exemptions. If you’re eligible for entry, you will need to complete an entry form. All travellers will be required to quarantine for 14 days. This may be shortened to 10 days upon the completion of two negative coronavirus tests (one upon arrival and one after 9 days). The minimum time required between the two tests is at least 24 hours.  Restrictions also apply at land crossings between Israel and Jordan, and between the Occupied Palestinian Territories and Jordan    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118163854/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/the-occupied-palestinian-territories/entry-requirements    Source: UK foreign office
notes_C2: The Palestinian Prime Minister Mohammed Shtayyeh announced the 12-day West Bank lockdo own  late on Saturday to be effective from Sunday. Under the West Bank lockdown, schools, universities and non-essential shops will all be shut. "Government institutions, as well as civil and private establishments, must limit their operations to no more than 30-percent capacity."  Source: https://archive.is/f9S27 https://archive.is/Yr5wo
notes_C4: The Palestinian Prime Minister Mohammed Shtayyeh announced the 12-day West Bank lockdo own  late on Saturday to be effective from Sunday. Under the West Bank lockdown, schools, universities and non-essential shops will all be shut.    Source:  https://archive.is/f9S27
notes_H7: A.    Palestine started its vaccination campaign on 04.02.2021 after the arrival of a first shipment of 2,000 doses of American firm Moderna’s vaccine.  After health workers, people over the age of 60 and those with chronic diseases will be vaccinated.  The Palestinian government has also placed orders for the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine and will receive it “during the coming period.”  Some 37,000 vaccine doses are also due to arrive in Palestine under the COVAX initiative, according to the minister.    10,000 doses of Russia's Sputnik V vaccine have been delivered to the West Bank but the rollout has been dogged by problems. The Palestinian Authority (PA) accused Israel on Monday of holding up the delivery of 2000 Sputnik V vaccine doses into Gaza, where Palestinians have yet to receive any.    https://archive.vn/utPXZ  http://web.archive.org/web/20210215224314/https://www.bbc.com/news/55800921  http://web.archive.org/web/20210215224850/https://english.alarabiya.net/coronavirus/2021/02/16/Palestinians-accuse-Israel-of-preventing-coronavirus-vaccine-transfer-to-Gaza
notes_C5: The Palestinian Prime Minister Mohammed Shtayyeh announced the 12-day West Bank lockdo own  late on Saturday to be effective from Sunday. Under the West Bank lockdown, schools, universities and non-essential shops will all be shut.    Source:  https://archive.is/f9S27
