name: Timor-Leste
notes_H1: The Ministry of Transport and Communication launched a hotline for citizens to solves doubts and provides assistance on COVID-19-related matters.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200530110247/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/03/23/governu-kria-lina-telefonika-numeru-119-asesu-informasaun-kona-ba-covid-19/
notes_H3: Protocols for case detection and contact tracing have been updated based on the new revised  surveillance guidelines. Surveillance teams and rapid responders at national and municipality level have been trained and are on standby to detect and respond to COVID-19 alerts in the country.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200530153458/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/searo/timor-leste/03-03-2020-tls-sitrep-15-ncov-eng.pdf?sfvrsn=e7702ec7_2
notes_H2: Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Timor-Leste? Yes. At the time of this update, Timorese citizens and foreign nationals who are referred by a doctor for COVID-19 testing can obtain testing at the National Hospital, free of charge. Those seeking to test or experiencing COVID-19-like symptoms should call 119. COVID-19 testing is also available for a fee through the National Hospital for those needing COVID-free certification for international travel. Test results in English can be obtained directly from the National Health Laboratory or can be sent via email. Timor-Leste’s COVID-19 testing conditions are current as of the time of this update. Fees and services are subject to change; therefore, please confirm pricing when scheduling an appointment.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210305175204/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FMinisteriodaSaudeTL
notes_C7: Is a curfew in place? No  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes  The government has restricted travel to and from the municipalities of Bobonaro and Cova-Lima with the other Timor-Leste municipalities through March 3, 2021, with limited exceptions.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210222182612/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: School temporarily closed in Covalima municipality.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210314083223/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/like.php?href=http://www.tatoli.tl/en/2021/03/01/ministry-of-education-temporarily-closes-the-schools-in-covalima-municipality/&layout=button_count&show_faces=false&width=105&action=like&colorscheme=light&height=21
notes_H6: Mandatory mask in public and private places of collective use.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210305172230/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2021/Covid/GovPRCom2Mar2021PtEn.pdf
notes_E2: No info. Assumed that policy is over.
notes_E1: PREVIOUS CODING MIGHT BE INCORRECT.    The State institutions responsible for the Basic Basket (Cesta Básica) program, coordinated by the Coordinating Minister of Economic Affairs (MCAE), signed a joint order, on February 25th, 2021, for the extension of the Basic Basket program until March 31st, 2021. Thus, through the said order, this program’s distribution, of a universal character, will be extended until March 31st, allowing to reach the entire population of the entire territory, in accordance with the provisions of Decree-Law no. 48/2020, of October 7th, amended by Decree-Law no. 1/2021, of January 6th, on the creation of the Basic Basket program.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210305171313/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=27093&lang=en&n=1
notes_C3: Government rules the prohibition to hold any events of a social, cultural, sporting or religious  nature that imply the agglomeration of people in the Dili municipality. The amoung of people allowed to meet is unclear.  Link: https://archive.ph/sQfEO
notes_C6: Authorities have placed Dili under lockdown through 23:59 March 15 due to COVID-19 concerns following the discovery of two cases in the capital. Residents must stay at home, except for urgent medical assistance, purchase essential goods and services, or travel to work for employees that must be onsite. All gatherings, including religious services, are banned during the lockdown. Officials have restricted almost all travel, including air and maritime transport, from the city. Exceptions are possible for safety, public health, or humanitarian reasons. Increased security is likely to enforce restrictions; police could erect checkpoints on main entry points to and from the capital. Significant business disruptions are likely.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210314080531/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights/risk-alerts/wip1001271301/timor-leste-authorities-lock-down-dili-through-2359-march-15-due-to-covid-19-concerns
notes_C8: Government of Timor-Leste (GOTL) announced it had temporarily closed its airports, ports, and land borders.  During this temporary border closure, the following exceptions will apply:    - Transit of diplomatic or consular personnel, members of international organizations and bilateral cooperation agencies, and workers in the petroleum sector;  - Operation of medical evacuation; and,  - International transportation of goods.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210104154759/http://www.tatoli.tl/en/2020/12/24/tl-government-decides-to-close-the-borders-until-january-2021/    http://web.archive.org/web/20210104153050/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Timor-Leste has suspended nonessential businesses nationwide as of March 13 following a recent increase in COVID-19 cases. Essential businesses, such as food establishments, medical services, banks, and fuel stations, can continue operating with safe-distancing protocols and other measures in place. The end date of the measure is unclear.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210314075332/https://crisis24.garda.com/insights/risk-alerts/wip10011872623/timor-leste-nonessential-businesses-suspended-nationwide-as-of-march-13-update-22
notes_C4: Government rules the prohibition to hold any events of a social, cultural, sporting or religious  nature that imply the agglomeration of people in the Dili municipality. The amoung of people allowed to meet is unclear.  Link: https://archive.ph/sQfEO
notes_C5: Suspension of collective transport in Dili.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210314083650/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/like.php?href=http://www.tatoli.tl/en/2021/03/09/government-makes-an-adjustment-on-the-sanitary-fence-and-mandatory-confiement-in-dili/&layout=button_count&show_faces=false&width=105&action=like&colorscheme=light&height=21

name: Tonga
notes_H1: No official announcement of a coordinated campaign was found, however there is evidence of such a campaign including regular government announcements, a dedicated Covid-19 link on the government website, information leaflets on the government website (in Tongan).  Following the coding rules regarding an announcement of a campaign, H1 could be coded as "1G", however the observations noted above suggests it was more coordinated than "Public officials urge caution", hence the code of 2G.
notes_H3: First suspected case of Covid-19.  Article refers to contact tracing.  "He said Health had started to track down people she might have had contact with here in Tonga, from passengers on the aircraft she arrived on from Sydney on Monday, and people close to her."    http://archive.today/2020.12.12-192144/https://matangitonga.to/2020/03/04/suspected-case-coronavirus-tonga
notes_H2: First suspected case of Covid-19 in Tonga.  Article refers to testing, however at this time, Tonga did not have testing equipment and so the samples were sent abroad.      http://archive.today/2020.12.12-192144/https://matangitonga.to/2020/03/04/suspected-case-coronavirus-tonga
notes_C7: The easing of restrictions from 12th April include the reopening of "most" public services, schools and businesses.  There is no reference to restrictions on internal movement (other than curfew which is coded under C6) and so C7 is coded as "0" (no measures)    http://archive.today/2020.12.16-170315/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/331721/tonga-authorities-extend-restrictive-covid-19-measures-until-april-17-update-4
notes_C1: Article about hand-washing at one school in Tonga.  New wash basins had been installed in this and other primary schools in Tonga.  Coding changed to "1" based on the coding guidance for C1 which reflects that the school environment has significantly changed for students.  "She said some children wash their hands at every opportunity they can as it wasn’t always like this at school."  http://archive.today/2020.12.17-173852/https://matangitonga.to/2020/05/05/students-step-hand-hygiene-school
notes_E2: See earlier note for E2 on 6th May
notes_C3: Announcement on SoE restrictions    "Night clubs, clubs, bars and kava clubs may be opened for business on Fridays and Saturdays only; from 5:00am to 9:00pm.  Kava drinking sessions prior to church services are permitted on Sundays only.  Daily early morning church services and on Sundays are allowed.     Mass gatherings under the restrictions, which are limited to only 20 people indoors and 40 people outdoors, does not apply to religious services and educational institutions.  All gyms, sporting events and activities, celebration of birthdays, marriages and other recreational or related gatherings shall be permitted, but they shall not exceed the maximum number defined as Mass Gatherings: not exceeding 20 people indoors and 40 people outdoors.  Events such as bingos and contact sports are prohibited.  Funeral gatherings shall be restricted to 20 people indoors and 40 people outdoors."    http://archive.today/2020.12.15-200143/https://matangitonga.to/2020/05/02/tonga-relaxes-covid-19-restrictions-under-state-emergency    In this announcement, there is no general reference to public events other than specific examples such as church gatherings. However,  the limitations on gatherings (20 inside/40 outside) suggests that there are likely to be limits on the type of public event that would meet the policy requirements.  As such, it is coded as "1" recommended rather than "2" (required) or "0" (no measures)
notes_C6: Restoration of curfew (Midnight-5am).  See 21st December for policy announcement
notes_C8: "Tonga declares State of Emergency"  "Starting today, Friday 20 March, at 8:00 pm:   Foreign Nationals are banned from entering Tonga.   Tongan nationals must be quarantined for 14-days upon arrival."  "The State of Emergency applies to all the land and sea areas of Tonga starting today, March 20 to April 17, unless further renewed."  Link: http://archive.today/2020.12.12-162440/https://matangitonga.to/2020/03/20/tonga-declares-state-emergency  Note that there is a slight timing difference between the news article above and Travel Advisory No.6 issued on 23rd March (see link below) which suggests that the border closure policy was implemented from 23rd March  http://archive.today/2021.01.04-191750/https://www.gov.to/press-release/travel-advisory-no-6-for-travelers-arriving-in-or-intending-to-travel-to-tonga/
notes_C2: To date, the codes "2G" and "1G" have largely reflected restrictions placed on the opening of bars, night clubs and kava bars.  However, with the further easing of restrictions, such venues are permitted to open Mon-Sat between the hours of 5am - 11pm.  A code of "0" (no measures) was felt to reflect the new policy.    http://archive.today/2020.12.16-193122/https://matangitonga.to/2020/05/29/tongas-covid-19-restrictions-eased-further
notes_C4: "Tonga declares State of Emergency"  "Starting today, Friday 20 March, at 8:00 pm:   Public gatherings are restricted.   People are to practice social distancing.   Concerts, sports events, funerals, weddings and birthdays are banned."  "The State of Emergency applies to all the land and sea areas of Tonga starting today, March 20 to April 17, unless further renewed."  "This extends to public gatherings, restricted to a maximum of 20 people inside a building or 40 people outside, and people are to practice social distancing. Concerts, sports events, funerals, weddings and birthdays are also banned."  Link: http://archive.today/2020.12.12-162440/https://matangitonga.to/2020/03/20/tonga-declares-state-emergency
notes_C5: "The government is, however, easing some restrictions, and has stated that certain activities now deemed essential, such as most public services, schools, businesses, and trade operations, will be permitted to reopen. These operations are set to resume normally as of 13:00 on Sunday, April 12. "    It is assumed that the reopening of "most public services, schools, businesses and trade operations" will include public transport, hence the change of code to "0" (no measures)    http://archive.today/2020.12.16-170315/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/331721/tonga-authorities-extend-restrictive-covid-19-measures-until-april-17-update-4

name: Trinidad and Tobago
notes_H1: Government begins releasing daily 'Trinidad and Tobago COVID-19 (Novel Coronavirus) Updates'.   https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.news.gov.tt/content/trinidad-and-tobago-covid-19-novel-coronavirus-update-1#.XpRoalNKg1I
notes_H3: Prime Minister states "Our protocols have been operationalized for some time now. We had tested over fifty cases and this is the first one that tested positive. Contact tracing is taking place. Our professionals have been and are handling the situation and situations."    (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413122852/https://www.opm.gov.tt/prime-minister-dr-the-hon-keith-rowleys-parliament-statement-on-covid-19/)
notes_H2: According to the Ministry of Health's guidelines, a PCR test will be conducted if a public health official decides so.    In accordance with the guidance provided by the WHO, not everyone with flu-like symptoms needs to be tested. If a person does not fit the criteria, testing will not be performed and factors such as clinical history, travel history and/or contact with a COVID-19 positive patient are considered.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200901013919/http://www.health.gov.tt/sitepages/default.aspx?id=305
notes_C7: Changed from 2-Required, to 0-No Measures, because restrictions were eased for movement between the islands of Trinidad and Tobago.    Prime Minister Dr the Hon Keith Rowley announced several adjustments to the Public Health Ordinance Regulations during a media conference held at the Diplomatic Centre, St Ann’s today (Saturday 10th October, 2020).  -Caribbean Airlines will operate six flights daily to Tobago.  **Previously, Air and Sea bridge Transportation to Tobago were limited to essentials.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201123214337/https://www.opm.gov.tt/prime-ministers-media-conference-saturday-10th-october-2020/
notes_C1: Secondary schools re-opened on February 8th for Forms 4-6 students only using a hybrid system.  "Online classes for teaching to continue as far as possible  Students to report to school for the completion of Practicals, SBAs and Internal Assessments  Physical teaching classes to be held only where absolutely necessary"  source: https://archive.vn/txRx0
notes_H6: From 31 August, the Government amended the existing Public Health Ordinance to make the use of face masks in public mandatory. According to Section 6 (7) of the regulation: "No person shall, without reasonable excuse, be in a public space without wearing a face mask, face shield, or face covering in a manner which covers his mouth, nose and chin."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200901020028/http://www.looptt.com:8080/content/7-things-know-about-new-face-mask-legislation
notes_E2: Following Tamoi's note, there is no evidence of a debt/contract relief program in the country from 1 August onwards.
notes_E1: A new public assistance program was announced on February 26th. It was coded on this day as it is unclear when it will begin.   “This agreement will support minimum income for those affected by the coronavirus in the immediate period and during the recovery. The agreement does not see Trinidad and Tobago taking on additional debt but instead redirects existing uncommitted loan resources to new and urgent high priority public investment areas that require financing during this critical period” stated Minister West.  The programme will see US$24.45 million deployed for the creation of COVID-19 management measures aimed at ensuring that basic needs are met for vulnerable persons.  It will directly benefit vulnerable populations in the form of:  (1) Protection using existing cash transfer programmes and  (2) Protection for the vulnerable population not on the rosters of transfer programmes, working in the informal sector."    source: https://archive.vn/CKS3w
notes_C3: Public gatherings limited to 10 people. "On March 21, the GOTT announced restrictions on gatherings at public places." (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413124105/https://tt.usembassy.gov/information-on-government-of-trinidad-and-tobago-stay-at-home-order-public-health-ordinance/)
notes_C6: As of 26 October, 2020, clubs, theatres, gaming houses, and gyms have all reopened with maximum fifty per cent allowed capacity, indicating that there is no longer a recommendation to stay at home.      According to the Minister of Public Health T. Deyalsingh, in Public Health Regulations 25 October, 2020:  4. (1) For the purposes of controlling and preventing the spread of the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV), it shall be an offence, during the period specified in regulation 17, for any person to--  (7) A maximum of fifty per cent of the allowed capacity of a building is permitted in the following places:  (a) a club as defined in section 2 of the Registration of Clubs Act;  (b) a theatre licensed under the Theatres and Dancehalls Act;  (c) a theatre licensed under the Cinematograph Act;  (d) a common gaming house or betting office licensed under the Gambling and Betting Act; and  (e) a gym or fitness centre.  **Subregulation (7) above is all new since the Public Health Regulations 11 October, 2020**  17. These regulations shall have effect from 26th October, 2020 to 8th November 2020.    Public Health Regulations 25 October, 2020  https://web.archive.org/web/20201123201624/http://www.health.gov.tt/covid19/GuidelinesRegulations/PublicHealthRegulations/PublicHealthRegulations.pdf    For historical reference:  Public Health Regulations 11 October, 2020  http://web.archive.org/web/20201123202223/https://www.covid19.gov.tt/the-public-health-2019-novel-coronavirus-2019-ncov-no-29-regulations-2020/
notes_C8: "National Security Minister Stuart Young has announced the closure of all borders effective midnight on Sunday. He said no international flights would be allowed to enter the country. This will apply to both nationals and non nationals."  (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413134259/https://trinidadexpress.com/newsextra/t-t-s-borders-closed-to-all/article_5061e42c-6b8b-11ea-8328-3f8003c18b6f.html)
notes_C2: In line with phased reopening announced by government, Phase II began on May 21 and allowed additional industries beyond essential businesses to open.    Government graphic explaining closure stages  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528205540/https:/twitter.com/newsgovtt/status/1263153842201509891/photo/1    Story about manufacturing opening:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528210025/http://www.guardian.co.tt/news/slow-phase-2-reopening-for-some-businesses-6.2.1121329.a259194645
notes_C4: No evidence of a policy change, the number of people gathering should not exceed 10. This was coded as a level 4 not level 3 as the new and revised wording of level 4 permits a gathering up to and including 10 people.  source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210102172147/http://www.health.gov.tt/covid19/GuidelinesRegulations/PublicHealthRegulations/PublicHealthRegulations.pdf
notes_H7: A: Front line workers are now receiving the COVID-19 vaccine in Trinidad and Tobago. They are receiving the Oxford-Astrazeneca vaccine.  sources: https://archive.vn/sg5yf  https://archive.vn/ro2kf
notes_C5: On 15 August, the Government of Trinidad and Tobago announced new measures to contain the surge of COVID-19 cases. The new measures, which are in place from 17 August, require all public taxis and maxis have to operate at 50% capacity and public service also remains at 50% rotation.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200901005409/https://www.opm.gov.tt/prime-ministers-media-conference-saturday-15-august-2020/

name: Tunisia
notes_H1: Dedicated Public Health information Website gives out general advice for the public.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608201759/https://covid-19.tn/blog/%d9%81%d9%8a%d8%b1%d9%88%d8%b3-%d9%83%d9%88%d8%b1%d9%88%d9%86%d8%a7-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%ac%d8%af%d9%8a%d8%af-%d9%86%d8%b5%d8%a7%d8%a6%d8%ad-%d8%b9%d8%a7%d9%85%d8%a9/
notes_H3: no change   Travellers to Tunisia are required to complete online the Tunisian government’s passenger questionnaire, including information on where you will self-isolate, and download E7mi, the official Tunisian government contact tracing application on your smartphone.  contract tracing application     From November 16th, all travellers aged 12 and over arriving in Tunisia will be required to present evidence of a negative PCR test taken no more than 72 hours prior to their arrival.    https://archive.vn/wip/tFnVx
notes_H2: "If you think you have COVID-19 symptoms, you should call 190 (emergency services SAMU). They will ask a series of questions to assess whether it is likely that you have COVID-19. If COVID-19 is suspected, then they will arrange for someone to come to your home or hotel to conduct a test and they will advise you to self-isolate. COVID-19 PCR tests are only offered free if you are displaying symptoms. You can also pay for a test, if required for travel purposes, at the Institut Pasteur."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200806161617/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/tunisia/coronavirus
notes_C7: "Tunisia has tightened precautionary measures amid a rapid spread of COVID-19 across the country, according to a statement released by the government on Thursday.    The measures, taken after a meeting between Tunisian Prime Minister Hichem Mechichi and members of Tunisia's committee to confront COVID-19 and several ministers, included the extension of the night curfew, suspension of the collective prayer, a ban of gatherings and suspension of classes.    (....)    It was also decided to ban travel and inter-provincial traffic, "except for absolute and exceptional emergencies," the statement said."    "Also, movement between provinces will be prohibited, except for work, students and exceptional cases that can be justified."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20201031131417/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-10/29/c_139476377.htm  http://web.archive.org/web/20201031132054/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/tunisia-imposes-new-measures-to-stem-coronavirus-/2023792
notes_C1: This rules have come in place since January and i can see a note on the government web site extending them with no end date   1- The adoption of the comprehensive quarantine on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays except the process of supplying vital sectors with the prohibition of the Golan from 4 p.m. to 6 a.m. the following day.  2- Suspension of all lessons in the public and private sectors for basic, preparatory, secondary and higher education and vocational training centers from Wednesday, January 13, after the end of classes until Sunday, January 24th.  3- Suspension of all demonstrations from Thursday 14 January to The End of Sunday, January 24  4- Lifting chairs and preventing consumption on the spot for cafes and restaurants from Monday, January 18th until Sunday, January 24th, and limiting to food and beverages intended for pregnancy.  5- Approve the system of day-to-day trading with the team system and invite the heads of departments to adopt the system of working as remotely as possible.  Call on private institutions to adopt the system of working as far as possible and to organize work to reduce overcrowding of transportation and duty stations.     https://archive.vn/DwEUI   https://archive.vn/DwEUI
notes_H6: Travel in Tunisia  All modes of public transport (taxis, buses, trains and others) are permitted to operate. There may be restrictions on travel between regions. You should follow the advice of local authorities.    The Tunisian authorities have announced that wearing a face mask in public places is mandatory. This includes public transport, health and educational institutions, shopping centres, sports and cultural venues as well as places of worship. Failure to wear a mask may result in a fine or imprisonment.    On 6 December, the Tunisian authorities revised the health measures in place and extended them until 30 December in response to the detection of infection clusters:    A national curfew in all regions across the country,from 8pm to 5am every day.  All cafes and restaurants must close at 7pm, but from 4pm it will be take away only. When they are open they must observe a maximum of 30% capacity in enclosed spaces and 50% capacity in open spaces.  A maximum limit of 30 people is set for private events and funerals.  All prayers in mosques are temporarily suspended.  Additional curfews and lock downs can be imposed at short notice as the government’s response to COVID-19 develops. You should follow the guidance of local authorities when travelling around the country.    https://archive.is/jg7ll
notes_E2: no change since last update   https://archive.is/KkSWz#T
notes_E1: A 2.5 billion TND emergency plan ($0.71 billion or 1.8 percent of GDP) was announced on March 21. From the social side, this also includes cash transfers for low income households, disabled and homeless people (450 TND million for three months). The plan also includes a support for those who will be on temporary unemployment because of the COVID19 shock (300 TND million).   Sources:    https://web.archive.org/web/20200608195445/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19   https://web.archive.org/web/20200608195532/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/tunisia-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: "Tunisian authorities will ban all gatherings and reduce working hours for employees in the public sector in order to stop the rapid spread of the coronavirus, Prime Minister Hichem Mechichi said on Saturday (October 3).    The decision? ?was taken amid strong fears that hospitals in the North African nation will be unable to cope with a high number of patients because of the shortage of intensive-care beds."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201031132808if_/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-tunisia/tunisia-to-ban-gatherings-cut-public-sector-work-hours-due-to-pandemic-idUSKBN26O0ZJ
notes_C6: "Tunisia has tightened precautionary measures amid a rapid spread of COVID-19 across the country, according to a statement released by the government on Thursday.    The measures, taken after a meeting between Tunisian Prime Minister Hichem Mechichi and members of Tunisia's committee to confront COVID-19 and several ministers, included the extension of the night curfew, suspension of the collective prayer, a ban of gatherings and suspension of classes.    Mechichi authorized all 24 governors to announce a curfew in their provinces, from Monday to Friday between 8 p.m. to 5 a.m. local time and on Saturday and Sunday from 7 p.m. to 5 a.m."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201031131417/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-10/29/c_139476377.htm
notes_C8: Tunisia Government has suspended all air travel with Britain, Australia and South Africa regardless of nationality, citing fears of a new coronavirus strain.    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210112131345/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-tunisia-int/tunisia-bans-air-travel-with-uk-australia-and-south-africa-over-new-virus-idUSKBN28V1M9
notes_C2: "Tunisian authorities will ban all gatherings and reduce working hours for employees in the public sector in order to stop the rapid spread of the coronavirus, Prime Minister Hichem Mechichi said on Saturday (October 3).    The decision? was taken amid strong fears that hospitals in the North African nation will be unable to cope with a high number of patients because of the shortage of intensive-care beds."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201031132808if_/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-tunisia/tunisia-to-ban-gatherings-cut-public-sector-work-hours-due-to-pandemic-idUSKBN26O0ZJ
notes_C4: All modes of public transport (taxis, buses, trains and others) are permitted to operate. There are restrictions on travel between regions. You should follow the advice of local authorities.    The Tunisian authorities have announced that wearing a face mask in public places is mandatory. This includes public transport, health and educational institutions, shopping centres, sports and cultural venues as well as places of worship. Failure to wear a mask may result in a fine or imprisonment.    On 23 January, the Tunisian authorities revised the national health measures to combat the speed of transmission of the virus.    There is a national curfew in all regions across the country, from 8pm to 5am. During the curfew you are only allowed to leave your residence in case of an emergency.  Cafes and restaurants are open at a reduced capacity. After 4pm they are only open for takeaway service.  Gatherings are banned.  Movement between cities is banned.  https://archive.vn/sn4Nq  https://archive.vn/DwEUI
notes_H7: The Minister of Health stressed that the solution to controlling the epidemic in the medium term is to provide vaccination, reminding that the aim of the vaccination campaign is to reduce serious cases and deaths, maintain the capacity of the health system and protect health personnel.    According to the national strategy for mers-CoV vaccination, priority groups have been identified: citizens over 60 years of age, health professionals and vital interests, under 60 years of age with chronic diseases.        The minister stressed that the vaccines will be free, effective and high quality as it was decided to acquire vaccines from various international laboratories that have finished their research and obtained the license, announcing that pfizer laboratory obtained yesterday the license to market In Tunisia, waiting for the rest of the laboratories to obtain distribution licenses in our country in the coming weeks.    https://archive.vn/alywx

You should follow the advice of local authorities.    There is a national curfew in all regions across the country, from 8pm to 5am. Gatherings are banned.    Movement between cities is banned.  https://archive.vn/sn4Nq  https://archive.vn/DwEUI

name: Turkey
notes_H1: Turkish Ministry of Health informs about Coronavirus in a series of videos; https://web.archive.org/web/20200211204229/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225755162737827841, https://web.archive.org/web/20200210073346/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225737365160939520, https://web.archive.org/web/20200211032634/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225759617629577218,  https://web.archive.org/web/20200210133127/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225696129578258432,  https://web.archive.org/web/20200313112513/https://twitter.com/saglikbakanligi/status/1225731397022879745
notes_H3: Ankara also ramped up use of contact tracing to map out the chain of interactions in COVID-19 cases. A staff composed of doctors and other professionals scan the information on confirmed patients in a call center and dispatch teams in protective gear to find the contacts of patients who are viewed as prospective patients themselves. Crews arrange a 14-day quarantine for those potential patients and treatment if they test positive.https://web.archive.org/web/20200422155344/https://www.dailysabah.com/turkey/turkey-ranks-7th-worldwide-with-600000-coronavirus-tests/news
notes_H2: Coronavirus Scientific Advisory Board issues guidance on testing: "All patient samples conforming to the 2019-nCoV possible case definition should also be evaluated for 2019-nCoV (with a PCR test)."; https://hsgm.saglik.gov.tr/depo/haberler/ncov/2019-nCov_Hastal_Salk_alanlar_Rehberi.pdf (not archivable, https://web.archive.org/web/20200406142757/https://www.aa.com.tr/tr/koronavirus/turkiye-koronaviruse-karsi-tedbirlerini-aldi/1744654
notes_C7: On 1 March, President Erdogan announced a new "controlled normalization process", which includes a four-tier system on local COVID-19 related restrictions.    Based on infection and vaccination rates, provinces are now divided into 4 different risk groups: low, medium, high, and very high. The level of measures in combating the epidemic will be determined according to these risk groups.    Intercity travel permits are required for citizens under age 20 and those age 65 and older, if any of the provinces included in the trip (departure, arrival, or route) are high or very high risk.    No permission for intercity travel is required for these age groups if the provinces are low or medium risk.     Coded as 1 because the majority of citizens participating in intercity travel are likely outside of these age groups regardless.     The current risk groups are as follows.     Low risk:  Agri, Batman, Bingöl, Bitlis, Diyarbakir, Hakkari, Igdir, Mardin, Mus, Siirt, Sanliurfa, Sirnak, Usak, Van.    Medium risk:  Adana, Afyonkarahisar, Ankara, Aydin, Bartin, Bayburt, Bursa, Çankiri, Çorum, Denizli, Elazig, Erzincan, Erzurum, Eskisehir, Gaziantep, Hatay, Isparta, Kahramanmaras, Karabük, Kars, Kastamonu, Kirsehir, Malatya, Manisa, Nevsehir, Sivas, Tunceli, Yozgat.      High risk:  Antalya, Ardahan, Artvin, Bilecik, Bolu, Çanakkale, Düzce, Istanbul, Izmir, Karaman, Kayseri, Kirikkale, Kirklareli, Kilis, Kocaeli, Kütahya, Mersin, Mugla, Nigde, Tekirdag, Yalova, Zonguldak.      Very high risk:   Adiyaman, Aksaray, Amasya, Balikesir, Burdur, Edirne, Giresun, Gümüshane, Konya, Ordu, Osmaniye, Rize, Sakarya, Samsun, Sinop, Tokat, Trabzon.       https://web.archive.org/web/20210302093030/https://www.tccb.gov.tr/en/news/542/125091/-we-are-starting-the-new-controlled-normalization-process-today-    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308194008/https://www.icisleri.gov.tr/koronavirus-ile-mucadelede-kontrollu-normallesme-sureci    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308200841/https://www.icisleri.gov.tr/kontrollu-normallesme-sureci-ile-ilgili-sikca-sorulan-sorular
notes_C1: On 2 March, face-to-face education was initiated across the country in all pre-school education institutions, primary schools, 8th, and 12th grades.        Face-to-face education is also provided in all pre-school education institutions, primary schools, secondary schools and high schools in provinces defined as low and medium risk.     Face-to-face training in provinces defined as low and medium risk:  Full-time in pre-school education institutions  2 days a week in diluted classes in primary schools  2 days a week in diluted classes in 5th, 6th, and 7th grades   12-22 hours per week in diluted classes in 8th grade  2 days a week in diluted classes in 9th, 10th, 11th grades  16-24 hours a week in diluted classes in 12th grade      Face to face training in provinces defined as high and very high risk:  Full-time in pre-school education institutions  2 days a week in diluted clases in primary schools  12-22 hours per week in diluted classes in 8th grade  16-24 hours per week in diluted classes in 12th grade    Special education schools and classes serving for students with special needs began full-time face-to-face education throughout the country.    Distance education will be continued in applications outside the scope of face-to-face education.     Participation in face-to-face training will be carried out in all provinces subject to the consent of the parents.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210308165904/http://www.meb.gov.tr/basin-aciklamasi/haber/22651/tr
notes_H6: “As of 8 September the wearing of masks is mandatory at all times outside the home throughout Turkey. This includes, but is not limited to, all public places, including streets, side streets, parks, gardens, picnic areas, markets, sea side and public transportation including Metro, buses, taxis and ferries. Masks are also mandatory in all shops, restaurants, hairdressers and barber shops.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200909213906/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/turkey/coronavirus
notes_E2: On 4 February, the decision to postpone the loan debts of tradesmen and craftsmen to Halkbank was published in the Official Gazette.    The measure is effective from 1 January 2021 until 30 June 2021.    Coded as 0 because the measure is not targeted at households.     During the postponement period, the portion of the installment / principal debt and the interest to be accrued on the tradesmen and craftsmen in accordance with the relevant decisions, and the bank and insurance transactions tax related to this amount will be added equally to the remaining installments.    Within the scope of the decision, a letter of undertaking will be taken from the tradesmen and craftsmen whose loans are postponed , stating that they will not reduce the number of employees during the postponement period. Tradesmen and craftsmen with a decrease in the number of employees will be excluded from the scope of postponement.    Tradesmen and craftsmen, whose debts are deferred, may be granted a low-interest loan by the Bank within the scope of the relevant decisions regarding the provision of low-interest loans upon their request, and the provisions preventing the opening of loans to those who have debts subject to deferral will not be applied in such decisions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210214091401/https://www.resmigazete.gov.tr/eskiler/2021/02/20210204-10.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210216005501/https://www.aa.com.tr/tr/ekonomi/esnaf-ve-sanatkarlarin-kredi-borclarina-erteleme/2133337
notes_E1: Deadline for new applications for wage support was 31 December 2020.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210215231828/https://ailevecalisma.gov.tr/tr-tr/haberler/bakan-selcuk-ocak-ayina-iliskin-nakdi-ucret-destegi-odemelerini-9-subat-ta-yapacagiz/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210215233503/https://www.dailysabah.com/business/economy/turkey-extends-layoff-ban-by-2-more-months
notes_C3: “The Interior Ministry sent a circular on expanding virus restrictions from 14 to all of Turkey’s 81 provinces. As of Friday [September 4th], large gatherings such as outdoor weddings and other traditional celebrations will be toned down. The duration of a wedding ceremony in Turkey has been limited to an hour, with a ban on dancing and serving of food. People aged 65 and above and under 15, who are not first and second degree relatives of the bride and groom, will not be allowed to attend the wedding. At least one public officer will attend the wedding ceremony to monitor the measures.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200909231135/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/turkey-imposes-new-nationwide-virus-restrictions/1961415
notes_C6: As of 8 February, Turkish citizens and residents are subject to a weekend curfew beginning 9 p.m. on Friday, continuing through 5 a.m. on Monday.    Travel outside of the house is limited to individuals between the ages of 20 and 65, who are obtaining basic food items, between 10 a.m. and 5 p.m.    Additionally, there is a nightly curfew between 9 p.m. and 5 a.m.    Foreigners in the country temporarily for tourism are exempt from curfews and travel permit requirements.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210214212732/https://tr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C8: Passengers failing to submit a digital or paper copy of a negative PCR test result are not permitted to board the flights. Those who are in transit, are not required to submit a PCR test in Turkey. Passengers departing from the United Kingdom will not be allowed to enter Turkey. All passengers arriving in Turkey through third countries, who visited The United Kingdom within the last 10 days, will be quarantined for 14 days at places selected by the Turkish officials following their arrival. Passengers arriving from Denmark and South Africa should declare their residency address and stay in isolation for 7 days.   Link: https://archive.fo/2qeZb
notes_C2: On June 1, "Turkey has reopened restaurants and cafes in addition to many other public areas, as the government further eased coronavirus restrictions". Bars, hookah bars and nightclubs were required to remain closed.     Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200610025346/https://abcnews.go.com/Business/wireStory/turkey-eases-lockdown-restaurants-reopen-flights-resume-70996794  https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/06/turkey-reopens-public-places-coronavirus-lockdown-200601143056501.html (unable to archive)
notes_C4: As of 24 January, weddings and funerals were limited to 30 people.    Unable to find an update since then.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210214232708/https://apnews.com/article/international-news-turkey-coronavirus-pandemic-4316a18d7eae4b5724b7775b07360c1c
notes_H7: A,C:    On 28 January, vaccination efforts were expanded to people at the age of 75 and above.    People are receiving CoronaVac, developed by China’s Sinovac, an inactive vaccine the country started receiving shipments of last month.    Health care workers were the first to receive the shots, and under a mass vaccination plan, the elderly citizens are next in line. The age limit will gradually drop in line with the plan.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210201020353/https://www.dailysabah.com/turkey/coronavirus-vaccination-in-turkey-begins-for-citizens-75-and-above/news
notes_C5: As of 25 January, buses, ferries, and trains are operating but there are limits to passenger capacity on buses and all passengers must wear a mask.    In Istanbul, the use of all means of public mass transport has been banned for people under 20 and over 65 part of COVID-19 restrictions.    Coded as 1 because people under 20 and over 65 likely don't constitute "most citizens", which is the benchmark to be coded as 2.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210131014418/https://tr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/

name: Tanzania
notes_H1: Recent reports show the government is embarking upon some public campaigns, which are limited in both their scientific basis and scope:     https://web.archive.org/web/20210206234855/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/tanzania-embarks-on-steam-therapy-to-fight-coronavirus/2130552
notes_H3: Tanzania is definitely denying any spread of the virus. A foreign citizen has resulted positive to the virus weeks after the country was declared covid-free. Despite him knowing of at least other 25 people getting COVID, there was no attempt by the govt to trace contacts.  http://archive.fo/zQhLc
notes_H2: Testing is available through Government of Tanzania laboratories however the details of testing (including test type and performance characteristics) have not been made available nor independently verified. They are also not reliably available with increasing reports of inconclusive tests.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308174222/https://tz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: No closures in place, as the government is still denying the presence of COVID-19.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210222191241/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-55900680
notes_H6: 'Wear masks - not because of corona'  It is questionable whether this is truly a current appeal to the nation to wear face masks.  Hence, it seems that the government is not in total denial as there have been moments when it appears to acknowledge the virus might exist in the country.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210222191241/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-55900680
notes_C3: According to the IMF website, effective June 1, 2020, the authorities allowed the opening of upper-secondary and tertiary schools and the resumption of sport activities and events. On June 29, 2020 all other educational institutions reopened. As a result, all the restrictions due to Covid-19 have been lifted by July 2020.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928023258/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C8: According to the US embassy website, all travelers whether foreigners or returning residents whose countries or airlines require them to provide negative testing for COVID-19 as a condition for traveling will be required to present a certificate on arrival. Travelers from other countries with symptoms and signs related to COVID-19 infection will undergo enhanced screening and may be tested on arrival.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928033423/https://tz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: According to the IMF website, effective June 1, 2020, the authorities allowed the opening of upper-secondary and tertiary schools and the resumption of sport activities and events. On June 29, 2020 all other educational institutions reopened. As a result, all the restrictions due to Covid-19 have been lifted by July 2020.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200928023258/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

name: Uganda
notes_H1: video prevention campaign: @MinofHealthUG   appeals to the general public to remain vigilant and look out for the symptoms of #Coronavirus. (https://twitter.com/MinofHealthUG/status/1223616070080245760)
notes_H3: This report suggests that contact tracing has been taking place within Uganda. Additionally, the Ministry of Health reports on contacts and alerts in their regular updates on social media.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208213112/http://www.afenet.net/index.php/news/news/669-contact-tracing-during-covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210208210505/https://twitter.com/MinofHealthUG  https://web.archive.org/web/20210208213641/https://www.health.go.ug/
notes_H2: A laboratory test carried out on medical prescription can identify the SARS-CoV-2 virus infection.  However, this test is of no use in the absence of symptoms. Your personal physician is in the best position to assess the value of the test in your case. If needed, contact your physician via telephone. The Ministry of Health's Testing Eligibility Tool recommends isolating and monitoring for those with general symptoms, while those with severe symptoms must get in contact with the Ministry of Health to arrange for a test and receive medical attention.    Travelers are expected to cover all costs associated with their COVID-19 test.  Average cost for testing is UGX 350,000. Delivery of test results may be via email, text message (i.e. a PDF send via WhatsApp) or physical copy.  Make sure to confirm a delivery method that suits your needs before selecting a company/lab to conduct the test.  It is recommended  to bring a printed copy of your test results with you to the airport; an electronic copy may not be accepted. A COVID RDT Antigen test can be done next to the airport in Entebbe at the Kazuri Medical clinic (+256 0702 199 000 / +256 0787 199 788, Plot 168 Kampala Road, Katabi, Entebbe). The antigen test takes 15 minutes and costs 50 USD, certified results are provided onsite.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208211534/https://www.health.go.ug/covid/faq/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210208211617/https://www.health.go.ug/covid/project/testing-eligibility-tool/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210208195447/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No. Movement by personal vehicles is now permitted in all districts, including those with an international border, but is still limited to 4 people per car (including the driver) and all must wear masks if there is more than one person in the vehicle.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208195406/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20210208195447/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C1: "Despite rising coronavirus infections across the country, schools in Uganda reopened on Thursday after a seven-month break.  The government has allowed schools to resume finalist and candidate classes for now, with no date announced yet for the return of other students.  Schools were ordered to ensure COVID-19 safety measures before reopening, including handwashing facilities, temperature guns, and availability of face masks.  Some institutions that failed to meet requirements will remain closed, according to the Education Ministry."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201202000345/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/uganda-reopens-schools-despite-virus-fears/2007193
notes_H6: It is mandatory for everyone aged 6 or above to wear a face mask when outside your house.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210208195406/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/coronavirus
notes_E2: There seems to be no new information concerning this placeholder.
notes_C3: According to the US Embassy in Uganda, gathering of about 200 people can go on with social distancing measures and wearing of masks. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20201123004030/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C6: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/coronavirus  A curfew remains in place from 9pm to 6am. Passengers travelling on flights departing during curfew hours (9pm to 6am) will be allowed to travel to the airport upon presentation of a valid ticket.
notes_C8: Entebbe International Airport opened on October 1.  The Government of Uganda requires that all departing passengers present a negative PCR COVID-19 test taken not more than 120 hours before departure. This requirement is mandatory for all departing passengers out of Uganda even if the destination country does not require it.  COVID-19 tests for departing passengers must be taken at an accredited laboratory or a COVID-19 sample collection point approved by the Ministry of Health.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210202184751/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C2: "Shopping arcades, hairdressers and salons will be open from 22 July. Shopping malls, supermarkets and pharmacies are open. Hotels and restaurants are open with social distancing measures in place and food delivery services (such as Jumia) remain operational outside of curfew hours." Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200820114638/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/staying-during-coronavirus "Museveni said business arcades must have temperature checks and traders must wear masks, ensure social distancing, and follow other safety guidelines" Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200820114007/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/businesses-to-reopen-as-uganda-eases-virus-lockdown/1918466
notes_C4: According to the US Embassy in Uganda, gathering of about 200 people can go on with social distancing measures. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20201123004030/https://ug.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-page/
notes_C5: Travel by public transport (including minibus taxis, buses, coaches, passenger trains) is now allowed. Tuk tuks and boda bodas (motorbike taxis) are allowed to carry passengers, but must stop operating by 6pm.  /web/20210303160558/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uganda/coronavirus

name: Ukraine
notes_H1: The Ukrainian Government has created a special information page with all relevant information in addition to daily briefings by the chief medical officer and government officials: https://web.archive.org/web/20200414005009/https://covid19.gov.ua/en
notes_H3: On 7 May the Parliament passed a law providing for large scale free obligatory testing of those who have symptoms, have been in contact with infected patients or are in at-risk groups (e.g. medical workers, police).     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200608203532/https://www.oecd.org/eurasia/competitiveness-programme/eastern-partners/COVID-19-CRISIS-IN-UKRAINE.pdf
notes_H2: Note: COVID-19 tests are widely available at the expense of the individual. Average cost of a PCR test is 60 USD. See: https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ [web archive unavailable, accessed 28th September 2020]
notes_C7: From February 26, a red level of epidemic danger will be introduced in Ivano-Frankivsk region while restrictive measures will be intensified. At the red level, it is envisaged to introduce strict quarantine restrictions that were in force during the January lockdown. Including:  The activities of catering establishments will be prohibited (except for targeted delivery and takeaway service);  The work of shopping malls and other entertainment establishments – cinemas, theaters, etc. is prohibited.  Educational institutions will not work (except kindergartens and elementary schools);  Non-food markets and shops, gyms, swimming pools and fitness centers will be closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210227181512/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/premyer-ministr-rishennya-komisiyi-teb-ta-ns-maye-ne-dopustiti-podalshogo-poshirennya-covid-19-v-ivano-frankivskij-oblasti  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227182431/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/tag/ohorona-zdorovya  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227180512/https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: At midnight on January 25, the intensified quarantine restrictions, which lasted from January 8, ceased to apply in Ukraine. From now and till February 28 inclusive, the country returned to the anti-epidemic rules in force in December 2020. Returning to adaptive quarantine may be considered based on the epidemiological situation.   What is prohibited:   - Visiting educational institutions by groups of more than 20 people, except for preschool, general secondary, out-of-school and specialized art education institutions.   - Visiting educational institutions when more than 50% of students and staff of the educational institution are in self-isolation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210201235758/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/maksim-stepanov-ukraina-povernulasja-do-karantinnih-obmezhen-jaki-dijali-v-grudni  (link corrected on 16 February 2021)    https://web.archive.org/web/20210125213141/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/operativna-informacija-pro-poshirennja-koronavirusnoi-infekcii-2019-cov19
notes_H6: "When in public buildings, and while travelling on public transport and in taxis, you must wear a protective mask covering your nose and mouth."    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210104212108/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ukraine/coronavirus    Restricted: "stay in public buildings and structures, public transport without wearing personal protective equipment, including respirators or protective masks that cover the nose and mouth, including self-made" [machine translation from Ukranian].    NB The English language version of this document on the https://www.kmu.gov.ua/ website shortens this directive to "Staying in transport and public places without a mask"    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201216120435/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/npas/pro-vstanovlennya-karantinu-ta-zaprovadzhennya-obmezhuvalnih-protiepidemichnih-zahodiv-1236-091220
notes_E2: The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine adopted Resolution No. 247 “On the Provision of Housing Subsidies”, which provided for simplification of the procedure for granting housing subsidies and introduced additional compensation for utility costs. This decision significantly strengthens the program of housing subsidies and social support for the least protected categories of citizens:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200817102229/https://cis-legislation.com/document.fwx?rgn=123781
notes_E1: The amount of payments for persons receiving the minimum unemployment benefit without taking into account wages and length of service has been raised from UAH 650 to UAH 1,000 for the quarantine period. The Decree applies from the beginning of the quarantine announcement, ie from March 12, and will be valid for 30 calendar days after the quarantine ends: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430222447/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/news/minimalnu-dopomogu-po-bezrobittyu-pidvishcheno-z-650-grn-do-1000-grn-minekonomiki
notes_C3: From February 26, a red level of epidemic danger will be introduced in Ivano-Frankivsk region while restrictive measures will be intensified. At the red level, it is envisaged to introduce strict quarantine restrictions that were in force during the January lockdown. Including:  The activities of catering establishments will be prohibited (except for targeted delivery and takeaway service);  The work of shopping malls and other entertainment establishments – cinemas, theaters, etc. is prohibited.  Educational institutions will not work (except kindergartens and elementary schools);  Non-food markets and shops, gyms, swimming pools and fitness centers will be closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210227181512/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/premyer-ministr-rishennya-komisiyi-teb-ta-ns-maye-ne-dopustiti-podalshogo-poshirennya-covid-19-v-ivano-frankivskij-oblasti  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227182431/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/tag/ohorona-zdorovya  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227180512/https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: President Zelenskyy stated in an address "I strongly recommend that all people stay home, except for the need to buy food or pharmaceuticals." This is a development from three days earlier in which only those over 60 were advised to stay home.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200407160742/https://www.president.gov.ua/en/news/zvernennya-glavi-derzhavi-shodo-protidiyi-koronavirusu-60181
notes_C8: On 29 September, the Ukraine opened its borders for international travel. Countries are divided into green and red categories. "Green" countries do not have to take any measures, whilst "red" countries can choose from the following three options: 1. Observation in specialized isolators;    2. 14 days self-isolation at the place of residence for persons who have agreed to undergo it using the "Diy Vdoma" mobile app;    3. Pass the COVID-19 test using the PCR method after crossing the state border.    Link: https://archive.fo/XBDLg
notes_C2: Code changed on 26 January 2021.  From 19 December 2020, new restrictions will apply throughout Ukraine.   Acc. to these new restrictions it is forbidden:  - Operation of public catering establishments from 22:00 to 7:00 (except for delivery of takeaway orders). Payment transactions are prohibited after 22:00. During the night of December 31– January 1 the work of restaurants and cafes will be allowed until 01:00.  - Carrying out mass events (performances, holiday concerts) in educational institutions with the participation of children from more than one group/class and in the presence of visitors.  - Carrying out festive events, banquets, master classes, public events in public catering establishments and entertainment facilities.  - Reception of visitors in museums, exhibitions, galleries if there are more than 1 visitor per 10m2.  - Conducting religious events indoors upon condition that there will be present more than 1 person per 5 square meters; religious events open-air not keeping the requirement of maintaining physical distance 1.5 meters between those present.    Further it is forbidden:  Staying in transport and public places without a mask, being outside without documents. • Unauthorized leave of the observation place. • Carrying out of mass cultural, sports, social, advertising and other actions in which more than 20 persons take part and not preserving physical distance 1.5 meters between participants (with some exceptions). • Operation of cinemas and cultural facilities with more than 50% occupancy per hall. • Carriage of more passengers in passenger transport than the number of seats (except metro). • Work of discos, night clubs and operation of public catering establishments with the organization of leisure. • Not abiding the demand to preserve a physical distance of 2 meters between the tables and to place a maximum number of 4 people at one table. • The work of business entities in which employees are not provided with masks, no markings are applied to the distance of 1.5 meters between customers, and visitors not properly wearing personal protective equipment. • Crossing the border for foreigners without an existing insurance policy (with some exceptions). • Activities of accommodation facilities (except hotels). • Visiting by a group of more than 20 persons of educational institutions, except for preschool, general secondary, out-of-school and specialized education institutions. • Visiting preschool, general secondary, out-of-school, sports and art education institutions when more than 50% of students and staff of the educational institution stay in self-isolation. • Carrying out planned hospitalization (with exceptions). • Operation of gyms, fitness centers and museums, if they allow more than 1 person per 20 m2. • Visiting places of temporary detention of persons, places of temporary stay of foreigners and stateless persons, accommodation places for refugees. • Crossing the checkpoints with the temporarily occupied territories of separate areas of Donetsk and Luhansk regions (ORDLO) and Crimea by foreigners without an existing insurance policy (with some exceptions). • Visits to social protection institutions with the stay of persons of certain categories (persons of senior age, war veterans, people with disabilities, mental disorders, etc.).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201220102241/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/uryadom-zaprovadzheno-perelik-karantinnih-obmezhen-yaki-diyatimut-z-19-grudnya-2020-roku-na-vsij-teritoriyi-ukrayini

name: Uruguay
notes_H1: Website with al relevant information on coronavirus and what the government is doing:  /web/20200430214429/https://www.gub.uy/sistema-nacional-emergencias/comunicacion/noticias/informacion-interes-actualizada-sobre-coronavirus-covid-19-uruguay
notes_H3: The Ministry of Public Health announced it would trace individuals coming from high risk areas. https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html (Archived version: https://web.archive.org/web/20200417034706/https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html)
notes_H2: Recoded from 1, as testing has actually been incredibly strong.     "Testing is so aggressive that Uruguay is fourth worldwide after New Zealand, Australia and Thailand in the number of tests conducted per new confirmed case. Uruguay conducts 1,610 tests per new case. By comparison, the US and UK conduct only 52 and 21 tests respectively."     "Instead of seeking out only the contacts of confirmed cases, Uruguay sends out special teams to test random city blocks and critical job sectors such as construction workers, carrying out more than 57,000 tests so far – approximately 1.6% of its population of 3.5 million."     https://web.archive.org/web/20200806112817/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jun/25/uruguay-and-paraguay-buck-latin-america-coronavirus-trend
notes_C7: No restrictions on intercity or interstate travel currently in place.  source:  https://archive.vn/OGM43#selection-2685.109-2685.317
notes_C1: Updating indicator as The University of the Republic (Uruguay's only public university) is requiring remote learning for the Spring 2021 semester.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201127132925/https://coronavirus.udelar.edu.uy/
notes_H6: Mandatory for users and staff to wear a face covering on public transport, along with other safety measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200831120003/https://www.impo.com.uy/bases/resoluciones-mtop/SN20200603001-20200
notes_E2: - The government has postponed maturities of tax payments and credit programs.  - VAT payments have been deferred to be paid in 6 installments without interest.  - Social Security Bank loan quotas for retirees and pensioners have been deferred   /web/20200430214936/https://www.gub.uy/medidas-emergencia-sanitaria
notes_E1: Reinstating former indicator value based on the following statement:    UTE extends, by decision of 4 February 2021, the benefits granted by the pandemic, until 31 March this year. (5/2/2021)    https://archive.vn/pCasz  https://archive.vn/NT6MS
notes_C3: "This Wednesday government authorities announced at a press conference the decision to apply sanctions, according to the powers granted by current regulations for pandemic contexts, such as fines, closures and criminal complaints to those who violate health provisions.    In recent weeks, several unauthorized mass parties have been detected, which the government considers are the greatest risk ahead and put the transitory health status of the country at risk, stressed the Secretary of the Presidency, Álvaro Delgado.    “The Executive Power through the Ministry of Public Health and according to the legal mandate of the Organic Law of Public Health must adopt, immediately, before the violation of the sanitary provisions, all the measures at its disposal to keep the country harmless or reduce the risks of the effects of the pandemic ”, explained the prosecutor Rodrigo Ferrés.    The fines may range from 37 thousand pesos to one million three hundred thousand. The Executive Power may close establishments and file police and prosecutorial complaints in cases of contempt.    The Minister of Health, Daniel Salinas, explained why the risk of a massive adult party is different than that of a children's party protocolized by the Ministry and other activities that have been devised opening in recent times, such as restaurants, hotels, some shows, and also the Rural del Prado."    (Since not all shows have been authorized I have coded this indicator as 2G)    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201018230001/https://radiouruguay.uy/fiestas-no-autorizadas-se-aplicaran-multas-sanciones-y-denuncias-penales/
notes_C6: According to the government news, the president said that the Government "defends tooth and nail" not to establish a mandatory confinement of the population. "The 'stay at home' is worn out, everyone knows what they can do," said Lacalle Pou. "If people can stay at home, let them stay, but it is not mandatory," which indicates recommended but not required stay-at-home measure.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid
notes_C8: From December 21 to January 10, 2021, border will be closed, entry to the country will be suspended, except for Uruguayans who have purchased their ticket on December 16, and the transport of cargo.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221025342/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/larranaga-garcia-torre-ejecutiva-conferencia  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid   http://web.archive.org/web/20201229065720/https://uy.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20201020201228/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-exterior-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_C2: Changing value to 2G (at least for 2 Dec to 18 Dec) the below * items noted 1 Dec 2020:    *Implementation of teleworking in public offices, between December 2 and 18, as long as the essential quality of the service is not compromised. (01/12/2020)    Private companies throughout the country are encouraged to implement the voluntary use of teleworking. (01/12/2020)    Between December 2 and 18, bars and restaurants must close their doors at 00.00. and in case of non-compliance they will receive financial sanctions. (01/12/2020)     *Suspension of sports activities in gyms and closed places between December 2 and 18. (01/12/2020)    https://web.archive.org/web/20201214214141/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-trabajo-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202223646/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido    https://web.archive.org/web/20201215000942/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-deporte-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido
notes_C4: A battery of strict measures to prevent an increase in COVID-19 infections take effect on December 21, including “private meetings may not exceed ten people”.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid  http://web.archive.org/web/20201228231706/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-Sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_H7: A - Chinese CoronaVac    Uruguay, the last country in South America to receive delivery of coronavirus vaccines, started its inoculation campaign Monday with a focus on teachers, soldiers, police and firefighters. Some 90 vaccination centers countrywide opened their doors to give a first dose of the Chinese CoronaVac shot to some 140,000 essential workers.    https://archive.vn/iDGnj
notes_C5: Public transportation is open with masks and social distancing measures. To prevent the spread of COVID-19, the measure of limiting passenger capacity in interdepartmental transport units to 50% began to take effect from December 21 through January 10, 2021.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064206/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/mtop-transporte-distancia-olaizola-protocolo  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064449/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-transporte-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19

name: United States
notes_H1: The President's Coronavirus Guidelines for America https://web.archive.org/web/20200322010504/https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/03.16.20_coronavirus-guidance_8.5x11_315PM.pdf
notes_H3: "Contact tracing was used in Seattle and parts of California early on in their coronavirus outbreaks, but as community spread took hold, many cities and states switched to a "mitigation" approach, like closing schools and other social distancing measures." https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010434/https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/04/10/831200054/cdc-director-very-aggressive-contact-tracing-needed-for-u-s-to-return-to-normal
notes_H2: First drive-through testing site introduced in New York    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19
notes_C7: State by state variation, California starts on 19/03, then others follow  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/03/emergencies-closures-states-handling-coronavirus-200317213356419.html  --------- Financial Times from 23/03/20 -----------    	Please use the sharing tools found via the share button at the top or side of articles. Copying articles to share with others is a breach of FT.com T&Cs and Copyright Policy. Email licensing@ft.com to buy additional rights. Subscribers may share up to 10 or 20 articles per month using the gift article service. More information can be found at https://www.ft.com/tour.  	https://www.ft.com/content/f96ada9f-bd2a-39a7-8b59-c4170f5a1101    	Peter Wells MAR 23, 22:46  More than 42% of the US now under 'stay at home' orders    New Mexico has become the latest state to issue a stay at home order, bringing the proportion of the US population under lockdown now and in coming days to more than 40 per cent.    The order from the southwestern state, which comes into effect at 8am on March 24, means the number of US states ordering residents to stay at their residences more than doubled on Monday to 15. Indiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, Ohio, Oregon, West Virginia and Wisconsin made such announcements earlier in the day.    The 15 states where those orders are effective or about to come into effect cover just over 42 per cent of the population in the 50 states and District of Columbia.    The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in the US has soared to more than 41,000 as of Monday, 579 of whom have died, according to John Hopkins University. That is more cases than any country after China and Italy, and the number of people who test positive is expected to continue to rise rapidly as the US ramps up the ability to test people with symptoms.    New York is the hardest-hit state, with the number of confirmed cases rising by 5,707 in the past 24 hours, Governor Andrew Cuomo announced on Monday, bringing the total number of cases to 20,875.    Some individual cities and counties have issued stay at home orders, even though the states have not. As such, the proportion of the population affected by those restrictions probably exceeds 42 per cent.    Texas, the US's second most-populous state, does not have a stay at home order in place, but local media reported the capital, Austin, was expected to take this route tomorrow, following in the footsteps of Dallas and Waco.  https://www.ft.com/content/f96ada9f-bd2a-39a7-8b59-c4170f5a1101
notes_C1: As of Feb. 3, five states, and the District of Columbia, have state-ordered partial closures in effect. Puerto Rico is still on full closure, however Puerto Rico is not state in the USA.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210209023204/https://www.edweek.org/leadership/map-where-are-schools-closed/2020/07
notes_H6: Governor Wolf in Pennsylvania:    Expanding on the business safety order signed by Secretary of Health Dr. Rachel Levine in April that requires the wearing of masks in businesses, Governor Tom Wolf today announced a new order signed by Dr. Levine that takes the mask-wearing directive one step further.    With this order, signed under Dr. Levine’s authority under the Disease Prevention and Control Act, masks must be worn whenever anyone leaves home. The order takes effect immediately.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200923054840/https://www.governor.pa.gov/newsroom/gov-wolf-sec-of-health-signs-expanded-mask-wearing-order/
notes_E2: CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, implemented targeted debt relief based on Federal jurisdiction (e.g. eviction freezes for federal housing programs, mortgage forbearance for federally-backed mortgages, etc.). Primary source (U.S. House of Representatives, Financial Services Committee, archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430040220/https://financialservices.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=406472    Debt/contract relief also implemented at state level (e.g. eviction freezes, rent increase freezes, utility bill late charge waivers, etc.), but case-specific and not captured in this coding scheme.
notes_E1: Unemployment insurance in the U.S. is state-specific, but overseen by the U.S. Dept. of Labor. On average, unemployment insurance replaces ~50% of lost wages for a finite period of time. The CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, boosted unemployment benefits by supplementing state benefits with $600 per week, and expanding eligibility to individuals that normally don't qualify for unemployment insurance (e.g. gig workers & independent contractors). Secondary source, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430034950/https://www.cbpp.org/research/economy/policy-basics-unemployment-insurance    The CARES Act also established a low-interest, forgivable loan program for small businesses to help keep employees on payroll. Primary source, U.S. Small Business Administration, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430035544/https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/coronavirus-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program
notes_C3: Statewise-changes and dates are listed in website: https://archive.vn/6NqU4  Oregon: No gatherings of more than 250 people in Oregon for 4 weeks, Gov. Kate Brown says Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200502095403/https://www.oregonlive.com/coronavirus/2020/03/no-gatherings-of-250-or-more-people-in-oregon-for-4-weeks-gov-kate-brown-says.html Washington: Washington Gov. Jay Inslee said he’s banning gatherings of more than 250 people in several counties. Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200502095318/https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/11/washington-state-bans-large-events-to-contain-the-coronavirus-outbreak.html
notes_C6: As of March 4th, no generally applicable curfews are in force. In at least one state (South Dakota) the elderly and other vulnerable individuals are encouraged to stay at home.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308020436/https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html
notes_C8: As of March 2, foreign nationals who have travelled to Iran within the past 14 days are denied permission to enter the US.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200410104600/https://edition.cnn.com/travel/article/coronavirus-travel-restrictions/
notes_C2: Several states have rolled back restrictions on business after Thanksgiving holidays, so I’m changing the code to a 2T.     New Mexico transitioned from shutting down all essential businesses to a coding system whereby counties can reopen starting December 2.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201205192217/https://cv.nmhealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/120220-PHO.pdf     In Arizona, businesses can operate at a limited capacity if certain benchmarks are met.     In California, some businesses such as movie theaters and bars are closed. However, other industries such as retail stores can operate at 20% capacity.     In Georgia, gyms, hair salons and movies can operate, with restrictions.     In Idaho and Oregon, businesses can be open but are encouraged to telework when possible.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201205191446/https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html
notes_C4: Alabama, Idaho, Indiana, Missouri and South Dakota allow gatherings of any size, while other states have very strict measures in place. The most restrictive are New Mexico with max 5 people and Oregon with max 6 people from max 2 households.     Overview (last updated Nov 17): http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193939/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases  New Mexico: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123192402/https://cv.nmhealth.org/public-health-orders-and-executive-orders/frequently-asked-questions/  Oregon: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193338/https://govstatus.egov.com/OR-OHA-COVID-19
notes_H7: A, C:    On February 27th, Johnson & Johnson/Janssen Pharmaceuticals was granted an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) for its single-dose covid-19 vaccine. The first dose of this vaccine was administered in Columbus, Ohio on March 3rd.     In most of the country elderly groups are eligible for vaccination.
